member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IOMMU_DEVICE_CREATION_CONFIGURATION_TYPE.IommuDeviceCreationConfigTypeNone
member.summary: Default no type.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IOMMU_DEVICE_CREATION_CONFIGURATION_TYPE.IommuDeviceCreationConfigTypeAcpi
member.summary: Provides ACPI device specific parameters. This is currently used for ARM64 only.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IOMMU_DEVICE_CREATION_CONFIGURATION_TYPE.IommuDeviceCreationConfigTypeDeviceId
member.summary: Defines the IommuDeviceCreationConfigTypeDeviceId constant.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IOMMU_DEVICE_CREATION_CONFIGURATION_TYPE.IommuDeviceCreationConfigTypeMax
member.summary: Invalid type.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IOMMU_DMA_DOMAIN_TYPE
member.summary: Describes the domain types that can be created and interacted with via the DMA_IOMMU_INTERFACE_EX. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-iommu_dma_domain_type

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IOMMU_DMA_DOMAIN_TYPE.DomainTypeTranslate
member.summary: The standard remapping domain. The HAL/Hypervisor will create a domain structure and page table for holding logical address mappings.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IOMMU_DMA_DOMAIN_TYPE.DomainTypePassThrough
member.summary: Represents a passthrough domain. Calls to map and unmap are not necessary. Depending on the DMAGuard policy of the machine, this domain may not be available.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IOMMU_DMA_DOMAIN_TYPE.DomainTypeUnmanaged
member.summary: This is a remapping domain in which the page table is owned by the caller. The caller is responsible for interacting with the IOMMU Interface to provide its page table as well as performing necessary IOMMU TLB flushes.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IOMMU_DMA_DOMAIN_TYPE.DomainTypeMax
member.summary: Invalid domain type.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IOMMU_DMA_LOGICAL_ALLOCATOR_TYPE
member.summary: The IOMMU_DMA_LOGICAL_ALLOCATOR_TYPE enum indicates the type of logical allocator described in an IOMMU_DMA_LOGICAL_ALLOCATOR_CONFIG structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-iommu_dma_logical_allocator_type

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IOMMU_DMA_LOGICAL_ALLOCATOR_TYPE.IommuDmaLogicalAllocatorNone
member.summary: The logical allocator configuration does not describe any logical allocator type.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IOMMU_DMA_LOGICAL_ALLOCATOR_TYPE.IommuDmaLogicalAllocatorBuddy
member.summary: The logical allocator configuration describes the system's Buddy Allocator.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IOMMU_DMA_LOGICAL_ALLOCATOR_TYPE.IommuDmaLogicalAllocatorMax
member.summary: Invalid logical allocator type.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IOMMU_MAP_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS_TYPE
member.summary: The IOMMU_MAP_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS_TYPE enum indicates the format of the physical address described in an IOMMU_MAP_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-iommu_map_physical_address_type

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IOMMU_MAP_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS_TYPE.MapPhysicalAddressTypeMdl
member.summary: The physical address to be mapped is described by a MDL.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IOMMU_MAP_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS_TYPE.MapPhysicalAddressTypeContiguousRange
member.summary: The physical address to be mapped is physically contiguous and is described by a base and size.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IOMMU_MAP_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS_TYPE.MapPhysicalAddressTypePfn
member.summary: The physical address is described by a PFN array.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IOMMU_MAP_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS_TYPE.MapPhysicalAddressTypeMax
member.summary: Invalid physical address format.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_ACCESS_MODE
member.summary: Defines the types of access mode for Scheduled File I/O (SFIO). https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-_io_access_mode

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_ACCESS_MODE.SequentialAccess
member.summary: Indicates that the input/output will be sent down in a sequential order.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_ACCESS_MODE.RandomAccess
member.summary: Indicates that the input/output might not be in a predictable order.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_ACCESS_TYPE
member.summary: Defines the access rights for Scheduled File I/O (SFIO). https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-_io_access_type

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_ACCESS_TYPE.ReadAccess
member.summary: Indicates that the input/output will be comprised solely of reads.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_ACCESS_TYPE.WriteAccess
member.summary: Indicates that the input/output will be comprised solely of writes.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_ACCESS_TYPE.ModifyAccess
member.summary: Indicates that the input/output will be comprised of reads and writes.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_ALLOCATION_ACTION
member.summary: The IO_ALLOCATION_ACTION enumerated type is used to specify return values for AdapterControl and ControllerControl routines. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-_io_allocation_action

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_ALLOCATION_ACTION.KeepObject
member.summary: Indicates that you want the driver to retain ownership of the adapter or controller object.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_ALLOCATION_ACTION.DeallocateObject
member.summary: Indicates that you do not want the driver to retain ownership of the adapter or controller object.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_ALLOCATION_ACTION.DeallocateObjectKeepRegisters
member.summary: For adapter objects only. Indicates that you do not want the driver to retain ownership of the adapter object, but you do want the driver to retain ownership of the allocated map registers.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_CONTAINER_INFORMATION_CLASS
member.summary: The IO_CONTAINER_INFORMATION_CLASS enumeration contains constants that indicate the classes of system information that a kernel-mode driver can request. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-_io_container_information_class

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_CONTAINER_INFORMATION_CLASS.IoSessionStateInformation
member.summary: Session state information. A driver uses this enumeration constant to request information about a user session.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_CONTAINER_INFORMATION_CLASS.IoMaxContainerInformationClass
member.summary: Specifies the maximum value in this enumeration type.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_CONTAINER_NOTIFICATION_CLASS
member.summary: The IO_CONTAINER_NOTIFICATION_CLASS enumeration contains constants that indicate the classes of events for which a kernel-mode driver can register to receive notifications. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-_io_container_notification_class

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_CONTAINER_NOTIFICATION_CLASS.IoSessionStateNotification
member.summary: Session state notifications. The driver uses this enumeration constant to request notifications about changes in the state of user sessions that the driver is interested in.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_CONTAINER_NOTIFICATION_CLASS.IoMaxContainerNotificationClass
member.summary: Specifies the maximum value in this enumeration type.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_NOTIFICATION_EVENT_CATEGORY
member.summary: Specifies the category of PnP event for which the callback routine is being registered. Used in IoRegisterPlugPlayNotification. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-io_notification_event_category

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_NOTIFICATION_EVENT_CATEGORY.EventCategoryReserved
member.summary: Reserved for system use.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_NOTIFICATION_EVENT_CATEGORY.EventCategoryHardwareProfileChange
member.summary: PnP events in this category include query-change (GUID_HWPROFILE_QUERY_CHANGE), change-complete (GUID_HWPROFILE_CHANGE_COMPLETE), and change-cancel (GUID_HWPROFILE_CHANGE_CANCELLED) of a hardware profile.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_NOTIFICATION_EVENT_CATEGORY.EventCategoryDeviceInterfaceChange
member.summary: PnP events in this category include the arrival (enabling) of a new instance of a device interface class (GUID_DEVICE_INTERFACE_ARRIVAL), or the removal (disabling) of an existing device interface instance (GUID_DEVICE_INTERFACE_REMOVAL).

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_NOTIFICATION_EVENT_CATEGORY.EventCategoryTargetDeviceChange
member.summary: PnP events in this category include events related to removing a device: the device's drivers received a query-remove IRP (GUID_TARGET_DEVICE_QUERY_REMOVE), the drivers completed a remove IRP (GUID_TARGET_DEVICE_REMOVE_COMPLETE), or the drivers received a cancel-remove IRP (GUID_TARGET_DEVICE_REMOVE_CANCELLED). This category is also used for custom notification events.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_NOTIFICATION_EVENT_CATEGORY.EventCategoryKernelSoftRestart
member.summary: Reserved for system use.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_PAGING_PRIORITY
member.summary: The IO_PAGING_PRIORITY enumeration describes the priority value for a paging I/O IRP. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-_io_paging_priority

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_PAGING_PRIORITY.IoPagingPriorityInvalid
member.summary: The IRP is not a paging I/O IRP.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_PAGING_PRIORITY.IoPagingPriorityNormal
member.summary: The associated IRP has a normal priority level for paging I/O.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_PAGING_PRIORITY.IoPagingPriorityHigh
member.summary: The associated IRP has a high priority level for paging I/O.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_PAGING_PRIORITY.IoPagingPriorityReserved1
member.summary: Reserved for system use.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_PAGING_PRIORITY.IoPagingPriorityReserved2
member.summary: Reserved for system use.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_PRIORITY_HINT
member.summary: The IO_PRIORITY_HINT enumeration type specifies the priority hint for an IRP. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-_io_priority_hint

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_PRIORITY_HINT.IoPriorityVeryLow
member.summary: Specifies the lowest possible priority hint level. The system uses this value for background I/O operations.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_PRIORITY_HINT.IoPriorityLow
member.summary: Specifies a low-priority hint level.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_PRIORITY_HINT.IoPriorityNormal
member.summary: Specifies a normal-priority hint level. This value is the default setting for an IRP.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_PRIORITY_HINT.IoPriorityHigh
member.summary: Specifies a high-priority hint level. This value is reserved for use by the system.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_PRIORITY_HINT.IoPriorityCritical
member.summary: Specifies the highest-priority hint level. This value is reserved for use by the system.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_PRIORITY_HINT.MaxIoPriorityTypes
member.summary: Marks the limit for priority hints. Any priority hint value must be less than MaxIoPriorityTypes.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_SESSION_STATE
member.summary: The IO_SESSION_STATE enumeration contains constants that indicate the current state of a user session. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-_io_session_state

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_SESSION_STATE.IoSessionStateCreated
member.summary: The session has been created.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_SESSION_STATE.IoSessionStateInitialized
member.summary: The session has been initialized but has not yet been created.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_SESSION_STATE.IoSessionStateConnected
member.summary: The session is connected but the user has not yet logged on.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_SESSION_STATE.IoSessionStateDisconnected
member.summary: The session has been disconnected.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_SESSION_STATE.IoSessionStateDisconnectedLoggedOn
member.summary: The session was disconnected while the user was logged on.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_SESSION_STATE.IoSessionStateLoggedOn
member.summary: The user is logged on to the session.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_SESSION_STATE.IoSessionStateLoggedOff
member.summary: The user has logged off of the session.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_SESSION_STATE.IoSessionStateTerminated
member.summary: The session has been terminated.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IO_SESSION_STATE.IoSessionStateMax
member.summary: Specifies the maximum value in this enumeration type.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IRQ_DEVICE_POLICY
member.summary: The IRQ_DEVICE_POLICY enumeration type indicates the policy the operating system can use to assign the interrupts from a device to different processors. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-_irq_device_policy

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IRQ_DEVICE_POLICY.IrqPolicyMachineDefault
member.summary: The device does not require any particular assignment of interrupts to processors.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IRQ_DEVICE_POLICY.IrqPolicyAllCloseProcessors
member.summary: The operating system should assign interrupts from the device to processors that are close to the device. On non-NUMA computers, the effect of this value is identical to that of IrqPolicyAllProcessorsInMachine.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IRQ_DEVICE_POLICY.IrqPolicyOneCloseProcessor
member.summary: The operating system should assign a single interrupt for the device to one processor that is close to the device. On non-NUMA computers, the operating system can assign the interrupt to any processor.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IRQ_DEVICE_POLICY.IrqPolicyAllProcessorsInMachine
member.summary: The operating system should assign interrupts from the device to all processors.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IRQ_DEVICE_POLICY.IrqPolicySpecifiedProcessors
member.summary: The operating system should assign interrupts from the device to a specific set of processors.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IRQ_DEVICE_POLICY.IrqPolicySpreadMessagesAcrossAllProcessors
member.summary: The operating system should assign different message-signaled interrupts to different processors, if possible.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IRQ_DEVICE_POLICY.IrqPolicyAllProcessorsInMachineWhenSteered
member.summary: Reserved for system use. Do not use in your driver.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IRQ_PRIORITY
member.summary: The IRQ_PRIORITY enumeration type indicates the priority the system should give to servicing a device's interrupts. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-_irq_priority

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IRQ_PRIORITY.IrqPriorityUndefined
member.summary: Specifies that the device does not require any particular priority for its interrupts.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IRQ_PRIORITY.IrqPriorityLow
member.summary: Specifies that the device's interrupts are of low priority. This setting is appropiate for devices that can tolerate higher-than-normal latency.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IRQ_PRIORITY.IrqPriorityNormal
member.summary: Specifies that the device's interrupts are of normal priority.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.IRQ_PRIORITY.IrqPriorityHigh
member.summary: Specifies that the device's interrupts are of high priority. This setting is appropriate for devices that require low latency.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KBUGCHECK_CALLBACK_REASON
member.summary: The KBUGCHECK_CALLBACK_REASON enumeration type specifies the situations in which a bug-check callback executes. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-_kbugcheck_callback_reason

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KBUGCHECK_CALLBACK_REASON.KbCallbackInvalid
member.summary: Reserved for system use. Do not use.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KBUGCHECK_CALLBACK_REASON.KbCallbackReserved1
member.summary: Reserved for system use. Do not use.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KBUGCHECK_CALLBACK_REASON.KbCallbackSecondaryDumpData
member.summary: The callback function provides data to append to the secondary data area of the crash dump file when the system issues a bug check. For more information about this type of callback, see Implementing a KbCallbackSecondaryDumpData Callback Routine.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KBUGCHECK_CALLBACK_REASON.KbCallbackDumpIo
member.summary: Specifies that the system should call the callback function each time it writes data to a crash dump file. Drivers for devices that monitor the system state can use this type of callback. For more information about this type of callback, see Implementing a KbCallbackDumpIo Callback Routine.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KBUGCHECK_CALLBACK_REASON.KbCallbackAddPages
member.summary: The callback function adds one or more pages of driver-specific data to the primary section of the crash dump file when the operating system issues a bug check. For more information about this type of callback, see Implementing a KbCallbackAddPages Callback Routine.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KBUGCHECK_CALLBACK_REASON.KbCallbackSecondaryMultiPartDumpData
member.summary: Specifies that the callback is executed to get the amount of data the driver wants to store in the dump file. This enumeration value is supported in Windows Server 2008 and later versions of Windows.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KBUGCHECK_CALLBACK_REASON.KbCallbackRemovePages
member.summary: The callback function removes one or more pages of driver-supplied data from the crash dump file. For more information, see KBUGCHECK_REMOVE_PAGES.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KBUGCHECK_CALLBACK_REASON.KbCallbackTriageDumpData
member.summary: Specifies that the callback is executed to add virtual memory ranges the driver wants to preserve in the carved minidump file. This enumeration value is supported starting in Windows 10, version 1809 and Windows Server 2019. For more information about this type of callback, see Implementing a KbCallbackTriageDumpData Callback Routine.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KBUGCHECK_CALLBACK_REASON.KbCallbackReserved2
member.summary: Reserved for system use. Do not use.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KBUGCHECK_DUMP_IO_TYPE
member.summary: The KBUGCHECK_DUMP_IO_TYPE enumeration type identifies the type of a section of data within a crash dump file. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-_kbugcheck_dump_io_type

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KBUGCHECK_DUMP_IO_TYPE.KbDumpIoInvalid
member.summary: Reserved for system use. Do not use.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KBUGCHECK_DUMP_IO_TYPE.KbDumpIoHeader
member.summary: Specifies that crash dump data is header information.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KBUGCHECK_DUMP_IO_TYPE.KbDumpIoBody
member.summary: Specifies that the crash dump data is part of the main body of the crash dump, such as the memory state at the time of the bug check.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KBUGCHECK_DUMP_IO_TYPE.KbDumpIoSecondaryData
member.summary: Specifies that the crash dump data is data returned by a KbCallbackSecondaryDumpData routine.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KBUGCHECK_DUMP_IO_TYPE.KbDumpIoComplete
member.summary: Specifies that the crash dump data has been completely written.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KB_ADD_PAGES_FLAGS
member.summary: flags that describe the add-page request. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_kbugcheck_add_pages

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KB_ADD_PAGES_FLAGS.KB_ADD_PAGES_FLAG_VIRTUAL_ADDRESS
member.summary: Indicates that the Address member contains a virtual address.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KB_ADD_PAGES_FLAGS.KB_ADD_PAGES_FLAG_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS
member.summary: Indicates that the Address member contains a physical address.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KB_ADD_PAGES_FLAGS.KB_ADD_PAGES_FLAG_ADDITIONAL_RANGES_EXIST
member.summary: Indicates that the callback routine requests that it be called again so that it can add more pages.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KERB_CERTIFICATE_INFO_TYPE
member.summary: The KERB_CERTIFICATE_INFO_TYPE enumeration specifies the type of certificate information that is provided. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/ntsecapi/ne-ntsecapi-kerb_certificate_info_type

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KERB_CERTIFICATE_INFO_TYPE.CertHashInfo
member.summary: Identifies certificate hash information as defined by the KERB_CERTIFICATE_HASHINFO structure.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KERB_LOGON_SUBMIT_TYPE
member.summary: The KERB_LOGON_SUBMIT_TYPE enumeration identifies the type of logon being requested. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/ntsecapi/ne-ntsecapi-kerb_logon_submit_type

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KERB_LOGON_SUBMIT_TYPE.KerbInteractiveLogon
member.summary: Perform an interactive logon.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KERB_LOGON_SUBMIT_TYPE.KerbSmartCardLogon
member.summary: Logon using a smart card.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KERB_LOGON_SUBMIT_TYPE.KerbWorkstationUnlockLogon
member.summary: Unlock a workstation.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KERB_LOGON_SUBMIT_TYPE.KerbSmartCardUnlockLogon
member.summary: Unlock a workstation using a smart card.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KERB_LOGON_SUBMIT_TYPE.KerbProxyLogon
member.summary: Logon using a proxy server.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KERB_LOGON_SUBMIT_TYPE.KerbTicketLogon

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KERB_LOGON_SUBMIT_TYPE.KerbTicketUnlockLogon
member.summary: Unlock a workstation by using a Kerberos ticket.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KERB_LOGON_SUBMIT_TYPE.KerbS4ULogon

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KERB_LOGON_SUBMIT_TYPE.KerbCertificateLogon
member.summary: Logon interactively using a certificate stored on a smart card.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KERB_LOGON_SUBMIT_TYPE.KerbCertificateS4ULogon
member.summary: Perform a service for user logon using a certificate stored on a smart card.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KERB_LOGON_SUBMIT_TYPE.KerbCertificateUnlockLogon
member.summary: Unlock a workstation using a certificate stored on a smart card.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KERB_PROFILE_BUFFER_TYPE
member.summary: The KERB_PROFILE_BUFFER_TYPE enumeration lists the type of logon profile returned. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/ntsecapi/ne-ntsecapi-kerb_profile_buffer_type

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KERB_PROFILE_BUFFER_TYPE.KerbInteractiveProfile
member.summary: The buffer contains information about an interactive logon session.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KERB_PROFILE_BUFFER_TYPE.KerbTicketProfile
member.summary: The buffer contains information about a Kerberos logon session.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KERB_PROTOCOL_MESSAGE_TYPE
member.summary: The KERB_PROTOCOL_MESSAGE_TYPE enumeration lists the types of messages that can be sent to the Kerberos authentication package by calling the LsaCallAuthenticationPackage function. Each message corresponds to a dispatch routine and causes the Kerberos authentication package to perform a different task. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/ntsecapi/ne-ntsecapi-kerb_protocol_message_type

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KEY_VALUE_INFORMATION_CLASS.KeyValueFullInformationAlign64

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KEY_VALUE_INFORMATION_CLASS.KeyValuePartialInformationAlign64

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KE_PROCESSOR_CHANGE_NOTIFY_STATE
member.summary: The state of the processor add operation. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_ke_processor_change_notify_context

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KE_PROCESSOR_CHANGE_NOTIFY_STATE.KeProcessorAddStartNotify
member.summary: The operating system is about to add the processor. At this state, a device driver that receives this notification can allocate any per-processor data structures and perform any other required tasks to prepare the driver for execution on the new processor.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KE_PROCESSOR_CHANGE_NOTIFY_STATE.KeProcessorAddCompleteNotify
member.summary: The operating system has successfully added the processor. At this state, a device driver that receives this notification can start scheduling threads on the new processor.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KE_PROCESSOR_CHANGE_NOTIFY_STATE.KeProcessorAddFailureNotify
member.summary: The operating system failed to add the processor. If a device driver receives this notification, it should free any per-processor data structures that it allocated for the new processor when it received the KeProcessorAddStartNotify notification.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KINTERRUPT_MODE
member.summary: The KINTERRUPT_MODE enumeration type indicates whether an interrupt is level-triggered or edge-triggered. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-_kinterrupt_mode

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KINTERRUPT_MODE.LevelSensitive
member.summary: The interrupt is level-triggered. This is the mode for traditional PCI line-based interrupts.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KINTERRUPT_MODE.Latched
member.summary: The interrupt is edge-triggered. This is the mode for PCI message-signaled interrupts.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KINTERRUPT_POLARITY
member.summary: The KINTERRUPT_POLARITY enumeration indicates how a device signals an interrupt request on an interrupt line. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-_kinterrupt_polarity

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KINTERRUPT_POLARITY.InterruptPolarityUnknown
member.summary: The interrupt polarity is unknown.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KINTERRUPT_POLARITY.InterruptActiveHigh
member.summary: Active-high interrupt. The interrupt input type is level-triggered, and an interrupt request is indicated by a high signal level on the interrupt line. The request remains active as long as the line remains high.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KINTERRUPT_POLARITY.InterruptRisingEdge
member.summary: Rising-edge-triggered interrupt. The interrupt input type is edge-triggered, and an interrupt request is indicated by a low-to-high transition on the interrupt line.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KINTERRUPT_POLARITY.InterruptActiveLow
member.summary: Active-low interrupt. The interrupt input type is level-triggered, and an interrupt request is indicated by a low signal level on the interrupt line. The request remains active as long as the line remains low.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KINTERRUPT_POLARITY.InterruptFallingEdge
member.summary: Falling-edge-triggered interrupt. The interrupt input type is edge-triggered, and an interrupt request is indicated by a high-to-low transition on the interrupt line.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KINTERRUPT_POLARITY.InterruptActiveBoth
member.summary: Active-both interrupt. The interrupt input type is edge-triggered, and an interrupt request is indicated by a low-to-high or a high-to-low transition on the interrupt line. After a low-to-high transition signals an interrupt request, the interrupt line remains high until a high-to-low transition signals the next interrupt request. Similarly, after a high-to-low transition signals an interrupt request, the interrupt line remains low until a low-to-high transition signals the next interrupt request.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KINTERRUPT_POLARITY.InterruptActiveBothTriggerLow
member.summary: Reserved for use by the operating system.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.KINTERRUPT_POLARITY.InterruptActiveBothTriggerHigh
member.summary: Reserved for use by the operating system.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.LoadLibrarySetDirectoriesFlags.LOAD_LIBRARY_SEARCH_APPLICATION_DIR
member.summary: If this value is used, the application's installation directory is searched.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.LoadLibrarySetDirectoriesFlags.LOAD_LIBRARY_SEARCH_DEFAULT_DIRS
member.summary: This value is a combination of LOAD_LIBRARY_SEARCH_APPLICATION_DIR, LOAD_LIBRARY_SEARCH_SYSTEM32, and LOAD_LIBRARY_SEARCH_USER_DIRS. This value represents the recommended maximum number of directories an application should include in its DLL search path.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.LoadLibrarySetDirectoriesFlags.LOAD_LIBRARY_SEARCH_SYSTEM32
member.summary: If this value is used, %windows%\system32 is searched.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.LoadLibrarySetDirectoriesFlags.LOAD_LIBRARY_SEARCH_USER_DIRS
member.summary: If this value is used, any path explicitly added using the AddDllDirectory or SetDllDirectory function is searched. If more than one directory has been added, the order in which those directories are searched is unspecified.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.LOAD_LIBRARY_FLAGS.DONT_RESOLVE_DLL_REFERENCES
member.summary:
If this value is used, and the executable module is a DLL, the system does not call DllMain for process and thread initialization and termination. Also, the system does not load additional executable modules that are referenced by the specified module.
Note Do not use this value; it is provided only for backward compatibility. If you are planning to access only data or resources in the DLL, use LOAD_LIBRARY_AS_DATAFILE_EXCLUSIVE or LOAD_LIBRARY_AS_IMAGE_RESOURCE or both. Otherwise, load the library as a DLL or executable module using the LoadLibrary function.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.LOAD_LIBRARY_FLAGS.LOAD_IGNORE_CODE_AUTHZ_LEVEL
member.summary:
If this value is used, the system does not check AppLocker rules or apply Software Restriction Policies for the DLL. This action applies only to the DLL being loaded and not to its dependencies. This value is recommended for use in setup programs that must run extracted DLLs during installation.
Windows Server 2008 R2 and Windows 7: On systems with KB2532445 installed, the caller must be running as "LocalSystem" or "TrustedInstaller"; otherwise the system ignores this flag. For more information, see "You can circumvent AppLocker rules by using an Office macro on a computer that is running Windows 7 or Windows Server 2008 R2" in the Help and Support Knowledge Base at https://support.microsoft.com/kb/2532445.
Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: AppLocker was introduced in Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.LOAD_LIBRARY_FLAGS.LOAD_LIBRARY_AS_DATAFILE
member.summary:
If this value is used, the system maps the file into the calling process's virtual address space as if it were a data file. Nothing is done to execute or prepare to execute the mapped file. Therefore, you cannot call functions like GetModuleFileName, GetModuleHandle or GetProcAddress with this DLL. Using this value causes writes to read-only memory to raise an access violation. Use this flag when you want to load a DLL only to extract messages or resources from it.
This value can be used with LOAD_LIBRARY_AS_IMAGE_RESOURCE. For more information, see Remarks.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.LOAD_LIBRARY_FLAGS.LOAD_LIBRARY_AS_DATAFILE_EXCLUSIVE
member.summary:
Similar to LOAD_LIBRARY_AS_DATAFILE, except that the DLL file is opened with exclusive write access for the calling process. Other processes cannot open the DLL file for write access while it is in use. However, the DLL can still be opened by other processes.
This value can be used with LOAD_LIBRARY_AS_IMAGE_RESOURCE. For more information, see Remarks.
Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not supported until Windows Vista.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.LOAD_LIBRARY_FLAGS.LOAD_LIBRARY_AS_IMAGE_RESOURCE
member.summary:
If this value is used, the system maps the file into the process's virtual address space as an image file. However, the loader does not load the static imports or perform the other usual initialization steps. Use this flag when you want to load a DLL only to extract messages or resources from it. Unless the application depends on the file having the in-memory layout of an image, this value should be used with either LOAD_LIBRARY_AS_DATAFILE_EXCLUSIVE or LOAD_LIBRARY_AS_DATAFILE.
Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not supported until Windows Vista.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.LOAD_LIBRARY_FLAGS.LOAD_LIBRARY_SEARCH_APPLICATION_DIR
member.summary:
If this value is used, the application's installation directory is searched for the DLL and its dependencies. Directories in the standard search path are not searched. This value cannot be combined with LOAD_WITH_ALTERED_SEARCH_PATH.
Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Vista and Windows Server 2008: This value requires KB2533623 to be installed.
Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.LOAD_LIBRARY_FLAGS.LOAD_LIBRARY_SEARCH_DEFAULT_DIRS
member.summary:
This value is a combination of LOAD_LIBRARY_SEARCH_APPLICATION_DIR, LOAD_LIBRARY_SEARCH_SYSTEM32, and LOAD_LIBRARY_SEARCH_USER_DIRS. Directories in the standard search path are not searched. This value cannot be combined with LOAD_WITH_ALTERED_SEARCH_PATH.
This value represents the recommended maximum number of directories an application should include in its DLL search path.
Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Vista and Windows Server 2008: This value requires KB2533623 to be installed.
Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.LOAD_LIBRARY_FLAGS.LOAD_LIBRARY_SEARCH_DLL_LOAD_DIR
member.summary:
If this value is used, the directory that contains the DLL is temporarily added to the beginning of the list of directories that are searched for the DLL's dependencies. Directories in the standard search path are not searched.
The lpFileName parameter must specify a fully qualified path. This value cannot be combined with LOAD_WITH_ALTERED_SEARCH_PATH.
For example, if Lib2.dll is a dependency of C:\Dir1\Lib1.dll, loading Lib1.dll with this value causes the system to search for Lib2.dll only in C:\Dir1. To search for Lib2.dll in C:\Dir1 and all of the directories in the DLL search path, combine this value with LOAD_LIBRARY_SEARCH_DEFAULT_DIRS.
Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Vista and Windows Server 2008: This value requires KB2533623 to be installed.
Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.LOAD_LIBRARY_FLAGS.LOAD_LIBRARY_SEARCH_SYSTEM32
member.summary:
If this value is used, %windows%\system32 is searched for the DLL and its dependencies. Directories in the standard search path are not searched. This value cannot be combined with LOAD_WITH_ALTERED_SEARCH_PATH.
Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Vista and Windows Server 2008: This value requires KB2533623 to be installed.
Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.LOAD_LIBRARY_FLAGS.LOAD_LIBRARY_SEARCH_USER_DIRS
member.summary:
If this value is used, directories added using the AddDllDirectory or the SetDllDirectory function are searched for the DLL and its dependencies. If more than one directory has been added, the order in which the directories are searched is unspecified. Directories in the standard search path are not searched. This value cannot be combined with LOAD_WITH_ALTERED_SEARCH_PATH.
Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Vista and Windows Server 2008: This value requires KB2533623 to be installed.
Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.LOAD_LIBRARY_FLAGS.LOAD_WITH_ALTERED_SEARCH_PATH
member.summary:
If this value is used and lpFileName specifies an absolute path, the system uses the alternate file search strategy discussed in the Remarks section to find associated executable modules that the specified module causes to be loaded. If this value is used and lpFileName specifies a relative path, the behavior is undefined.
If this value is not used, or if lpFileName does not specify a path, the system uses the standard search strategy discussed in the Remarks section to find associated executable modules that the specified module causes to be loaded.
This value cannot be combined with any LOAD_LIBRARY_SEARCH flag.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.LOAD_LIBRARY_FLAGS.LOAD_LIBRARY_REQUIRE_SIGNED_TARGET
member.summary: Specifies that the digital signature of the binary image must be checked at load time. This value requires Windows 8.1, Windows 10 or later.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.LOAD_LIBRARY_FLAGS.LOAD_LIBRARY_SAFE_CURRENT_DIRS
member.summary: If this value is used, loading a DLL for execution from the current directory is only allowed if it is under a directory in the Safe load list.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.NTSTATUS
member.summary:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/kernel/using-ntstatus-values https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/kernel/defining-new-ntstatus-values https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/kernel/defining-custom-error-types 32 bits: Code 0-15 Facility 16-28 The Facility code specifies the facility that generated the error. C 29 The C bit specifies if the value is customer-defined or Microsoft-defined. Sev 30-31 The Sev field shown in the preceding diagram indicates the severity code STATUS_SEVERITY_SUCCESS Indicates a successful NTSTATUS value, such as STATUS_SUCCESS, or the value IO_ERR_RETRY_SUCCEEDED in error log packets. STATUS_SEVERITY_INFORMATIONAL Indicates an informational NTSTATUS value, such as STATUS_SERIAL_MORE_WRITES. STATUS_SEVERITY_WARNING Indicates a warning NTSTATUS value, such as STATUS_DEVICE_PAPER_EMPTY. STATUS_SEVERITY_ERROR Indicates an error NTSTATUS value, such as STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES for a FinalStatus value or IO_ERR_CONFIGURATION_ERROR for an ErrorCode value in error log packets.
NT_SUCCESS(Status) Evaluates to TRUE if the return value specified by Status is a success type (0 0x3FFFFFFF) or an informational type (0x40000000 0x7FFFFFFF). NT_INFORMATION(Status) Evaluates to TRUE if the return value specified by Status is an informational type (0x40000000 0x7FFFFFFF). NT_WARNING(Status) Evaluates to TRUE if the return value specified by Status is a warning type (0x80000000 0xBFFFFFFF). NT_ERROR(Status) Evaluates to TRUE if the return value specified by Status is an error type (0xC0000000 - 0xFFFFFFFF).

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.POOL_TYPE
member.summary: The POOL_TYPE enumeration type specifies the type of system memory to allocate. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-_pool_type

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.POOL_TYPE.NonPagedPool
member.summary:
Nonpaged pool, which is nonpageable system memory. Nonpaged pool can be accessed from any IRQL, but it is a scarce resource and drivers should allocate it only when necessary.
System memory allocated with the NonPagedPool pool type is executable. For more information, see the description of the NonPagedPoolExecute pool type.
Starting with Windows 8, drivers should allocate most or all of their nonpaged memory from the no-execute (NX) nonpaged pool instead of the executable nonpaged pool. For more information, see the description of the NonPagedPoolNx pool type.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.POOL_TYPE.NonPagedPoolExecute
member.summary: Starting with Windows 8, NonPagedPoolExecute is an alternate name for the NonPagedPool value. This value indicates that the allocated memory is to be nonpaged and executablethat is, instruction execution is enabled in this memory. To port a driver from an earlier version of Windows, you should typically replace all or most instances of the NonPagedPool name in the driver source code with NonPagedPoolNx. Avoid replacing instances of the NonPagedPool name with NonPagedPoolExecute except in cases in which executable memory is explicitly required. For more information, see No-Execute (NX) Nonpaged Pool.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.POOL_TYPE.NonPagedPoolMustSucceed
member.summary: This value is for internal use only, and is allowed only during system startup. Drivers must not specify this value at times other than system startup, because a "must succeed" request crashes the system if the requested memory size is unavailable.

member.summary: Reserved for system use.

member.summary: This value is for internal use only, and is allowed only during system startup. It is the cache-aligned equivalent of NonPagedPoolMustSucceed.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.POOL_TYPE.NonPagedPoolNx
member.summary:
No-execute (NX) nonpaged pool. This pool type is available starting with Windows 8. In contrast to the nonpaged pool designated by NonPagedPool, which allocates executable memory, the NX nonpaged pool allocates memory in which instruction execution is disabled. For more information, see No-Execute (NX) Nonpaged Pool.
Nonpaged pool can be accessed from any IRQL, but it is a scarce resource and drivers should allocate it only when necessary.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.POWER_ACTION.PowerActionShutdownReset
member.summary: The computer is entering its shutdown (S5) state. After all devices have entered their off (D3) state, the computer automatically powers off and then immediately restarts and returns to its working (S0) state.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.POWER_ACTION.PowerActionShutdownOff
member.summary: The computer is entering its shutdown (S5) state. After all devices have entered their off (D3) state, the computer automatically powers off.

member.summary: Notify the caller of changes to a value of the key. This can include adding or deleting a value, or changing an existing value.

member.summary: Notify the caller of changes to the security descriptor of the key.

member.summary: Indicates that the lifetime of the registration must not be tied to the lifetime of the thread issuing the RegNotifyChangeKeyValue call. Note This flag value is only supported in Windows 8 and later.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.RegRestoreFlags.REG_FORCE_RESTORE
member.summary: If specified, the restore operation is executed even if open handles exist at or beneath the location in the registry hierarchy to which the hKey parameter points.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.RegRestoreFlags.REG_WHOLE_HIVE_VOLATILE
member.summary: If specified, a new, volatile (memory only) set of registry information, or hive, is created.If REG_WHOLE_HIVE_VOLATILE is specified, the key identified by the hKey parameter must be either the HKEY_USERS or HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE value.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.REG_CREATEKEY_OPTIONS.REG_OPTION_BACKUP_RESTORE
member.summary: If this flag is set, the function ignores the samDesired parameter and attempts to open the key with the access required to backup or restore the key. If the calling thread has the SE_BACKUP_NAME privilege enabled, the key is opened with the ACCESS_SYSTEM_SECURITY and KEY_READ access rights. If the calling thread has the SE_RESTORE_NAME privilege enabled, beginning with Windows Vista, the key is opened with the ACCESS_SYSTEM_SECURITY, DELETE and KEY_WRITE access rights. If both privileges are enabled, the key has the combined access rights for both privileges.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.REG_CREATEKEY_OPTIONS.REG_OPTION_CREATE_LINK
member.summary: This key is a symbolic link. The target path is assigned to the L"SymbolicLinkValue" value of the key. The target path must be an absolute registry path.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.REG_CREATEKEY_OPTIONS.REG_OPTION_NON_VOLATILE
member.summary: This key is not volatile; this is the default. The information is stored in a file and is preserved when the system is restarted. The RegSaveKey function saves keys that are not volatile.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.REG_CREATEKEY_OPTIONS.REG_OPTION_VOLATILE
member.summary: All keys created by the function are volatile. The information is stored in memory and is not preserved when the corresponding registry hive is unloaded. For HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, this occurs only when the system initiates a full shutdown. For registry keys loaded by the RegLoadKey function, this occurs when the corresponding RegUnLoadKey is performed. The RegSaveKey function does not save volatile keys. This flag is ignored for keys that already exist.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.REG_KEY_TYPE
member.summary: Specifies the system-defined type for the value entry in the registry key https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_key_value_basic_information

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.REG_KEY_TYPE.REG_BINARY
member.summary: Binary data in any form

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.REG_SAVE_FLAGS.REG_STANDARD_FORMAT
member.summary: The key or hive is saved in standard format. The standard format is the only format supported by Windows 2000.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.REG_SAVE_FLAGS.REG_LATEST_FORMAT
member.summary: The key or hive is saved in the latest format. The latest format is supported starting with Windows XP. After the key or hive is saved in this format, it cannot be loaded on an earlier system.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.REG_SAVE_FLAGS.REG_NO_COMPRESSION
member.summary: The hive is saved with no compression, for faster save operations. The hKey parameter must specify the root of a hive under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE or HKEY_USERS. For example, HKLM\SOFTWARE is the root of a hive.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.RTS_CONTROL.RTS_CONTROL_DISABLE
member.summary: Disables the RTS line when the device is opened and leaves it disabled.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.RTS_CONTROL.RTS_CONTROL_ENABLE
member.summary: Enables the RTS line when the device is opened and leaves it on.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.RTS_CONTROL.RTS_CONTROL_HANDSHAKE
member.summary: Enables RTS handshaking. The driver raises the RTS line when the "type-ahead" (input) buffer is less than one-half full and lowers the RTS line when the buffer is more than three-quarters full. If handshaking is enabled, it is an error for the application to adjust the line by using the EscapeCommFunction function.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.RTS_CONTROL.RTS_CONTROL_TOGGLE
member.summary: Specifies that the RTS line will be high if bytes are available for transmission. After all buffered bytes have been sent, the RTS line will be low.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SECURITY_IMPERSONATION_LEVEL
member.summary: The SECURITY_IMPERSONATION_LEVEL enumeration contains values that specify security impersonation levels. Security impersonation levels govern the degree to which a server process can act on behalf of a client process. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ne-winnt-security_impersonation_level

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SECURITY_INFORMATION
member.summary: typedef ULONG SECURITY_INFORMATION, *PSECURITY_INFORMATION; A value of type SECURITY_INFORMATION is used to identify the object-related security information being set or queried. This security information includes: The owner of an object The primary group of an object The discretionary access-control list (DACL) of an object The system ACL (SACL) of an object Each item of security information is designated by a bit flag. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ifs/security-information https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-dtyp/cca27429-5689-4a16-b2b4-9325d93e4ba2

member.summary: The SACL of the object is being referenced.

The functions, such as GetSecurityInfo and SetSecurityInfo, that set and retrieve the security information of an object, use these values to indicate the type of object. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/accctrl/ne-accctrl-se_object_type

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SIGNAL_WAIT.WAIT_ABANDONED
member.summary: The specified object is a mutex object that was not released by the thread that owned the mutex object before the owning thread terminated. Ownership of the mutex object is granted to the calling thread, and the mutex is set to nonsignaled. If the mutex was protecting persistent state information, you should check it for consistency.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SIGNAL_WAIT.WAIT_IO_COMPLETION
member.summary: The wait was ended by one or more user-mode asynchronous procedure calls (APC) queued to the thread.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SIGNAL_WAIT.WAIT_OBJECT_0
member.summary: The state of the specified object is signaled.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SIGNAL_WAIT.WAIT_TIMEOUT
member.summary: The time-out interval elapsed, and the object's state is nonsignaled.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SIGNAL_WAIT.WAIT_FAILED
member.summary: The function has failed. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS
member.summary: The clipboard formats defined by the system are called standard clipboard formats. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/dataxchg/standard-clipboard-formats

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_BITMAP
member.summary: A handle to a bitmap (HBITMAP).

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_DIB
member.summary: A memory object containing a BITMAPINFO structure followed by the bitmap bits.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_DIBV5
member.summary: A memory object containing a BITMAPV5HEADER structure followed by the bitmap color space information and the bitmap bits.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_DIF
member.summary: Software Arts' Data Interchange Format.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_DSPBITMAP
member.summary: Bitmap display format associated with a private format.The hMem parameter must be a handle to data that can be displayed in bitmap format in lieu of the privately formatted data.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_DSPENHMETAFILE
member.summary: Enhanced metafile display format associated with a private format.The hMem parameter must be a handle to data that can be displayed in enhanced metafile format in lieu of the privately formatted data.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_DSPMETAFILEPICT
member.summary: Metafile-picture display format associated with a private format.The hMem parameter must be a handle to data that can be displayed in metafile-picture format in lieu of the privately formatted data.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_DSPTEXT
member.summary: Text display format associated with a private format.The hMem parameter must be a handle to data that can be displayed in text format in lieu of the privately formatted data.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_ENHMETAFILE
member.summary: A handle to an enhanced metafile (HENHMETAFILE).

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_GDIOBJFIRST
member.summary: Start of a range of integer values for application-defined GDI object clipboard formats.The end of the range is CF_GDIOBJLAST. Handles associated with clipboard formats in this range are not automatically deleted using the GlobalFree function when the clipboard is emptied.Also, when using values in this range, the hMem parameter is not a handle to a GDI object, but is a handle allocated by the GlobalAlloc function with the GMEM_MOVEABLE flag.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_GDIOBJLAST
member.summary: See CF_GDIOBJFIRST.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_HDROP
member.summary: A handle to type HDROP that identifies a list of files.An application can retrieve information about the files by passing the handle to the DragQueryFile function.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_LOCALE
member.summary: The data is a handle (HGLOBAL) to the locale identifier (LCID) associated with text in the clipboard. When you close the clipboard, if it contains CF_TEXT data but no CF_LOCALE data, the system automatically sets the CF_LOCALE format to the current input language. You can use the CF_LOCALE format to associate a different locale with the clipboard text. An application that pastes text from the clipboard can retrieve this format to determine which character set was used to generate the text. Note that the clipboard does not support plain text in multiple character sets.To achieve this, use a formatted text data type such as RTF instead. The system uses the code page associated with CF_LOCALE to implicitly convert from CF_TEXT to CF_UNICODETEXT. Therefore, the correct code page table is used for the conversion.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_METAFILEPICT
member.summary: Handle to a metafile picture format as defined by the METAFILEPICT structure.When passing a CF_METAFILEPICT handle by means of DDE, the application responsible for deleting hMem should also free the metafile referred to by the CF_METAFILEPICT handle.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_OEMTEXT
member.summary: Text format containing characters in the OEM character set. Each line ends with a carriage return/linefeed (CR-LF) combination. A null character signals the end of the data.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_OWNERDISPLAY
member.summary: Owner-display format. The clipboard owner must display and update the clipboard viewer window, and receive the WM_ASKCBFORMATNAME, WM_HSCROLLCLIPBOARD, WM_PAINTCLIPBOARD, WM_SIZECLIPBOARD, and WM_VSCROLLCLIPBOARD messages. The hMem parameter must be NULL.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_PALETTE
member.summary: Handle to a color palette. Whenever an application places data in the clipboard that depends on or assumes a color palette, it should place the palette on the clipboard as well. If the clipboard contains data in the CF_PALETTE (logical color palette) format, the application should use the SelectPalette and RealizePalette functions to realize (compare) any other data in the clipboard against that logical palette. When displaying clipboard data, the clipboard always uses as its current palette any object on the clipboard that is in the CF_PALETTE format.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_PENDATA
member.summary: Data for the pen extensions to the Microsoft Windows for Pen Computing.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_PRIVATEFIRST
F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_PRIVATELAST
member.summary: See CF_PRIVATEFIRST.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_RIFF
member.summary: Represents audio data more complex than can be represented in a CF_WAVE standard wave format.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_SYLK
member.summary: Microsoft Symbolic Link (SYLK) format.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_TEXT
member.summary: Text format. Each line ends with a carriage return/linefeed (CR-LF) combination.A null character signals the end of the data.Use this format for ANSI text.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_TIFF
member.summary: Tagged-image file format.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_UNICODETEXT
member.summary: Unicode text format.Each line ends with a carriage return/linefeed (CR-LF) combination. A null character signals the end of the data.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STANDARD_CLIPBOARD_FORMATS.CF_WAVE
member.summary: Represents audio data in one of the standard wave formats, such as 11 kHz or 22 kHz PCM.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STOPBITS
member.summary: The number of stop bits to be used. This member can be one of the following values.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STOPBITS.ONESTOPBIT
member.summary: 1 stop bit.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STOPBITS.ONE5STOPBITS
member.summary: 1.5 stop bits.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.STOPBITS.TWOSTOPBITS
member.summary: 2 stop bits.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SystemShutdownFlags
member.summary: One or more bit flags that specify options for the shutdown.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SystemShutdownFlags.SHUTDOWN_FORCE_OTHERS
member.summary: All sessions are forcefully logged off. If this flag is not set and users other than the current user are logged on to the computer specified by the lpMachineName parameter, this function fails with a return value of ERROR_SHUTDOWN_USERS_LOGGED_ON.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SystemShutdownFlags.SHUTDOWN_FORCE_SELF
member.summary: Specifies that the originating session is logged off forcefully. If this flag is not set, the originating session is shut down interactively, so a shutdown is not guaranteed even if the function returns successfully.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SystemShutdownFlags.SHUTDOWN_GRACE_OVERRIDE
member.summary: Overrides the grace period so that the computer is shut down immediately.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SystemShutdownFlags.SHUTDOWN_HYBRID
member.summary:
Beginning with InitiateShutdown running on Windows 8, you must include the SHUTDOWN_HYBRID flag with one or more of the flags in this table to specify options for the shutdown.
Beginning with Windows 8, InitiateShutdown always initiate a full system shutdown if the SHUTDOWN_HYBRID flag is absent.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SystemShutdownFlags.SHUTDOWN_INSTALL_UPDATES
member.summary: The computer installs any updates before starting the shutdown.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SystemShutdownFlags.SHUTDOWN_NOREBOOT
member.summary: The computer is shut down but is not powered down or rebooted.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SystemShutdownReasonCodes.SHTDN_REASON_FLAG_PLANNED
member.summary: The shutdown was planned. The system generates a System State Data (SSD) file. This file contains system state information such as the processes, threads, memory usage, and configuration. If this flag is not present, the shutdown was unplanned. Notification and reporting options are controlled by a set of policies. For example, after logging in, the system displays a dialog box reporting the unplanned shutdown if the policy has been enabled. An SSD file is created only if the SSD policy is enabled on the system. The administrator can use Windows Error Reporting to send the SSD data to a central location, or to Microsoft.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SYSTEM_POWER_STATE
member.summary: The SYSTEM_POWER_STATE enumeration type is used to indicate a system power state. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-_system_power_state

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SYSTEM_POWER_STATE.PowerSystemUnspecified
member.summary: Indicates an unspecified system power state.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SYSTEM_POWER_STATE.PowerSystemWorking
member.summary: Indicates maximum system power, which corresponds to system working state S0.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SYSTEM_POWER_STATE.PowerSystemSleeping1
member.summary: Indicates a system sleeping state less than PowerSystemWorking and greater than PowerSystemSleeping2, which corresponds to system power state S1.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SYSTEM_POWER_STATE.PowerSystemSleeping2
member.summary: Indicates a system sleeping state less than PowerSystemSleeping1 and greater than PowerSystemSleeping3, which corresponds to system power state S2.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SYSTEM_POWER_STATE.PowerSystemSleeping3
member.summary: Indicates a system sleeping state less than PowerSystemSleeping2 and greater than PowerSystemHibernate, which corresponds to system power state S3.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SYSTEM_POWER_STATE.PowerSystemHibernate
member.summary: Indicates the lowest-powered sleeping state, which corresponds to system power state S4.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SYSTEM_POWER_STATE.PowerSystemShutdown
member.summary: Indicates the system is turned off, which corresponds to system shutdown state S5.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.SYSTEM_POWER_STATE.PowerSystemMaximum
member.summary: The number of system power state values for this enumeration type that represents actual power states. This value is the number of elements in the DeviceState member of the DEVICE_CAPABILITIES structure for a device. The other system power state values are less than this value.

member.summary: The TOKEN_ELEVATION_TYPE enumeration indicates the elevation type of token being queried by the GetTokenInformation function. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ne-winnt-token_elevation_type

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS
member.summary: The TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS enumeration contains values that specify the type of information being assigned to or retrieved from an access token. The GetTokenInformation function uses these values to indicate the type of token information to retrieve. The SetTokenInformation function uses these values to set the token information. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ne-winnt-token_information_class

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.TOKEN_TYPE

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.TRANSACTION_OUTCOME
member.summary: The TRANSACTION_OUTCOME enumeration defines the outcomes (results) that KTM can assign to a transaction. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-_transaction_outcome

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.TRANSACTION_OUTCOME.TransactionOutcomeUndetermined
member.summary: The transaction has not yet been committed or rolled back.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.TRANSACTION_OUTCOME.TransactionOutcomeCommitted
member.summary: The transaction has been committed.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.TRANSACTION_OUTCOME.TransactionOutcomeAborted
member.summary: The transaction has been rolled back.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.TRANSACTION_STATE
member.summary: The TRANSACTION_STATE enumeration defines the states that KTM can assign to a transaction. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ne-wdm-_transaction_state

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.TRANSACTION_STATE.TransactionStateNormal
member.summary: The transaction's state is neither in doubt nor committed.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.TRANSACTION_STATE.TransactionStateIndoubt
member.summary: The transaction's state is in doubt (that is, KTM cannot determine whether the transaction should be committed or rolled back). A transaction that has been prepared enters the "in doubt" state if its superior transaction manager becomes unavailable.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.TRANSACTION_STATE.TransactionStateCommittedNotify
member.summary: The transaction has been committed. Commit notifications might (or might not) have been delivered to all enlistments.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.TRUSTED_INFORMATION_CLASS
member.summary: The TRUSTED_INFORMATION_CLASS enumeration type defines values that indicate the type of information to set or query for a trusted domain. Each value has an associated structure that the LsaQueryTrustedDomainInfo and LsaSetTrustedDomainInformation functions use to store the information. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/ntsecapi/ne-ntsecapi-trusted_information_class

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.USER_OBJECT_INDEX.UOI_FLAGS
member.summary: The handle flags. The pvInfo parameter must point to a USEROBJECTFLAGS structure.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.USER_OBJECT_INDEX.UOI_NAME
member.summary: The name of the object, as a string.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.USER_OBJECT_INDEX.UOI_TYPE
member.summary: The type name of the object, as a string.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.USER_OBJECT_INDEX.UOI_USER_SID
member.summary: The SID structure that identifies the user that is currently associated with the specified object. If no user is associated with the object, the value returned in the buffer pointed to by lpnLengthNeeded is zero. Note that SID is a variable length structure. You will usually make a call to GetUserObjectInformation to determine the length of the SID before retrieving its value.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.USER_OBJECT_INDEX.UOI_HEAPSIZE
member.summary: The size of the desktop heap, in KB, as a ULONG value. The hObj parameter must be a handle to a desktop object, otherwise, the function fails. Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP/2000: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.USER_OBJECT_INDEX.UOI_IO
member.summary: TRUE if the hObj parameter is a handle to the desktop object that is receiving input from the user. FALSE otherwise. Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP/2000: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.USER_OBJECT_INDEX.UOI_TIMERPROC_EXCEPTION_SUPPRESSION
member.summary: Sets the exception handling behavior when calling TimerProc. hObj must be the process handle returned by the GetCurrentProcess function. The pvInfo parameter must point to a BOOL. If TRUE, Windows will enclose its calls to TimerProc with an exception handler that consumes and discards all exceptions. This has been the default behavior since Windows 2000, although that may change in future versions of Windows. If pvInfo points to FALSE, Windows will not enclose its calls to TimerProc with an exception handler. A setting of FALSE is recommended. Otherwise, the application could behave unpredictably, and could be more vulnerable to security exploits.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.WELL_KNOWN_SID_TYPE
member.summary: The WELL_KNOWN_SID_TYPE enumeration is a list of commonly used security identifiers (SIDs). Programs can pass these values to the CreateWellKnownSid function to create a SID from this list. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ne-winnt-well_known_sid_type

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.WORK_QUEUE_TYPE.CriticalWorkQueue
member.summary: Indicates a real-time system worker thread. The assigned priority level is 13.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.WORK_QUEUE_TYPE.DelayedWorkQueue
member.summary: Indicates an ordinary worker thread. The assigned priority level is 12.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.WORK_QUEUE_TYPE.HyperCriticalWorkQueue
member.summary: System priority level. The assigned priority level is 15.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.WORK_QUEUE_TYPE.NormalWorkQueue
member.summary: System priority level. The assigned priority level is 8

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.WORK_QUEUE_TYPE.BackgroundWorkQueue
member.summary: System priority level. The assigned priority level is 7.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.WORK_QUEUE_TYPE.RealTimeWorkQueue
member.summary: System priority level. The assigned priority level is18.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.WORK_QUEUE_TYPE.SuperCriticalWorkQueue
member.summary: System priority level. The assigned priority level is 14.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.WORK_QUEUE_TYPE.MaximumWorkQueue
member.summary: System priority maximum. No priority level assigned.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Enums.WORK_QUEUE_TYPE.CustomPriorityWorkQueue
member.summary: The queue has a custom priority level assigned by the caller. The CustomPriorityWorkQueue value is the base priority level for the custom priority queue. Work items are queued at a particular priority by setting QueueType to CustomPriorityWorkQueue + Priority where Priority is the KPRIORITY value for the work item. This queue type is valid starting with Windows 8.1.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACCESS_ALLOWED_ACE
member.summary: The ACCESS_ALLOWED_ACE structure defines an access control entry (ACE) for the discretionary access control list (DACL) that controls access to an object. An access-allowed ACE allows access to an object for a specific trustee identified by a security identifier (SID). https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-access_allowed_ace

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACCESS_ALLOWED_CALLBACK_ACE
member.summary: The ACCESS_ALLOWED_CALLBACK_ACE structure defines an access control entry (ACE) for the discretionary access control list (DACL) that controls access to an object. An access-allowed ACE allows access to an object for a specific trustee identified by a security identifier(SID). https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-access_allowed_callback_ace

member.summary: The ACCESS_ALLOWED_CALLBACK_OBJECT_ACE structure defines an access control entry (ACE) that controls allowed access to an object, property set, or property. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-access_allowed_callback_object_ace

member.summary: The ACCESS_DENIED_CALLBACK_ACE structure defines an access control entry (ACE) for the discretionary access control list (DACL) that controls access to an object. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-access_denied_callback_ace

member.summary: The ACCESS_DENIED_OBJECT_ACE structure defines an access control entry (ACE) that controls denied access to an object, a property set, or property. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-access_denied_object_ace

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACE_HEADER
member.summary: The ACE_HEADER structure defines the type and size of an access control entry (ACE). https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-ace_header

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACE_HEADER.AceType
member.summary: An unsigned 8-bit integer that specifies the ACE types.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACE_HEADER.AceFlags
member.summary: An unsigned 8-bit integer that specifies a set of ACE type-specific control flags. This field can be a combination of the following values.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACE_HEADER.AceSize
member.summary: An unsigned 16-bit integer that specifies the size, in bytes, of the ACE. The AceSize field can be greater than the sum of the individual fields, but MUST be a multiple of 4 to ensure alignment on a DWORD boundary. In cases where the AceSize field encompasses additional data for the callback ACEs types, that data is implementation-specific. Otherwise, this additional data is not interpreted and MUST be ignored.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACL
member.summary: The ACL structure is the header of an access control list (ACL). A complete ACL consists of an ACL structure followed by an ordered list of zero or more access control entries (ACEs). https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-acl

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACL.AclRevision
member.summary: Specifies the revision level of the ACL. This value should be ACL_REVISION, unless the ACL contains an object-specific ACE, in which case this value must be ACL_REVISION_DS. All ACEs in an ACL must be at the same revision level.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACL.Sbz1
member.summary: Specifies a zero byte of padding that aligns the AclRevision member on a 16-bit boundary.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACL.AclSize
member.summary: Specifies the size, in bytes, of the ACL. This value includes both the ACL structure and all the ACEs.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACL.AceCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of ACEs stored in the ACL.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACL.Sbz2
member.summary: Specifies two zero-bytes of padding that align the ACL structure on a 32-bit boundary.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACL_REVISION_INFORMATION
member.summary: The ACL_REVISION_INFORMATION structure contains revision information about an ACL structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-acl_revision_information

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACL_SIZE_INFORMATION
member.summary: The ACL_SIZE_INFORMATION structure contains information about the size of an ACL structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-acl_size_information
