member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACTCTXA
member.summary: The ACTCTX structure is used by the CreateActCtx function to create the activation context.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACTCTXA.cbSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of this structure. This is used to determine the version of this structure.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACTCTXA.dwFlags
member.summary: Flags that indicate how the values included in this structure are to be used.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACTCTXA.lpSource
member.summary: Null-terminated string specifying the path of the manifest file or PE image to be used to create the activation context. If this path refers to an EXE or DLL file, the lpResourceName member is required.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACTCTXA.wProcessorArchitecture
member.summary: Identifies the type of processor used. Specifies the system's processor architecture.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACTCTXA.wLangId
member.summary: Specifies the language manifest that should be used. The default is the current user's current UI language. If the requested language cannot be found, an approximation is searched for using the following order: The current user's specific language. For example, for US English (1033). The current user's primary language. For example, for English (9). The current system's specific language. The current system's primary language. A nonspecific worldwide language.Language neutral (0).

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACTCTXA.lpAssemblyDirectory
member.summary: The base directory in which to perform private assembly probing if assemblies in the activation context are not present in the system-wide store.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACTCTXA.lpResourceName
member.summary: Pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the resource name to be loaded from the PE specified in hModule or lpSource. If the resource name is an integer, set this member using MAKEINTRESOURCE. This member is required if lpSource refers to an EXE or DLL.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACTCTXA.lpApplicationName
member.summary: The name of the current application. If the value of this member is set to null, the name of the executable that launched the current process is used.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ACTCTXA.hModule
member.summary: Use this member rather than lpSource if you have already loaded a DLL and wish to use it to create activation contexts rather than using a path in lpSource. See lpResourceName for the rules of looking up resources in this module.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.APP_MEMORY_INFORMATION.TotalCommitUsage

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.AUDIODESCRIPTION
member.summary: Contains information associated with audio descriptions. This structure is used with the SystemParametersInfo function when the SPI_GETAUDIODESCRIPTION or SPI_SETAUDIODESCRIPTION action value is specified. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-audiodescription

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.AUDIODESCRIPTION.cbSize
member.summary: The size of the structure, in bytes. The caller must set this member to sizeof(AUDIODESCRIPTION).

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.AUDIODESCRIPTION.Enabled
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, audio descriptions are enabled; Otherwise, this member is FALSE.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.AUDIODESCRIPTION.Locale
member.summary: The locale identifier (LCID) of the language for the audio description.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.AUDIT_POLICY_INFORMATION
member.summary: The AUDIT_POLICY_INFORMATION structure specifies a security event type and when to audit that type. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/ntsecapi/ns-ntsecapi-audit_policy_information

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.BLENDFUNCTION

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.BOOTDISK_INFORMATION

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.BOOTDISK_INFORMATION.BootPartitionOffset

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.BOOTDISK_INFORMATION.SystemPartitionOffset

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.BOOTDISK_INFORMATION.BootDeviceSignature
member.summary: If the boot disk is formatted with an MBR partition table, this specifies the signature for the disk's MBR partition table. Otherwise, this member is unused.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.BOOTDISK_INFORMATION.SystemDeviceSignature
member.summary: If the system disk is formatted with an MBR partition table, this specifies the signature for the disk's MBR partition table. Otherwise, this member is unused.

member.summary: Specifies the offset, in bytes, on the boot disk where the boot partition begins.

member.summary: Specifies the offset, in bytes, on the system disk where the system partition begins.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.BOOTDISK_INFORMATION_EX.BootDeviceSignature
member.summary: If the boot disk is formatted with an MBR partition table, this specifies the signature for the disk's MBR partition table. Otherwise, this member is unused.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.BOOTDISK_INFORMATION_EX.SystemDeviceSignature
member.summary: If the system disk is formatted with an MBR partition table, this specifies the signature for the disk's MBR partition table. Otherwise, this member is unused.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.BOOTDISK_INFORMATION_EX.BootDeviceGuid
member.summary: If the BootDeviceIsGpt member is TRUE, this specifies the GUID for the boot disk. Otherwise, this member is unused.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.BOOTDISK_INFORMATION_EX.SystemDeviceGuid
member.summary: If the SystemDeviceIsGpt member is TRUE, this specifies the GUID for the boot disk. Otherwise, this member is unused.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.BOOTDISK_INFORMATION_EX.SystemDeviceIsGpt

The only flag that has been implemented for this release is LOG_POLICY_OVERWRITE, which indicates that when the policy is installed, it will replace the policy of the same type, if such a policy already exists.

member.summary: The CLFS node type.

member.summary: The CLFS_STREAM_ID_INFORMATION structure holds a value that identifies a stream in a Common Log File System (CLFS) log. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_clfs_stream_id_information

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLFS_STREAM_ID_INFORMATION.StreamIdentifier
member.summary: An 8-bit value that identifies a stream.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLIENTCREATESTRUCT
member.summary: Contains information about the menu and first multiple-document interface (MDI) child window of an MDI client window. An application passes a pointer to this structure as the lpParam parameter of the CreateWindow function when creating an MDI client window. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-clientcreatestruct

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLIENTCREATESTRUCT.hWindowMenu
member.summary: A handle to the MDI application's window menu. An MDI application can retrieve this handle from the menu of the MDI frame window by using the GetSubMenu function.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLIENTCREATESTRUCT.idFirstChild
member.summary: The child window identifier of the first MDI child window created.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_ARCHIVE_DESCRIPTOR
member.summary: Used by the GetNextLogArchiveExtent function to return information about log archive extents. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/clfs/ns-clfs-cls_archive_descriptor

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_ARCHIVE_DESCRIPTOR.coffLow
member.summary: The offset in the container to the first byte of the archive extent.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_ARCHIVE_DESCRIPTOR.coffHigh
member.summary: The offset in the container to the last byte of the archive extent.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_ARCHIVE_DESCRIPTOR.infoContainer
member.summary: The container information structure that describes the container associated with the archive extent.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_CONTAINER_INFORMATION
member.summary: The CLFS_CONTAINER_INFORMATION structure holds descriptive information for an individual container in a Common Log File System (CLFS) log. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_cls_container_information

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_CONTAINER_INFORMATION.FileAttributes
member.summary: A set of flags that specifies attributes of the container. See the fFlagsAndAttributes parameter of the ClfsCreateLogFile function.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_CONTAINER_INFORMATION.CreationTime
member.summary: The time that the container was created.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_CONTAINER_INFORMATION.LastAccessTime
member.summary: The time that the container was last accessed.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_CONTAINER_INFORMATION.LastWriteTime
member.summary: The time of the last write to the container.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_CONTAINER_INFORMATION.ContainerSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the container.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_CONTAINER_INFORMATION.FileNameActualLength
member.summary: The size, in characters, of the actual file name of the container.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_CONTAINER_INFORMATION.FileNameLength
member.summary: The size of the file name in the FileName buffer.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_CONTAINER_INFORMATION.FileName
member.summary: An array of wide characters that holds the file name of the container.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_CONTAINER_INFORMATION.State
member.summary: An integer that specifies the state of the container. This member must be one of the CLFS_CONTAINER_STATE.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_CONTAINER_INFORMATION.PhysicalContainerId
member.summary: A 32-bit identifier that remains the same over the life of the log.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_CONTAINER_INFORMATION.LogicalContainerId
member.summary: A 32-bit identifier that changes every time the container is recycled.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_INFORMATION
member.summary: The CLFS_INFORMATION structure holds metadata and state information for a Common Log File System (CLFS) stream and/or its underlying physical log. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_cls_information

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_INFORMATION.TotalAvailable
member.summary: The total available space allocated to the log. This is calculated as the sum of the sizes of all containers in the log.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_INFORMATION.CurrentAvailable
member.summary: The amount of space available in the log for new records and reservation allocations. This space is the total available space minus the undo commitment space and space used for storing owner pages in a multiplexed log.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_INFORMATION.TotalReservation
member.summary: The amount of space reserved in the stream (or physical log) for undo operations.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_INFORMATION.BaseFileSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the base log file.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_INFORMATION.ContainerSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of an individual container in the log. Note that all containers in the log are the same size.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_INFORMATION.TotalContainers
member.summary: The number of containers in the log.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_INFORMATION.FreeContainers
member.summary: The number of containers in the log that are not active.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_INFORMATION.TotalClients
member.summary: The number of streams that share the log.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_INFORMATION.Attributes
member.summary: A set of flags that specify stream (or physical log) attributes. See the fFlagsAndAttributes parameter of the ClfsCreateLogFile function.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_INFORMATION.FlushThreshold
member.summary: The number of bytes of data (including headers) that are allowed to remain pending on the internal flush queue before CLFS automatically schedules a thread to write the flush queue to stable storage.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_INFORMATION.SectorSize
member.summary: The sector size, in bytes, of the underlying disk geometry. The sector size is assumed to be a multiple of 512 and consistent across containers.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_INFORMATION.MinArchiveTailLsn
member.summary: The LSN of the oldest record in the log for which archiving has not taken place. The minimum of this and the base LSN determines the last container that can be reused when containers are recycled.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_INFORMATION.BaseLsn
member.summary: The LSN of the oldest record in the stream (or physical log) that is still needed by the stream (or log) clients.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_INFORMATION.LastFlushedLsn
member.summary: The LSN of the last record that was flushed to stable storage.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_INFORMATION.LastLsn
member.summary: The LSN of the youngest record in the stream (or physical log) that is still needed by the stream (or log) clients.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_INFORMATION.RestartLsn
member.summary: The LSN of the last restart record written to the stream (or physical log). If there are no restart records, this member is equal to CLFS_LSN_INVALID.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_INFORMATION.Identity
member.summary: A GUID that serves as a unique identifier for the log.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_IO_STATISTICS
member.summary: The CLFS_IO_STATISTICS structure holds I/O statistics data for a Common Log File System (CLFS) log. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_cls_io_statistics

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_IO_STATISTICS.hdrIoStats
member.summary: A CLFS_IO_STATISTICS_HEADER structure that holds header information for the set of statistics.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_IO_STATISTICS.cFlush
member.summary: The number of data flushes.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_IO_STATISTICS.cbFlush
member.summary: The number of bytes of data flushed.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_IO_STATISTICS.cMetaFlush
member.summary: The number of metadata flushes.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_IO_STATISTICS.cbMetaFlush
member.summary: The number of bytes of metadata flushed.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_IO_STATISTICS_HEADER
member.summary: The CLFS_IO_STATISTICS_HEADER structure holds the header portion of a CLFS_IO_STATISTICS structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_cls_io_statistics_header

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_IO_STATISTICS_HEADER.ubMajorVersion
member.summary: The major version of the CLFS_IO_STATISTICS structure.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_IO_STATISTICS_HEADER.ubMinorVersion
member.summary: The minor version of the CLFS_IO_STATISTICS structure.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_IO_STATISTICS_HEADER.eStatsClass
member.summary: Reserved for future use. This member is ignored. CLFS_IOSTATS_CLASS

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_IO_STATISTICS_HEADER.cbLength
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the CLFS_IO_STATISTICS structure, including the header.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_IO_STATISTICS_HEADER.coffData
member.summary: The offset, in bytes, from the beginning of the CLFS_IO_STATISTICS structure to the beginning of the statistics data. This member allows for transparent modifications to the header.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_LSN
member.summary: The CLFS_LSN structure identifies an individual record in a Common Log File System (CLFS) stream. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_cls_lsn A container is a contiguous physical disk extent that serves as part of a CLFS log.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_LSN.Internal
member.summary: A 64-bit value that holds three pieces of information about a log record: container identifier, block offset, and record sequence number.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_WRITE_ENTRY
member.summary: Contains a user buffer, which is to become part of a log record, and its length. The ReserveAndAppendLog function uses CLFS_WRITE_ENTRY structures in the routine that appends log records to logs. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/clfs/ns-clfs-cls_write_entry

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_WRITE_ENTRY.Buffer
member.summary: The log record data buffer.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CLS_WRITE_ENTRY.ByteLength
member.summary: The length of the log record data buffer, in bytes.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_EISA_SLOT_INFORMATION
member.summary: The CM_EISA_SLOT_INFORMATION structure defines EISA configuration header information returned by HalGetBusData for the input BusDataType = EisaConfiguration, or by HalGetBusDataByOffset for the inputs BusDataType = EisaConfiguration and Offset = 0, assuming the caller-allocated Buffer is of sufficient Length. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_cm_eisa_slot_information

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_EISA_SLOT_INFORMATION.ReturnCode
member.summary: Contains a status code if an error occurs when the EISA BIOS is queried. Possible status codes include the following: EISA_INVALID_SLOT EISA_INVALID_FUNCTION EISA_INVALID_CONFIGURATION EISA_EMPTY_SLOT EISA_INVALID_BIOS_CALL

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_EISA_SLOT_INFORMATION.ReturnFlags
member.summary: The return flags.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_EISA_SLOT_INFORMATION.MajorRevision
member.summary: Information supplied by the manufacturer.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_EISA_SLOT_INFORMATION.MinorRevision
member.summary: Information supplied by the manufacturer.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_EISA_SLOT_INFORMATION.Checksum
member.summary: The checksum value, allowing validation of the configuration data.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_EISA_SLOT_INFORMATION.NumberFunctions
member.summary: The number at this slot.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_EISA_SLOT_INFORMATION.FunctionInformation
member.summary: Whether there is available CM_EISA_FUNCTION_INFORMATION for this slot.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_EISA_SLOT_INFORMATION.CompressedId
member.summary: The EISA compressed identification of the device at this slot.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_FLOPPY_DEVICE_DATA
member.summary: The CM_FLOPPY_DEVICE_DATA structure defines a device-type-specific data record that is stored in the \Registry\Machine\Hardware\Description tree for a floppy controller if the system can collect this information during the boot process. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_cm_floppy_device_data

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_FULL_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR
member.summary: The CM_FULL_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR structure specifies a set of system hardware resources of various types, assigned to a device that is connected to a specific bus. This structure is contained within a CM_RESOURCE_LIST structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_cm_full_resource_descriptor

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_FULL_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR.InterfaceType
member.summary: Specifies the type of bus to which the device is connected. This must be one of the types defined by INTERFACE_TYPE, in Wdm.h or Ntddk.h. (Not used by WDM drivers.)

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_FULL_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR.BusNumber
member.summary: The system-assigned, driver-supplied, zero-based number of the bus to which the device is connected. (Not used by WDM drivers.)

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_FULL_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR.PartialResourceList
member.summary: A CM_PARTIAL_RESOURCE_LIST structure.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_INT13_DRIVE_PARAMETER
member.summary: The CM_INT13_DRIVE_PARAMETER structure defines a device-type-specific data record that is stored in the \Registry\Machine\Hardware\Description tree for a disk controller if the system can collect this information during the boot process. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_cm_int13_drive_parameter

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_INT13_DRIVE_PARAMETER.DriveSelect
member.summary: The drive selected value.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_INT13_DRIVE_PARAMETER.MaxCylinders
member.summary: The maximum number of cylinders.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_INT13_DRIVE_PARAMETER.SectorsPerTrack
member.summary: The number of sectors per track.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_INT13_DRIVE_PARAMETER.MaxHeads
member.summary: The maximum number of heads.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_INT13_DRIVE_PARAMETER.NumberDrives
member.summary: The number of drives.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_KEYBOARD_DEVICE_DATA
member.summary: The CM_KEYBOARD_DEVICE_DATA structure defines a device-type-specific data record that is stored in the \Registry\Machine\Hardware\Description tree for a keyboard peripheral if the system can collect this information during the boot process. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_cm_keyboard_device_data

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_KEYBOARD_DEVICE_DATA.Version
member.summary: The version number of this structure.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_KEYBOARD_DEVICE_DATA.Revision
member.summary: The revision of this structure.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_KEYBOARD_DEVICE_DATA.Type
member.summary: The type of the keyboard.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_KEYBOARD_DEVICE_DATA.Subtype
member.summary: The subtype of the keyboard.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_KEYBOARD_DEVICE_DATA.KeyboardFlags
member.summary: Defined by x86 BIOS INT 16h, function 02 as KEYBOARD_FLAGS

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_MCA_POS_DATA
member.summary: The CM_MCA_POS_DATA structure is obsolete. It defines IBM-compatible MCA POS configuration information for a slot. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_cm_mca_pos_data This structure is used by the obsolete HalGetBusData and HalGetBusDataByOffset routines.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_PARTIAL_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR
member.summary: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_cm_partial_resource_descriptor

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_PARTIAL_RESOURCE_LIST
member.summary: The CM_PARTIAL_RESOURCE_LIST structure specifies a set of system hardware resources, of various types, assigned to a device. This structure is contained within a CM_FULL_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_cm_partial_resource_list

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_PARTIAL_RESOURCE_LIST.Version
member.summary: The version number of this structure. This value should be 1.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_PARTIAL_RESOURCE_LIST.Revision
member.summary: The revision of this structure. This value should be 1.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_PARTIAL_RESOURCE_LIST.Count
member.summary: The number of elements contained in the PartialDescriptors array.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_PARTIAL_RESOURCE_LIST.PartialDescriptors
member.summary: The first element in an array of one or more CM_PARTIAL_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR structures.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_RESOURCE_LIST
member.summary: The CM_RESOURCE_LIST structure specifies all of the system hardware resources assigned to a device. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_cm_resource_list

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_RESOURCE_LIST.Count
member.summary: The number of full resource descriptors that are specified by this CM_RESOURCE_LIST structure. The List member is the header for the first full resource descriptor. For WDM drivers, Count is always 1.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.CM_RESOURCE_LIST.List
member.summary: The CM_FULL_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR structure that serves as the header for the first full resource descriptor. If the CM_RESOURCE_LIST structure contains more than one full resource descriptor, the second full resource descriptor immediately follows the first in memory, and so on. The size of each full resource descriptor depends on the length of the CM_PARTIAL_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR array that it contains.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.COUNTED_REASON_CONTEXT.Version
member.summary: The version number of the structure. Set this member to DIAGNOSTIC_REASON_VERSION.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.COUNTED_REASON_CONTEXT.Flags
member.summary: Indicates whether the structure contains a simple reason string or a detailed set of reason strings. DIAGNOSTIC_REASON_SIMPLE_STRING DIAGNOSTIC_REASON_DETAILED_STRING If Flags = DIAGNOSTIC_REASON_SIMPLE_STRING, the SimpleString member of the union is valid. If Flags = DIAGNOSTIC_REASON_DETAILED_STRING, the ResourceFileName, ResourceReasonId, StringCount, and ReasonStrings members are valid (and the SimpleString member is not valid).

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.COUNTED_REASON_CONTEXT_UNION.SimpleString
member.summary: A pointer to a wide-character, null-terminated string that explains the reason for a power request. This member is valid only if Flags = DIAGNOSTIC_REASON_SIMPLE_STRING.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.COUNTED_REASON_CONTEXT_DUMMY.ResourceFileName

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.COUNTED_REASON_CONTEXT_DUMMY.ResourceReasonId
member.summary: The resource ID assigned to the first reason string in the resource file that is specified by ResourceFileName. This member is valid only if Flags = DIAGNOSTIC_REASON_DETAILED_STRING.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.COUNTED_REASON_CONTEXT_DUMMY.StringCount
member.summary: The number of reason strings in the ReasonStrings array or in the resource file that is specified by ResourceFileName. This member is valid only if Flags = DIAGNOSTIC_REASON_DETAILED_STRING.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.COUNTED_REASON_CONTEXT_DUMMY.ReasonStrings
member.summary: A pointer to an array of string pointers. Each array element is a pointer to a wide-character, null-terminated string. The number of array elements is specified by StringCount. This member is valid only if Flags = DIAGNOSTIC_REASON_DETAILED_STRING.

This interface allows device drivers to invoke the functions that manipulate _DSM functions 0Ah, 0Bh. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_d3cold_aux_power_and_timing_interface

member.summary: A pointer to interface-specific context information.

member.summary: A pointer to a D3COLD_REQUEST_PERST_DELAY enables the function device object (FDO) to convey its requirement for a fixed delay time.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB
member.summary: Defines the control setting for a serial communications device. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winbase/ns-winbase-dcb

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.DCBlength
member.summary: The length of the structure, in bytes. The caller must set this member to sizeof(DCB).

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.BaudRate
member.summary: The baud rate at which the communications device operates. This member can be an actual baud rate value, or one of the following indexes(in enums).

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.bitvector1
member.summary: fBinary : 1 fParity : 1 fOutxCtsFlow : 1 fOutxDsrFlow : 1 fDtrControl : 2 fDsrSensitivity : 1 fTXContinueOnXoff : 1 fOutX : 1 fInX : 1 fErrorChar : 1 fNull : 1 fRtsControl : 2 fAbortOnError : 1 fDummy2 : 17

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.wReserved
member.summary: Reserved; must be zero.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.XonLim
member.summary: The minimum number of bytes in use allowed in the input buffer before flow control is activated to allow transmission by the sender. This assumes that either XON/XOFF, RTS, or DTR input flow control is specified in the fInX, fRtsControl, or fDtrControl members.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.XoffLim
member.summary: The minimum number of free bytes allowed in the input buffer before flow control is activated to inhibit the sender. Note that the sender may transmit characters after the flow control signal has been activated, so this value should never be zero. This assumes that either XON/XOFF, RTS, or DTR input flow control is specified in the fInX, fRtsControl, or fDtrControl members. The maximum number of bytes in use allowed is calculated by subtracting this value from the size, in bytes, of the input buffer.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.ByteSize
member.summary: The number of bits in the bytes transmitted and received.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.Parity
member.summary: The parity scheme to be used. This member can be one of the following values(enum).

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.StopBits
member.summary: The number of stop bits to be used.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.XonChar
member.summary: The value of the XON character for both transmission and reception.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.XoffChar
member.summary: The value of the XOFF character for both transmission and reception.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.ErrorChar
member.summary: The value of the character used to replace bytes received with a parity error.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.EofChar
member.summary: The value of the character used to signal the end of data.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.EvtChar
member.summary: The value of the character used to signal an event.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.wReserved1
member.summary: Reserved; do not use.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.fBinary
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, binary mode is enabled. Windows does not support nonbinary mode transfers, so this member must be TRUE.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.fParity
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, parity checking is performed and errors are reported.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.fDtrControl
member.summary: DTR_CONTROL_DISABLE : 0x00 Disables the DTR line when the device is opened and leaves it disabled. DTR_CONTROL_ENABLE : 0x01 Enables the DTR line when the device is opened and leaves it on. DTR_CONTROL_HANDSHAKE : 0x02 Enables DTR handshaking. If handshaking is enabled, it is an error for the application to adjust the line by using the EscapeCommFunction function.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.fDsrSensitivity
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the communications driver is sensitive to the state of the DSR signal. The driver ignores any bytes received, unless the DSR modem input line is high.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.fTXContinueOnXoff
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, transmission continues after the input buffer has come within XoffLim bytes of being full and the driver has transmitted the XoffChar character to stop receiving bytes. If this member is FALSE, transmission does not continue until the input buffer is within XonLim bytes of being empty and the driver has transmitted the XonChar character to resume reception.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.fOutX
member.summary: Indicates whether XON/XOFF flow control is used during transmission. If this member is TRUE, transmission stops when the XoffChar character is received and starts again when the XonChar character is received.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.fInX
member.summary: Indicates whether XON/XOFF flow control is used during reception. If this member is TRUE, the XoffChar character is sent when the input buffer comes within XoffLim bytes of being full, and the XonChar character is sent when the input buffer comes within XonLim bytes of being empty.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.fErrorChar
member.summary: Indicates whether bytes received with parity errors are replaced with the character specified by the ErrorChar member. If this member is TRUE and the fParity member is TRUE, replacement occurs.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.fNull
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, null bytes are discarded when received.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.fRtsControl
member.summary: The RTS (request-to-send) flow control. This member can be one of the following values. RTS_CONTROL_DISABLE 0x00 Disables the RTS line when the device is opened and leaves it disabled. RTS_CONTROL_ENABLE 0x01 Enables the RTS line when the device is opened and leaves it on. RTS_CONTROL_HANDSHAKE 0x02 Enables RTS handshaking.The driver raises the RTS line when the "type-ahead" (input) buffer is less than one-half full and lowers the RTS line when the buffer is more than three-quarters full.If handshaking is enabled, it is an error for the application to adjust the line by using the EscapeCommFunction function. RTS_CONTROL_TOGGLE 0x03 Specifies that the RTS line will be high if bytes are available for transmission. After all buffered bytes have been sent, the RTS line will be low.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.fAbortOnError
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the driver terminates all read and write operations with an error status if an error occurs. The driver will not accept any further communications operations until the application has acknowledged the error by calling the ClearCommError function.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DCB.fDummy2
member.summary: Reserved; do not use.
