member.summary: Defines the DEVICE_BUS_SPECIFIC_RESET_TYPE structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-device_bus_specific_reset_type

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES
member.summary: A DEVICE_CAPABILITIES structure describes PnP and power capabilities of a device. This structure is returned in response to an IRP_MN_QUERY_CAPABILITIES IRP. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_device_capabilities

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.Size
member.summary: Specifies the size of the structure, in bytes. This field is set by the component that sends the IRP_MN_QUERY_CAPABILITIES request.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.Version
member.summary: Specifies the version of the structure, currently version 1. This field is set by the component that sends the IRP_MN_QUERY_CAPABILITIES request.

members.member: DeviceD1 : 1 DeviceD2 : 1 LockSupported : 1 EjectSupported : 1 Removable : 1 DockDevice : 1 UniqueID : 1 SilentInstall : 1 RawDeviceOK : 1 SurpriseRemovalOK : 1 WakeFromD0 : 1 WakeFromD1 : 1 WakeFromD2 : 1 WakeFromD3 : 1 HardwareDisabled : 1 NonDynamic : 1 WarmEjectSupported : 1 NoDisplayInUI : 1 Reserved1 : 1 WakeFromInterrupt : 1 SecureDevice : 1 ChildOfVgaEnabledBridge : 1 DecodeIoOnBoot : 1 Reserved : 9

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.Address
member.summary: Specifies an address indicating where the device is located on its underlying bus.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.UINumber
member.summary: Specifies a number associated with the device that can be displayed in the user interface.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.DeviceState
member.summary: An array of values indicating the most-powered device power state that the device can maintain for each system power state.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.SystemWake
member.summary: Specifies the least-powered system power state from which the device can signal a wake event. A value of PowerSystemUnspecified indicates that the device cannot wake the system.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.DeviceWake
member.summary: Specifies the least-powered device power state from which the device can signal a wake event. A value of PowerDeviceUnspecified indicates that the device cannot signal a wake event.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.D1Latency
member.summary: Specifies the device's approximate worst-case latency, in 100-microsecond units, for returning the device to the PowerDeviceD0 state from the PowerDeviceD1 state. Set to zero if the device does not support the D1 state.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.D2Latency
member.summary: Specifies the device's approximate worst-case latency, in 100-microsecond units, for returning the device to the PowerDeviceD0 state from the PowerDeviceD2 state. Set to zero if the device does not support the D2 state.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.D3Latency
member.summary: Specifies the device's approximate worst-case latency, in 100-microsecond units, for returning the device to the PowerDeviceD0 state from the PowerDeviceD3 state. Set to zero if the device does not support the D3 state.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.DeviceD1
member.summary: Specifies whether the device hardware supports the D1 power state. Drivers should not change this value.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.DeviceD2
member.summary: Specifies whether the device hardware supports the D2 power state. Drivers should not change this value.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.LockSupported
member.summary: Specifies whether the device supports physical-device locking that prevents device ejection. This member pertains to ejecting the device from its slot, rather than ejecting a piece of removable media from the device.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.EjectSupported
member.summary: Specifies whether the device supports software-controlled device ejection while the system is in the PowerSystemWorking state. This member pertains to ejecting the device from its slot, rather than ejecting a piece of removable media from the device.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.Removable
member.summary: Specifies whether the device can be dynamically removed from its immediate parent. If Removable is set to TRUE, the device does not belong to the same physical object as its parent.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.DockDevice
member.summary: Specifies whether the device is a docking peripheral.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.UniqueID
member.summary: Specifies whether the device's instance ID is unique system-wide. This bit is clear if the instance ID is unique only within the scope of the bus.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.SilentInstall
member.summary: Specifies whether Device Manager should suppress all installation dialog boxes; except required dialog boxes such as "no compatible drivers found."

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.RawDeviceOK
member.summary: Specifies whether the driver for the underlying bus can drive the device if there is no function driver (for example, SCSI devices in pass-through mode). This mode of operation is called raw mode.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.SurpriseRemovalOK
member.summary: Specifies whether the function driver for the device can handle the case where the device is removed before Windows can send IRP_MN_QUERY_REMOVE_DEVICE to it. If SurpriseRemovalOK is set to TRUE, the device can be safely removed from its immediate parent regardless of the state that its driver is in.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.WakeFromD0
member.summary: Specifies whether the device can respond to an external wake signal while in the D0 state. Drivers should not change this value.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.WakeFromD1
member.summary: Specifies whether the device can respond to an external wake signal while in the D1 state. Drivers should not change this value.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.WakeFromD2
member.summary: Specifies whether the device can respond to an external wake signal while in the D2 state. Drivers should not change this value.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.WakeFromD3
member.summary: Specifies whether the device can respond to an external wake signal while in the D3 state. Drivers should not change this value.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.HardwareDisabled
member.summary: When set, this flag specifies that the device's hardware is disabled. A device's parent bus driver or a bus filter driver sets this flag when such a driver determines that the device hardware is disabled. The PnP manager sends one IRP_MN_QUERY_CAPABILITIES IRP right after a device is enumerated and sends another after the device has been started. The PnP manager only checks this bit right after the device is enumerated. Once the device is started, this bit is ignored.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.NonDynamic
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.WarmEjectSupported
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.NoDisplayInUI
member.summary: Do not display the device in the user interface. If this bit is set, the device is never displayed in the user interface, even if the device is present but fails to start. Only bus drivers and associated bus filter drivers should set this bit. (Also see the PNP_DEVICE_DONT_DISPLAY_IN_UI flag in the PNP_DEVICE_STATE structure.)

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.Reserved1
member.summary: Reserved for system use.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.WakeFromInterrupt
member.summary: Indicates whether the driver or ACPI is responsible for handling the wake event. If set, the driver is responsible for handling the wake event. ACPI arms the device when it receives an IRP_MN_WAIT_WAKE IRP, but does not connect the interrupt, complete the IRP to notify the device stack of a wake event.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.SecureDevice
member.summary: Indicates whether the device is a secure device.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.ChildOfVgaEnabledBridge
member.summary: For a VGA device, indicates whether the parent bridge has the VGA decoding bit set.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.DecodeIoOnBoot
member.summary: Indictates whether the device has IO decode enabled on boot.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_CAPABILITIES.Reserved
member.summary: Reserved for system use.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT
member.summary: The DEVICE_OBJECT structure is used by the operating system to represent a device object. A device object represents a logical, virtual, or physical device for which a driver handles I/O requests. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_device_object

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.Type
member.summary: Used by the operating system to indicate that an object is a device object. For device objects, the value of this member is 3. This is a read-only member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.Size
member.summary: Specifies the size, in bytes, of the device object. This size includes the driver-specified device extension pointed to by the DeviceExtension member, but does not include the opaque device object extension pointed to by the DeviceObjectExtension member. Size is a read-only member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.ReferenceCount
member.summary: Used by the I/O manager to track the number of open handles for the device that are associated with the device object. This allows the I/O manager to avoid unloading a driver when there are outstanding handles for the driver's device(s). This is a read-only member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.DriverObject
member.summary: A pointer to the driver object (DRIVER_OBJECT), that represents the loaded image of the driver that was input to the DriverEntry and AddDevice routines. This member is set by the I/O manager upon a successful call to IoCreateDevice or IoCreateDeviceSecure. This is a read-only member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.NextDevice
member.summary: A pointer to the next device object, if any, that was created by the same driver. The I/O manager updates this list at each successful call to IoCreateDevice or IoCreateDeviceSecure. A non- Plug and Play(PnP) driver that is being unloaded must traverse("walk") the list of its device objects and delete them. A PnP driver does not have to walk this list of device objects.Instead, PnP drivers perform their cleanup during the device removal PnP operation (IRP_MN_REMOVE_DEVICE). A driver that recreates its device objects dynamically also uses this member. This is a read/write member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.AttachedDevice
member.summary: A pointer to the attached device object. If there is no attached device object, this member is NULL. The device object that is pointed to by the AttachedDevice member typically is the device object of a filter driver, which intercepts I/O requests originally targeted to the device represent by the device object. For more information, see the IoAttachDevice and IoAttachDeviceByPointer topics. This is an opaque member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.CurrentIrp
member.summary: A pointer to the current IRP if the driver has a StartIo routine whose entry point was set in the driver object and if the driver is currently processing IRP(s). Otherwise, this member is NULL. For more information, see the IoStartPacket and IoStartNextPacket topics. This is a read-only member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.Timer
member.summary: A pointer to a timer object. This allows the I/O manager to call a driver-supplied timer routine every second. For more information, see IoInitializeTimer. This is a read/write member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.Flags
member.summary: Device drivers perform a bitwise OR operation with this member in their newly created device objects by using one or more of the DEVICE_OBJECT_FLAGS

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.Characteristics
member.summary: Specifies one or more system-defined constants, combined with a bitwise OR operation, that provide additional information about the driver's device.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.Vpb
member.summary: A pointer to the volume parameter block (VPB) that is associated with the device object. For file system drivers, the VPB can provide a connection to any unnamed logical device object that represents an instance of a mounted volume. This is an opaque member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.DeviceExtension
member.summary: A pointer to the device extension. The structure and contents of the device extension are driver-defined. The size is driver-determined, specified in the driver's call to IoCreateDevice or IoCreateDeviceSecure. For more information about device extensions, see Device Extensions. This is a read-only member. However, the object that the member points to can be modified by the driver.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.DeviceType
member.summary: Set by IoCreateDevice and IoCreateDeviceSecure by using the value that is specified for that routine's DeviceType parameter. For more information, see the Specifying Device Types topic.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.StackSize
member.summary: Specifies the minimum number of stack locations in IRPs to be sent to this driver. IoCreateDevice and IoCreateDeviceSecure set this member to 1 in newly created device objects; lowest-level drivers can therefore ignore this member. The I/O manager automatically sets the StackSize member in a higher-level driver's device object to the appropriate value if the driver calls IoAttachDevice or IoAttachDeviceToDeviceStack. Only a higher-level driver that chains itself over another driver with IoGetDeviceObjectPointer must explicitly set the value of StackSize in its own device object(s) to 1 + the StackSize value of the next-lower driver's device object.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.Queue
member.summary: Used internally by the I/O manager to queue the device object when it is required. This is an opaque member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.AlignmentRequirement
member.summary: Specifies the device's address alignment requirement for data transfers. The value must be one of the FILE_XXX_ALIGNMENT values that are defined in Wdm.h. For more information, see the Initializing a Device Object, GetDmaAlignment, and ZwQueryInformationFile topics.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.DeviceQueue
member.summary: The device queue object for the device object. The device queue object contains any IRPs that are waiting to be processed by the driver that is associated with the device object. For more information, see the Driver-Managed IRP Queues topic. This is an opaque member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.Dpc
member.summary: The deferred procedure call (DPC) object for the device object. For more information, see the Introduction to DPC Objects topic. This is an opaque member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.ActiveThreadCount
member.summary: Reserved for future use. This is an opaque member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.SecurityDescriptor
member.summary: Specifies a security descriptor (SECURITY_DESCRIPTOR) for the device object when the device object is created. If this member is NULL, the device object receives default security settings. This is a read-only member, although the member can be modified through the ZwSetSecurityObjectfunction.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.DeviceLock
member.summary: A synchronization event object that is allocated by the I/O manager. The I/O manager obtains his event object before it dispatches a mount or mount-verify request to a file-system driver. This is an opaque member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.SectorSize
member.summary: If the device object does not represent a volume, this member is set to zero. If the device object represents a volume, this member specifies the volume's sector size, in bytes. The I/O manager uses this member to make sure that all read operations, write operations, and set file position operations that are issued are aligned correctly when intermediate buffering is disabled. A default system bytes-per-sector value is used when the device object is created, however, file system drivers; and more rarely, legacy and minifilter drivers, can update this value that is based on the geometry of the underlying volume hardware when a mount occurs. Other drivers should not modify this member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.Spare1
member.summary: Reserved for system use. This is an opaque member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.DeviceObjectExtension
member.summary: A pointer to a device object extension that is used by the I/O manager and PnP manager to store information about the state of the device. This is an opaque member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT.Reserved
member.summary: Reserved for system use. This is an opaque member.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT_QUEUE
member.summary: Used internally by the I/O manager to queue the device object when it is required.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT_QUEUE.ListEntry
member.summary: A LIST_ENTRY structure that contains forward and backward pointers for a doubly linked list.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_OBJECT_QUEUE.Wcb
member.summary: Device context information used by I/O manager.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_RESET_INTERFACE_STANDARD
member.summary: The DEVICE_RESET_INTERFACE_STANDARD structure enables function drivers to reset and recover malfunctioning devices. This structure describes the GUID_DEVICE_RESET_INTERFACE_STANDARD interface. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_device_reset_interface_standard

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_RESET_INTERFACE_STANDARD.Size
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of this structure.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_RESET_INTERFACE_STANDARD.Version
member.summary: The driver-defined interface version.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_RESET_INTERFACE_STANDARD.Context
member.summary: A pointer to interface-specific context information.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_RESET_INTERFACE_STANDARD.InterfaceReference
member.summary: A pointer to an InterfaceReference routine that increments the interface's reference count.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_RESET_INTERFACE_STANDARD.InterfaceDereference
member.summary: A pointer to an InterfaceDereference routine that decrements the interface's reference count.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_RESET_INTERFACE_STANDARD.DeviceReset
member.summary: A pointer to the interface's DeviceReset routine. This routine can be used by function drivers to attempt to reset and recover a malfunctioning device.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_RESET_INTERFACE_STANDARD.SupportedResetTypes
member.summary: Defines the ULONG parameter SupportedResetTypes.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_RESET_INTERFACE_STANDARD.Reserved
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_RESET_INTERFACE_STANDARD.QueryBusSpecificResetInfo
member.summary: Defines the PDEVICE_QUERY_BUS_SPECIFIC_RESET_HANDLER parameter QueryBusSpecificResetInfo.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_RESET_INTERFACE_STANDARD.DeviceBusSpecificReset
member.summary: Defines the PDEVICE_BUS_SPECIFIC_RESET_HANDLER parameter DeviceBusSpecificReset.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_RESET_INTERFACE_STANDARD.GetDeviceResetStatus
member.summary: Defines the PGET_DEVICE_RESET_STATUS parameter GetDeviceResetStatus.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_RESET_STATUS_FLAGS
member.summary: This topic describes the DEVICE_RESET_STATUS_FLAGS union. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-device_reset_status_flags

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_RESET_STATUS_FLAGS.u
member.summary: Defines the u structure.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_RESET_STATUS_FLAGS.AsUlonglong
member.summary: Defines the ULONGLONG member AsUlonglong.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_RESET_STATUS_FLAGS_U
member.summary: Defines the u structure.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_RESET_STATUS_FLAGS_U.KeepStackReset
member.summary: Defines the ULONGLONG member KeepStackReset.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_RESET_STATUS_FLAGS_U.RecoveringFromBusError
member.summary: Defines the ULONGLONG member RecoveringFromBusError.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DEVICE_RESET_STATUS_FLAGS_U.Reserved
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_ADAPTER
member.summary: The DMA_ADAPTER structure describes a system-defined interface to a DMA controller for a given device. A driver calls IoGetDmaAdapter to obtain this structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_dma_adapter

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_ADAPTER.Version
member.summary: Specifies the version of this structure. Version 3 of the DMA_ADAPTER structure is available starting with Windows 8. For versions 1 and 2 of this structure, this member is set to the value 1.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_ADAPTER.Size
member.summary: Specifies the size, in bytes, of this structure.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_ADAPTER.DmaOperations
member.summary: Pointer to a DMA_OPERATIONS structure that contains pointers to DMA adapter functions. The version of the DMA_OPERATIONS structure that this member points to is determined by the version of the DMA_ADAPTER structure. Thus, for version 1 of the DMA_ADAPTER structure, DmaOperations points to version 1 of the DMA_OPERATIONS structure, and so on.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_ADAPTER_INFO
member.summary: The DMA_ADAPTER_INFO structure is a container for a DMA_ADAPTER_INFO_XXX structure that describes the capabilities of a system DMA controller. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_dma_adapter_info

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_ADAPTER_INFO.Version
member.summary: The version number of the **DMA_ADAPTER_INFO_**XXX structure that follows this member. For a DMA_ADAPTER_INFO_V1 structure, set this member to DMA_ADAPTER_INFO_VERSION1 before calling the GetDmaAdapterInfo routine.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_ADAPTER_INFO_UNION.V1
member.summary: The capabilities of the bus-master DMA device or the system DMA controller.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_ADAPTER_INFO_UNION.Crashdump
member.summary: Defines the DMA_ADAPTER_INFO_CRASHDUMP member Crashdump.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_ADAPTER_INFO_V1
member.summary: The DMA_ADAPTER_INFO_V1 structure describes the capabilities of the system DMA controller that is represented by an adapter object.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_ADAPTER_INFO_V1.ReadDmaCounterAvailable
member.summary: Whether the counter value in each DMA channel can be read. This member is TRUE if the counter can be read, and is FALSE if it cannot be read.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_ADAPTER_INFO_V1.ScatterGatherLimit
member.summary: The maximum number of elements in a scatter/gather list that the DMA controller can process in a single scatter/gather DMA transfer.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_ADAPTER_INFO_V1.DmaAddressWidth
member.summary: The memory address width, in bits, of the DMA controller. The width is expressed as the number of bits in a DMA address. If the DMA address width is less than the memory address width, the platform hardware drives the remaining, high-order memory address bits to zero during a DMA transfer.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_ADAPTER_INFO_V1.Flags
member.summary: A set of flags that describe the capabilities of the DMA adapter. No flags are currently defined for this member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_ADAPTER_INFO_V1.MinimumTransferUnit
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the minimum transfer unit. The number of bytes specified by an element in a scatter/gather list must be an integer multiple of the minimum transfer unit.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_ADAPTER_INFO_CRASHDUMP
member.summary: This topic describes the DMA_ADAPTER_INFO_CRASHDUMP structure.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_ADAPTER_INFO_CRASHDUMP.DeviceDescription
member.summary: Defines the DEVICE_DESCRIPTION member DeviceDescription.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_ADAPTER_INFO_CRASHDUMP.DeviceIdSize
member.summary: Defines the SIZE_T member DeviceIdSize.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_ADAPTER_INFO_CRASHDUMP.DeviceId
member.summary: Defines the PVOID member DeviceId.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_IOMMU_INTERFACE
member.summary: An extended version of the INTERFACE structure that allows device drivers to invoke the callback functions that perform device domain operations. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_dma_iommu_interface DMA_IOMMU_INTERFACE has been deprecated in Windows 10, version 2103 and has been replaced by DMA_IOMMU_INTERFACE_EX.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_IOMMU_INTERFACE_EX
member.summary: An interface structure that allows device drivers to interface with the IOMMU functions that perform device domain operations. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-dma_iommu_interface_ex

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_IOMMU_INTERFACE_EX.Size
member.summary: The size (in bytes) of the interface structure.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_IOMMU_INTERFACE_EX.Version
member.summary: The interface version number that determines the set of interface functions that are provided by this interface structure.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_IOMMU_INTERFACE_EX_V1
member.summary: A DMA_IOMMU_INTERFACE_V1 structure that specifies the set of Version 1 (V1) IOMMU interface functions. These are the same set of functions as those provided by the deprecated DMA_IOMMU_INTERFACE structure.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_IOMMU_INTERFACE_EX_V2
member.summary: A DMA_IOMMU_INTERFACE_V2 structure that specifies the set of Version 2 (V2) IOMMU interface functions.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS
member.summary: The DMA_OPERATIONS structure provides a table of pointers to functions that control the operation of a DMA controller. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_dma_operations

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.Size
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of this DMA_OPERATIONS structure.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.PutDmaAdapter
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine to free a DMA_ADAPTER structure.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.AllocateCommonBuffer
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine to allocate a physically contiguous DMA buffer.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.FreeCommonBuffer
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine to free a physically contiguous DMA buffer previously allocated by AllocateCommonBuffer.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.AllocateAdapterChannel
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine to allocate a channel for DMA operations.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.FlushAdapterBuffers
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine to flush data from the system or bus-master adapter's internal cache after a DMA operation.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.FreeAdapterChannel
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine to free a channel previously allocated for DMA operations by AllocateAdapterChannel.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.FreeMapRegisters
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine to free map registers allocated for DMA operations.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.MapTransfer
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine to begin a DMA operation.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.GetDmaAlignment
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine to obtain the DMA alignment requirements of the controller.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.ReadDmaCounter
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine to obtain the current transfer count for a DMA operation.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.GetScatterGatherList
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine that allocates map registers and creates a scatter/gather list for DMA.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.PutScatterGatherList
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine that frees map registers and a scatter/gather list after a DMA operation is complete.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.CalculateScatterGatherList
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine that determines the buffer size needed to hold the scatter/gather list that describes an I/O data buffer. This member is available only in versions 2 and later of DMA_OPERATIONS.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.BuildScatterGatherList
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine that allocates map registers and creates a scatter/gather list for DMA in a driver-supplied buffer. This member is available only in versions 2 and later of DMA_OPERATIONS.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.BuildMdlFromScatterGatherList
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine that builds an MDL corresponding to a scatter/gather list. This member is available only in versions 2 and later of DMA_OPERATIONS.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.GetDmaAdapterInfo
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine that describes the capabilities of a bus-master DMA device or a system DMA controller. GetDmaAdapterInfo is available only in version 3 of DMA_OPERATIONS.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.GetDmaTransferInfo
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine that describes the allocation requirements for a scatter/gather list. This routine replaces CalculateScatterGatherList. GetDmaTransferInfo is available only in version 3 of DMA_OPERATIONS.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.InitializeDmaTransferContext
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine that initializes an opaque DMA transfer context. The operating system stores the internal status of a DMA transfer in this context. InitializeDmaTransferContext is available only in version 3 of DMA_OPERATIONS.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.AllocateCommonBufferEx
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine that allocates memory for a common buffer and maps this memory so that it can accessed both by the processor and by a DMA device. AllocateCommonBufferEx is available only in version 3 of DMA_OPERATIONS.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.AllocateAdapterChannelEx
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine that allocates the resources required for a DMA transfer and then calls the driver-supplied AdapterControl routine to initiate the DMA transfer. AllocateAdapterChannelEx is available only in version 3 of DMA_OPERATIONS.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.ConfigureAdapterChannel
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine enables a custom function that is implemented by the DMA controller. ConfigureAdapterChannel is available only in version 3 of DMA_OPERATIONS.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.CancelAdapterChannel
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine that tries to cancel a pending request to allocate a DMA channel. CancelAdapterChannel is available only in version 3 of DMA_OPERATIONS.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.MapTransferEx
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine that sets up map registers to map the physical addresses in a scatter/gather list to the logical addresses that are required to do a DMA transfer. MapTransferEx is available only in version 3 of DMA_OPERATIONS.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.GetScatterGatherListEx
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine that allocates resources required for a DMA transfer, builds a scatter/gather list, and then calls the driver-supplied AdapterListControl routine to initiate the DMA transfer. GetScatterGatherListEx is available only in version 3 of DMA_OPERATIONS.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.BuildScatterGatherListEx
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine that builds a scatter/gather list in a caller-allocated buffer, and then calls the driver-supplied AdapterListControl routine to initiate the DMA transfer. BuildScatterGatherListEx is available only in version 3 of DMA_OPERATIONS.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.FlushAdapterBuffersEx
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine that flushes any data that remains in the system DMA controller's internal cache or in a bus-master adapter's internal cache at the end of a DMA transfer. For a device that uses a system DMA controller, this routine cancels the current DMA transfer on the controller if the transfer is not complete. FlushAdapterBuffersEx is available only in version 3 of DMA_OPERATIONS.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.FreeAdapterObject
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine that releases the specified adapter object after a driver has completed all DMA operations. FreeAdapterObject is available only in version 3 of DMA_OPERATIONS.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.CancelMappedTransfer
member.summary: A pointer to a system-defined routine that cancels a mapped transfer. CancelMappedTransfer is available only in version 3 of DMA_OPERATIONS.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.AllocateDomainCommonBuffer
member.summary: A pointer to a PALLOCATE_DOMAIN_COMMON_BUFFER callback routine to allocate a domain common buffer.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.FlushDmaBuffer
member.summary: A pointer to a PFLUSH_DMA_BUFFER callback function that flushes any data remaining in the cache.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.JoinDmaDomain
member.summary: A pointer to a PJOIN_DMA_DOMAIN callback function that joins the specified DMA domain.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.LeaveDmaDomain
member.summary: A pointer to a PLEAVE_DMA_DOMAIN callback function that leaves the specified DMA domain.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.GetDmaDomain
member.summary: A pointer to the PGET_DMA_DOMAIN callback function that gets a handle to the DMA domain.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.AllocateCommonBufferWithBounds
member.summary: A pointer to a PALLOCATE_COMMON_BUFFER_WITH_BOUNDS callback function that allocates the memory for a common buffer and maps it so that it can be accessed by a master device and the CPU. The common buffer can be bound by an optional minimum and maximum logical address. This option is available starting in Windows 10, version 1803.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_OPERATIONS.CreateCommonBufferFromMdl
member.summary: A pointer to a PCREATE_COMMON_BUFFER_FROM_MDL callback function that will create a DMA common buffer from an MDL and maps the backing memory so that it can be accessed by a bus-mastering device and the CPU. This optional callback is available starting in Windows Server 2022.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_TRANSFER_INFO
member.summary: The DMA_TRANSFER_INFO structure is a container for a DMA_TRANSFER_INFO_XXX structure that describes the allocation requirements for a scatter/gather list. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_dma_transfer_info

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_TRANSFER_INFO.Version
member.summary: The version number of the DMA_TRANSFER_INFO_XXX structure that follows this member. For a DMA_TRANSFER_INFO_V1 structure, set this member to DMA_TRANSFER_INFO_VERSION1 before calling the GetDmaTransferInfo routine.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_TRANSFER_INFO_V1
member.summary: The allocation requirements for a scatter/gather list.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_TRANSFER_INFO_V1.MapRegisterCount
member.summary: The number of map registers required to translate all the physical addresses in the scatter/gather list to logical addresses.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_TRANSFER_INFO_V1.ScatterGatherElementCount
member.summary: The number of scatter/gather elements in the scatter/gather list. Each element is a structure of type SCATTER_GATHER_ELEMENT.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_TRANSFER_INFO_V1.ScatterGatherListSize
member.summary: The required size, in bytes, of the scatter/gather buffer. This buffer contains the scatter/gather list that describes the memory that is used to buffer I/O data during the DMA transfer. The scatter/gather buffer must be large enough to contain a SCATTER_GATHER_LIST structure and an array of SCATTER_GATHER_ELEMENT structures, plus additional data that is used internally by the operating system.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_TRANSFER_INFO_V2
member.summary: The allocation requirements for a scatter/gather list.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DMA_TRANSFER_INFO_V2.LogicalPageCount
member.summary: The number of logical pages.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DOMAIN_CONFIGURATION
member.summary: Contains information required to configure a domain. This structure is used by the IOMMU_DOMAIN_CONFIGURE callback function. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_domain_configuration

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DOMAIN_CONFIGURATION.Type
member.summary: A DOMAIN_CONFIGURATION_ARCH-type value that indicates the domain architecture.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DOMAIN_CONFIGURATION_ARM64
member.summary: Contains information required to configure a domain for an ARM64 system. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_domain_configuration_arm64

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DOMAIN_CONFIGURATION_X64
member.summary: Contains information required to configure a domain for an ARM64 system. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_domain_configuration_arm64

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DOMAIN_PASSWORD_INFORMATION
member.summary: The DOMAIN_PASSWORD_INFORMATION structure contains information about a domain's password policy, such as the minimum length for passwords and how unique passwords must be. It is used in the MSV1_0_CHANGEPASSWORD_RESPONSE structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/ntsecapi/ns-ntsecapi-domain_password_information

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DRAWITEMSTRUCT
member.summary: Provides information that the owner window uses to determine how to paint an owner-drawn control or menu item. The owner window of the owner-drawn control or menu item receives a pointer to this structure as the lParam parameter of the WM_DRAWITEM message. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-drawitemstruct

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DRAWTEXTPARAMS
member.summary: The DRAWTEXTPARAMS structure contains extended formatting options for the DrawTextEx function. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-drawtextparams

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DRAWTEXTPARAMS.cbSize
member.summary: The structure size, in bytes.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DRAWTEXTPARAMS.iTabLength
member.summary: The size of each tab stop, in units equal to the average character width.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DRAWTEXTPARAMS.iLeftMargin
member.summary: The left margin, in units equal to the average character width.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DRAWTEXTPARAMS.iRightMargin
member.summary: The right margin, in units equal to the average character width.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.DRAWTEXTPARAMS.uiLengthDrawn
member.summary: Receives the number of characters processed by DrawTextEx, including white-space characters. The number can be the length of the string or the index of the first line that falls below the drawing area. Note that DrawTextEx always processes the entire string if the DT_NOCLIP formatting flag is specified.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EFS_CERTIFICATE_BLOB
member.summary: Contains a certificate. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winefs/ns-winefs-efs_certificate_blob

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EFS_CERTIFICATE_BLOB.dwCertEncodingType
member.summary: A certificate encoding type. This member can be one of the following values. CRYPT_ASN_ENCODING CRYPT_NDR_ENCODING X509_ASN_ENCODING X509_NDR_ENCODING

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EFS_CERTIFICATE_BLOB.cbData
member.summary: The number of bytes in the pbData buffer.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EFS_CERTIFICATE_BLOB.pbData
member.summary: The binary certificate. The dwCertEncodingType member specifies the format for this certificate.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EFS_HASH_BLOB
member.summary: Contains a certificate hash. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winefs/ns-winefs-efs_hash_blob

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EFS_HASH_BLOB.cbData
member.summary: The number of bytes in the pbData buffer.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EFS_HASH_BLOB.pbData
member.summary: The certificate hash.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENABLE_TRACE_PARAMETERS
member.summary: The ENABLE_TRACE_PARAMETERS structure contains information used to enable a provider via EnableTraceEx2. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntrace/ns-evntrace-enable_trace_parameters

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENABLE_TRACE_PARAMETERS_V1
member.summary: The ENABLE_TRACE_PARAMETERS_V1 structure contains information used to enable a provider via EnableTraceEx2. This structure is obsolete. Use ENABLE_TRACE_PARAMETERS instead. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntrace/ns-evntrace-enable_trace_parameters_v1

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENCRYPTION_CERTIFICATE
member.summary: Contains a certificate and the SID of its owner. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winefs/ns-winefs-encryption_certificate

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENCRYPTION_CERTIFICATE.cbTotalLength
member.summary: The length of this structure, in bytes.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENCRYPTION_CERTIFICATE.pUserSid
member.summary: The SID of the user who owns the certificate.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENCRYPTION_CERTIFICATE.pCertBlob
member.summary: A pointer to an EFS_CERTIFICATE_BLOB structure.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENCRYPTION_CERTIFICATE_HASH
member.summary: Contains a certificate hash and display information for the certificate. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winefs/ns-winefs-encryption_certificate_hash

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENCRYPTION_CERTIFICATE_HASH.cbTotalLength
member.summary: The length of this structure, in bytes.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENCRYPTION_CERTIFICATE_HASH.pUserSid
member.summary: The SID of the user who owns the certificate.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENCRYPTION_CERTIFICATE_HASH.pHash
member.summary: A pointer to an EFS_HASH_BLOB structure.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENCRYPTION_CERTIFICATE_HASH.lpDisplayInformation
member.summary: User-displayable information for the certificate. This is usually the user's common name and universal principal name (UPN).

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENCRYPTION_CERTIFICATE_HASH_LIST
member.summary: Contains a list of certificate hashes. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winefs/ns-winefs-encryption_certificate_hash_list

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENCRYPTION_CERTIFICATE_HASH_LIST.nCert_Hash
member.summary: The number of certificate hashes in the list.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENCRYPTION_CERTIFICATE_HASH_LIST.pUsers
member.summary: A pointer to the first ENCRYPTION_CERTIFICATE_HASH structure in the list.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENCRYPTION_CERTIFICATE_LIST
member.summary: Contains a list of certificates. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winefs/ns-winefs-encryption_certificate_list

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENCRYPTION_CERTIFICATE_LIST.nCert_Hash
member.summary: The number of certificates in the list.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENCRYPTION_CERTIFICATE_LIST.pUsers
member.summary: A pointer to the first ENCRYPTION_CERTIFICATE structure in the list.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENLISTMENT_BASIC_INFORMATION
member.summary: The ENLISTMENT_BASIC_INFORMATION structure contains information about an enlistment object. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_enlistment_basic_information

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENLISTMENT_BASIC_INFORMATION.EnlistmentId
member.summary: A GUID that KTM has assigned to the enlistment object.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENLISTMENT_BASIC_INFORMATION.TransactionId
member.summary: A GUID that KTM has assigned to the transaction object that is associated with the enlistment object that the EnlistmentId member identifies.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENLISTMENT_BASIC_INFORMATION.ResourceManagerId
member.summary: A GUID that KTM has assigned to the resource manager that created the enlistment.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENUM_PAGE_FILE_INFORMATION
member.summary: Contains information about a pagefile. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/psapi/ns-psapi-enum_page_file_information

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENUM_PAGE_FILE_INFORMATION.cb
member.summary: The size of this structure, in bytes.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENUM_PAGE_FILE_INFORMATION.Reserved
member.summary: This member is reserved.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENUM_PAGE_FILE_INFORMATION.TotalSize
member.summary: The total size of the pagefile, in pages.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENUM_PAGE_FILE_INFORMATION.TotalInUse
member.summary: The current pagefile usage, in pages.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ENUM_PAGE_FILE_INFORMATION.PeakUsage
member.summary: The peak pagefile usage, in pages.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ETW_BUFFER_CALLBACK_INFORMATION
member.summary: Provided to the BufferCallback as the ConsumerInfo parameter and provides details on the current processing session. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntrace/ns-evntrace-etw_buffer_callback_information

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ETW_BUFFER_CALLBACK_INFORMATION.TraceHandle
member.summary: The TraceHandle for this processing session.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ETW_BUFFER_CALLBACK_INFORMATION.LogfileHeader
member.summary: TRACE_LOGFILE_HEADER structure containing trace processing status (previously-existing structure).

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ETW_BUFFER_CALLBACK_INFORMATION.BuffersRead
member.summary: The count of how many buffers have been processed up to this point.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ETW_BUFFER_CONTEXT
member.summary: The ETW_BUFFER_CONTEXT structure provides context information about the event. An instance of the ETW_BUFFER_CONTEXT structure is included in the EVENT_RECORD and EVENT_TRACE structures. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntrace/ns-evntrace-etw_buffer_context

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ETW_BUFFER_CONTEXT.LoggerId
member.summary: Identifier of the session that logged the event.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ETW_BUFFER_CONTEXT_DUMMY.ProcessorNumber
member.summary: The number of the CPU on which the provider process was running. The number is zero on a single-processor computer.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ETW_BUFFER_CONTEXT_DUMMY.Alignment
member.summary: Alignment between events (always eight).

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ETW_BUFFER_HEADER
member.summary: The header structure of an ETW buffer. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntrace/ns-evntrace-etw_buffer_header

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ETW_BUFFER_HEADER.Reserved1
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ETW_BUFFER_HEADER.TimeStamp
member.summary: The time when the buffer was flushed. It will be in the raw clock type of the session from which the buffer was collected (for example, QueryPerformanceCounter, CPU timestamp counter, or GetSystemTimeAsFileTime).

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ETW_BUFFER_HEADER.Reserved2
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ETW_BUFFER_HEADER.ClientContext
member.summary: Contains information about the processor and logger that generated this buffer. See ETW_BUFFER_CONTEXT.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ETW_BUFFER_HEADER.FilledBytes
member.summary: The size of the valid data in the buffer. This is the size of the ETW_BUFFER_HEADER and the event data. When a buffer is copied, it is common to only allocate enough memory to store the valid data (for example, only FilledBytes bytes are allocated and copied), so recipients of a buffer should not read beyond this offset.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ETW_BUFFER_HEADER.Reserved4
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ETW_OPEN_TRACE_OPTIONS
member.summary: Provides configuration parameters to OpenTraceFromBufferStream, OpenTraceFromFile, OpenTraceFromRealTimeLogger, OpenTraceFromRealTimeLoggerWithAllocationOptions functions. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntrace/ns-evntrace-etw_open_trace_options

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.ETW_TRACE_PARTITION_INFORMATION
member.summary: Contains partition information pulled from an ETW trace. Most commonly used as a return structure for QueryTraceProcessingHandle. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntrace/ns-evntrace-etw_trace_partition_information

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENTMSG
member.summary: Contains information about a hardware message sent to the system message queue. This structure is used to store message information for the JournalPlaybackProc callback function. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-eventmsg

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENTMSG.message
member.summary: The message.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENTMSG.paramL
member.summary: Additional information about the message. The exact meaning depends on the message value.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENTMSG.paramH
member.summary: Additional information about the message. The exact meaning depends on the message value.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENTMSG.time
member.summary: The time at which the message was posted.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENTMSG.hwnd
member.summary: A handle to the window to which the message was posted.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_ACCESS_RIGHTS
member.summary: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntcons/nf-evntcons-eventaccesscontrol

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_ACCESS_RIGHTS.WMIGUID_QUERY
member.summary: Allows the user to query information about the trace session. Set this permission on the session's GUID.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_ACCESS_RIGHTS.TRACELOG_CREATE_REALTIME
member.summary: Allows the user to start or update a real-time session. Set this permission on the session's GUID.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_ACCESS_RIGHTS.TRACELOG_CREATE_ONDISK
member.summary: Allows the user to start or update a session that writes events to a log file. Set this permission on the session's GUID.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_ACCESS_RIGHTS.TRACELOG_GUID_ENABLE
member.summary: Allows the user to enable the provider. Set this permission on the provider's GUID.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_ACCESS_RIGHTS.TRACELOG_ACCESS_KERNEL_LOGGER
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_ACCESS_RIGHTS.TRACELOG_LOG_EVENT
member.summary: Allows the user to log events to a trace session if session is running in SECURE mode (the session set the EVENT_TRACE_SECURE_MODE flag in the LogFileMode member of EVENT_TRACE_PROPERTIES).

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_ACCESS_RIGHTS.TRACELOG_ACCESS_REALTIME
member.summary: Allows a user to consume events in real-time. Set this permission on the session's GUID.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_ACCESS_RIGHTS.TRACELOG_REGISTER_GUIDS
member.summary: Allows the user to register the provider. Set this permission on the provider's GUID.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_DATA_DESCRIPTOR
member.summary: The EVENT_DATA_DESCRIPTOR structure defines a block of data that will be used in an ETW event. This structure is typically initialized using the EventDataDescCreate function. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntprov/ns-evntprov-event_data_descriptor

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_DESCRIPTOR
member.summary: The EVENT_DESCRIPTOR structure contains information (metadata) about an ETW event. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntprov/ns-evntprov-event_descriptor

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_EXTENDED_ITEM_EVENT_KEY
member.summary: Defines a unique event identifier. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntcons/ns-evntcons-event_extended_item_event_key

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_EXTENDED_ITEM_EVENT_KEY.Key
member.summary: The event key.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_EXTENDED_ITEM_INSTANCE
member.summary: Defines the relationship between events if TraceEventInstance was used to log related events. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntcons/ns-evntcons-event_extended_item_instance

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_EXTENDED_ITEM_INSTANCE.InstanceId

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_EXTENDED_ITEM_INSTANCE.ParentInstanceId
member.summary: A unique transaction identifier of a parent event if you are mapping a hierarchical relationship.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_EXTENDED_ITEM_INSTANCE.ParentGuid
member.summary: A GUID that uniquely identifies the provider that logged the event referenced by the ParentInstanceId member.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_EXTENDED_ITEM_PEBS_INDEX
member.summary: Defines a Processor Event Based Sampling (PEBS) index. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntcons/ns-evntcons-event_extended_item_pebs_index

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_EXTENDED_ITEM_PEBS_INDEX.PebsIndex
member.summary: The PEBS index.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_EXTENDED_ITEM_STACK_KEY32
member.summary: Defines an extended item stack key on a 32-bit computer. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntcons/ns-evntcons-event_extended_item_stack_key32

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_EXTENDED_ITEM_STACK_KEY32.MatchId
member.summary:
A unique identifier that you use to match the kernel-mode calls to the user-mode calls; the kernel-mode calls and user-mode calls are captured in separate events if the environment prevents both from being captured in the same event. If the kernel-mode and user-mode calls were captured in the same event, the value is zero.
Typically, on 32-bit computers, you can always capture both the kernel-mode and user-mode calls in the same event. However, if you use the frame pointer optimization compiler option, the stack may not be captured, captured incorrectly, or truncated.

The structure also contains registration handles for the event trace class and related parent event, which you use to trace instances of a transaction or hierarchical relationships between related events. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntrace/ns-evntrace-event_instance_header

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_RECORD.ExtendedData
member.summary: One or more extended data items that ETW collects. The extended data includes some items, such as the security identifier (SID) of the user that logged the event, only if the controller sets the EnableProperty parameter passed to the EnableTraceEx or EnableTraceEx2 function. The extended data includes other items, such as the related activity identifier and decoding information for trace logging, regardless whether the controller sets the EnableProperty parameter passed to EnableTraceEx or EnableTraceEx2.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EVENT_RECORD.UserData
member.summary: Event specific data. To parse this data, see Retrieving Event Data Using TDH. If the Flags member of EVENT_HEADER contains EVENT_HEADER_FLAG_STRING_ONLY, the data is a null-terminated Unicode string that you do not need TDH to parse.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EXPLICIT_ACCESS_A
member.summary: The EXPLICIT_ACCESS structure defines access control information for a specified trustee. Access control functions, such as SetEntriesInAcl and GetExplicitEntriesFromAcl, use this structure to describe the information in an access control entry(ACE) of an access control list (ACL). https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/accctrl/ns-accctrl-explicit_access_a

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EXTENDED_CREATE_INFORMATION
member.summary: The EXTENDED_CREATE_INFORMATION structure is the EaBuffer field in NtCreateFile when the FILE_CONTAINS_EXTENDED_CREATE_INFORMATION flag is set in NtCreateFile's CreateOption parameter. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-extended_create_information

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EXTENDED_CREATE_INFORMATION.ExtendedCreateFlags
member.summary:
Flags for the extended create. ExtendedCreateFlags can be one of the following values. When either of these flags are specified, NtCreateFile's file object is marked as opened for copy intent in its FileObjectExtension. Filters can check for this stored state by calling IoCheckFileObjectOpenedAsCopySource or IoCheckFileObjectOpenedAsCopyDestination
EX_CREATE_FLAG_FILE_SOURCE_OPEN_FOR_COPY 0x00000001 Signals that the file is being opened as the source file for a file copy. EX_CREATE_FLAG_FILE_DEST_OPEN_FOR_COPY 0x00000002 Signals that the file is being opened as the destination file for a file copy.
The presence of one of the above flags is not enough to ensure that read/writes (I/O operations) on the file object are trustworthy, as any user-mode process can provide these flags at create time.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EXTENDED_CREATE_INFORMATION.EaBuffer
member.summary: Pointer to the extended attributes buffer.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EXTENDED_CREATE_INFORMATION.EaLength
member.summary: Length of the buffer that EaBuffer points to.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EXT_DELETE_PARAMETERS
member.summary: The EXT_DELETE_PARAMETERS structure contains an extended set of parameters for the ExDeleteTimer routine. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_ext_delete_parameters

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EXT_DELETE_PARAMETERS.Version
member.summary: The version number of this EXT_DELETE_PARAMETERS structure. The ExInitializeDeleteTimerParameters routine sets this member to the correct version number.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EXT_DELETE_PARAMETERS.Reserved
member.summary: Set to zero. The ExInitializeDeleteTimerParameters routine sets this member to zero.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EXT_DELETE_PARAMETERS.DeleteCallback
member.summary:
A pointer to a driver-implemented ExTimerDeleteCallback callback routine. The operating system calls this routine when the timer is deleted. This parameter is optional and can be NULL if no timer-deletion callback routine is needed.
The ExInitializeDeleteTimerParameters routine sets this member to NULL.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EXT_DELETE_PARAMETERS.DeleteContext
member.summary: A context value for the timer-deletion callback routine. The operating system passes this value as a parameter to the timer-deletion callback routine, if one is specified. This parameter is typically a pointer to a caller-defined structure that contains context information used by the callback routine. This parameter is optional and can be set to NULL if no context information is needed. The ExInitializeDeleteTimerParameters routine sets this member to NULL.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EXT_SET_PARAMETERS
member.summary: The EXT_SET_PARAMETERS structure contains an extended set of parameters for the ExSetTimer routine. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_ext_set_parameters_v0

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EXT_SET_PARAMETERS.Version
member.summary: The version number of this EXT_SET_PARAMETERS structure. The ExInitializeSetTimerParameters routine sets this member to the correct version number.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EXT_SET_PARAMETERS.Reserved
member.summary: Set to zero. The ExInitializeSetTimerParameters routine sets this member to zero.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.EXT_SET_PARAMETERS.NoWakeTolerance
member.summary:
The maximum time, in system time units (100-nanosecond intervals), that the timer can wait to wake the processor after the timer reaches its expiration time. Only after the processor wakes can the timer expire. If a timer is set to expire when the processor is in a low-power state, the timer will not wake the processor to expire until the expiration time plus the NoWakeTolerance delay is exceeded. As an option, a driver can set this member to EX_TIMER_UNLIMITED_TOLERANCE, which indicates that the timer never wakes the processor and, thus, cannot expire until the processor wakes for some other reason.
Do not set this member to a negative value (other than EX_TIMER_UNLIMITED_TOLERANCE). Otherwise, the routine bug checks.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILETIME
