member.summary: Specifies he time that the file was last written to.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_NETWORK_OPEN_INFORMATION.ChangeTime
member.summary: Specifies the time that the file was last changed.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_NETWORK_OPEN_INFORMATION.AllocationSize
member.summary: Specifies the file allocation size, in bytes. Usually, this value is a multiple of the sector or cluster size of the underlying physical device.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_NETWORK_OPEN_INFORMATION.EndOfFile
member.summary: Specifies the absolute end-of-file position as a byte offset from the start of the file. EndOfFile specifies the byte offset to the end of the file. Because this value is zero-based, it actually refers to the first free byte in the file. In other words, EndOfFile is the offset to the byte immediately following the last valid byte in the file.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_NETWORK_OPEN_INFORMATION.FileAttributes
member.summary: Specifies one or more FILE_ATTRIBUTE_XXX flags.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT
member.summary: The FILE_OBJECT structure is used by the system to represent a file object. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_file_object

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.Type
member.summary: A read-only member used by the system to indicate that the object is a file object. If the object is a file object, the value of this member is 5.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.Size
member.summary: A read-only member that specifies the size, in bytes, of the file object. This size does not include the file object extension, if one is present.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.DeviceObject
member.summary: A pointer to the device object on which the file is opened.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.Vpb
member.summary: A pointer to the volume parameter block associated with the file object. Note that if the Vpb member is non-NULL, the file resides on a mounted volume.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.FsContext
member.summary:
A pointer to whatever optional state a driver maintains about the file object; otherwise, NULL. For file system drivers, this member must point to a FSRTL_ADVANCED_FCB_HEADER header structure that is contained within a file-system-specific structure; otherwise system instability can result. Usually, this header structure is embedded in a file control block (FCB). However, on some file systems that support multiple data streams, such as NTFS, this header structure is a stream control block (SCB).
In a WDM device stack, only the functional device object (FDO) can use the two context pointers. File system drivers share this member across multiple opens to the same data stream.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.FsContext2
member.summary: A pointer to whatever additional state a driver maintains about the file object; otherwise, NULL. This member is opaque for drivers in the file system stack because the underlying file system utilizes this member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.SectionObjectPointer
member.summary: A pointer to the file object's read-only section object. This member is set only by file systems and used for Cache Manager interaction.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.PrivateCacheMap
member.summary: An opaque member, set only by file systems, that points to handle-specific information and that is used for Cache Manager interaction.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.FinalStatus
member.summary: A read-only member that is used, in certain synchronous cases, to indicate the final status of the file object's I/O request.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.RelatedFileObject
member.summary: A pointer to a FILE_OBJECT structure used to indicate that the current file object has been opened relative to an already open file object.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.LockOperation
member.summary: A read-only member. If FALSE, a lock operation (NtLockFile) has never been performed on the file object.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.DeletePending
member.summary: A read-only member. If TRUE, a delete operation for the file associated with the file object exists. If FALSE, there currently is no pending delete operation for the file object.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.ReadAccess
member.summary: A read-only member. If TRUE, the file associated with the file object has been opened for read access. If FALSE, the file has been opened without read access. This information is used when checking and/or setting the share access of the file.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.WriteAccess
member.summary: A read-only member. If TRUE, the file associated with the file object has been opened for write access. If FALSE, the file has been opened without write access. This information is used when checking and/or setting the share access of the file.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.DeleteAccess
member.summary: A read-only member. If TRUE, the file associated with the file object has been opened for delete access. If FALSE, the file has been opened without delete access. This information is used when checking and/or setting the share access of the file.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.SharedRead
member.summary: A read-only member. If TRUE, the file associated with the file object has been opened for read sharing access. If FALSE, the file has been opened without read sharing access. This information is used when checking and/or setting the share access of the file.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.SharedWrite
member.summary: A read-only member. If TRUE, the file associated with the file object has been opened for write sharing access. If FALSE, the file has been opened without write sharing access. This information is used when checking and/or setting the share access of the file.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.SharedDelete
member.summary: A read-only member. If TRUE, the file associated with the file object has been opened for delete sharing access. If FALSE, the file has been opened without delete sharing access. This information is used when checking and/or setting the share access of the file.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.Flags
member.summary: A read-only member used by the system to hold one or more (a bitwise inclusive OR combination) of the following private flag values.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.FileName
member.summary: A UNICODE_STRING structure whose Buffer member points to a read-only Unicode string that holds the name of the file opened on the volume.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.CurrentByteOffset
member.summary: A read-only member that specifies the file offset, in bytes, associated with the file object.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.Waiters
member.summary: A read-only member used by the system to count the number of outstanding waiters on a file object opened for synchronous access.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.Busy
member.summary: A read-only member used by the system to indicate whether a file object opened for synchronous access is currently busy.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.LastLock
member.summary: An opaque pointer to the last lock applied to the file object.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.Lock
member.summary: An opaque member used by the system to hold a file object event lock. The event lock is used to control synchronous access to the file object. Applicable only to file objects that are opened for synchronous access.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.Event
member.summary: An opaque member used by the system to hold an event object for the file object. The event object is used to signal the completion of an I/O request on the file object if no user event was supplied or a synchronous API was called.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.CompletionContext
member.summary: An opaque pointer to completion port information (port pointer and key) associated with the file object, if any.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.IrpListLock
member.summary: An opaque pointer to a KSPIN_LOCK structure that serves as the spin lock used to synchronize access to the file object's IRP list.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.IrpList
member.summary: An opaque pointer to the head of the IRP list associated with the file object.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_OBJECT.FileObjectExtension
member.summary: An opaque pointer to the file object's file object extension (FOBX) structure. The FOBX structure contains various opaque contexts used internally as well as the per-file object contexts available through FsRtlXxx routines.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_POSITION_INFORMATION
member.summary: The FILE_POSITION_INFORMATION structure is used as an argument to routines that query or set file information. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_file_position_information

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_POSITION_INFORMATION.CurrentByteOffset
member.summary: The byte offset of the current file pointer.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_STANDARD_INFORMATION
member.summary: The FILE_STANDARD_INFORMATION structure is used as an argument to routines that query or set file information. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_file_standard_information

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_STANDARD_INFORMATION.AllocationSize
member.summary: The file allocation size in bytes. Usually, this value is a multiple of the sector or cluster size of the underlying physical device.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_STANDARD_INFORMATION.EndOfFile
member.summary: The end of file location as a byte offset.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_STANDARD_INFORMATION.NumberOfLinks
member.summary: The number of hard links to the file.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_STANDARD_INFORMATION.DeletePending
member.summary: The delete pending status. TRUE indicates that a file deletion has been requested.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FILE_STANDARD_INFORMATION.Directory
member.summary: The file directory status. TRUE indicates the file object represents a directory.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FPGA_CONTROL_INTERFACE
member.summary: Reserved for future use. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_fpga_control_interface

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FPGA_CONTROL_INTERFACE.Size
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of this structure.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FPGA_CONTROL_INTERFACE.Version
member.summary: The driver-defined interface version. The current version of this interface is FPGA_CONTROL_INTERFACE_VERSION.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FPGA_CONTROL_INTERFACE.Context
member.summary: A pointer to interface-specific context information.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FPGA_CONTROL_INTERFACE.InterfaceReference
member.summary: A pointer to an InterfaceReference routine that increments the interface's reference count.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FPGA_CONTROL_INTERFACE.InterfaceDereference
member.summary: A pointer to an InterfaceDereference routine that decrements the interface's reference count.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FPGA_CONTROL_INTERFACE.BusScan
member.summary: A pointer to a FPGA_BUS_SCAN callback function that triggers a bus scan at the parent of the FPGA device.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FPGA_CONTROL_INTERFACE.ControlLink
member.summary: A pointer to a FPGA_CONTROL_LINK callback function that enables or disables the link between the given FPGA device and its parent bridge.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FPGA_CONTROL_INTERFACE.ControlConfigSpace
member.summary: A pointer to a FPGA_CONTROL_CONFIG_SPACE callback function that enables or disables the access to the configuration space of the FPGA device.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FPGA_CONTROL_INTERFACE.ControlErrorReporting
member.summary: A pointer to a FPGA_CONTROL_ERROR_REPORTING callback function that toggles the error reporting for the FPGA device and its parent bridge.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FUNCTION_LEVEL_DEVICE_RESET_PARAMETERS
member.summary: The FUNCTION_LEVEL_DEVICE_RESET_PARAMETER structure is used as an argument to the DeviceReset routine of the GUID_DEVICE_RESET_INTERFACE_STANDARD interface. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_function_level_device_reset_parameters

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FUNCTION_LEVEL_DEVICE_RESET_PARAMETERS.Size
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of this structure.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FUNCTION_LEVEL_DEVICE_RESET_PARAMETERS.DeviceResetCompletion
member.summary:
Pointer to a completion callback routine to be called when a function-level device reset is completed. The callback must enter and exit at the same IRQL.
The function prototype for this callback routine is defined as follows: VOID (*PDEVICE_RESET_COMPLETION)( _In_ NTSTATUS Status, _Inout_opt_ PVOID Context);

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.FUNCTION_LEVEL_DEVICE_RESET_PARAMETERS.CompletionContext
member.summary: Points to a caller-supplied context structure to be passed to the DeviceResetCompletion callback.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.GENERIC_MAPPING
member.summary: The GENERIC_MAPPING structure describes the ACCESS_MASK value of specific access rights associated with each type of generic access right.

member.summary: Describes the specific access rights corresponding to the GENERIC_READ access right.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.GENERIC_MAPPING.GenericWrite
member.summary: Describes the specific access rights corresponding to the GENERIC_WRITE access right.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.GENERIC_MAPPING.GenericExecute
member.summary: Describes the specific access rights corresponding to the GENERIC_EXECUTE access right.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.GENERIC_MAPPING.GenericAll
member.summary: Describes the specific access rights corresponding to the GENERIC_ALL access right.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.GUITHREADINFO
member.summary: Contains information about a GUI thread. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-guithreadinfo

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HEAP_SUMMARY
member.summary: Represents a heap summary retrieved with a call to HeapSummary https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/heapapi/ns-heapapi-heap_summary

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HEAP_SUMMARY.cb
member.summary: The size of this data structure, in bytes. Set this member to sizeof(HEAP_SUMMARY).

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HEAP_SUMMARY.cbCommitted

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTPAPI_VERSION
member.summary: The HTTPAPI_VERSION structure defines the version of the HTTP Server API. This is not to be confused with the version of the HTTP protocol used, which is stored in an HTTP_VERSION structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-httpapi_version

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_BANDWIDTH_LIMIT_INFO
member.summary: The HTTP_BANDWIDTH_LIMIT_INFO structure is used to set or query the bandwidth throttling limit. This structure must be used when setting or querying the HttpServerBandwidthProperty on a URL Group or server session. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_bandwidth_limit_info

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_BINDING_INFO
member.summary: The HTTP_BINDING_INFO structure is used to associate a URL Group with a request queue. This structure must be used when setting or querying the HttpServerBindingProperty on a URL Group. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_binding_info

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_BYTE_RANGE
member.summary: The HTTP_BYTE_RANGE structure is used to specify a byte range within a cached response fragment, file, or other data block. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_byte_range

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_CACHE_POLICY
member.summary: The HTTP_CACHE_POLICY structure is used to define a cache policy associated with a cached response fragment. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_cache_policy

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_CHANNEL_BIND_INFO
member.summary: The HTTP_CHANNEL_BIND_INFO structure is used to set or query channel bind authentication. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_channel_bind_info

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_CONNECTION_LIMIT_INFO
member.summary: The HTTP_CONNECTION_LIMIT_INFO structure is used to set or query the limit on the maximum number of outstanding connections for a URL Group. This structure must be used when setting or querying the HttpServerConnectionsProperty on a URL Group. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_connection_limit_info

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_CONNECTION_LIMIT_INFO.Flags
member.summary: The HTTP_PROPERTY_FLAGS structure specifying whether the property is present.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_CONNECTION_LIMIT_INFO.MaxConnections
member.summary: The number of connections allowed. Setting this value to HTTP_LIMIT_INFINITE allows an unlimited number of connections.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_COOKED_URL
member.summary: The HTTP_COOKED_URL structure contains a validated, canonical, UTF-16 Unicode-encoded URL request string together with pointers into it and element lengths. This is the string that the HTTP Server API matches against registered UrlPrefix strings in order to route the request appropriately. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_cooked_url

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_DATA_CHUNK
member.summary: The HTTP_DATA_CHUNK structure represents an individual block of data either in memory, in a file, or in the HTTP Server API response-fragment cache. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_data_chunk

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_DELEGATE_REQUEST_PROPERTY_INFO
member.summary: Describes additional property information when delegating a request. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_delegate_request_property_info

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_FLOWRATE_INFO
member.summary: The transfer rate of a response https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_flowrate_info

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_KNOWN_HEADER
member.summary: The HTTP_KNOWN_HEADER structure contains the header values for a known header from an HTTP request or HTTP response. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_known_header

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_LISTEN_ENDPOINT_INFO
member.summary: Controls whether IP-based URLs should listen on the specific IP address or on a wildcard. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_listen_endpoint_info

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_LOGGING_INFO
member.summary: The HTTP_LOGGING_INFO structure is used to enable server side logging on a URL Group or on a server session. This structure must be used when setting or querying the HttpServerLoggingProperty on a URL Group or server session. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_logging_info

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_LOG_DATA
member.summary: The HTTP_LOG_DATA structure contains a value that specifies the type of the log data. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_log_data

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_LOG_FIELDS_DATA
member.summary: The HTTP_LOG_FIELDS_DATA structure is used to pass the fields that are logged for an HTTP response when WC3 logging is enabled. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_log_fields_data

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_MULTIPLE_KNOWN_HEADERS
member.summary: The HTTP_MULTIPLE_KNOWN_HEADERS structure specifies the headers that are included in an HTTP response when more than one header is required. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_multiple_known_headers

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_PROPERTY_FLAGS
member.summary: The HTTP_PROPERTY_FLAGS structure is used by the property configuration structures to enable or disable a property on a configuration object when setting property configurations. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_property_flags

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_QOS_SETTING_INFO
member.summary: The HTTP_QOS_SETTING_INFO structurecontains information about a QOS setting. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_qos_setting_info

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_REQUEST_AUTH_INFO
member.summary: The HTTP_REQUEST_AUTH_INFO structure contains the authentication status of the request with a handle to the client token that the receiving process can use to impersonate the authenticated client. This structure is contained in the HTTP_REQUEST_INFO structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_request_auth_info

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_REQUEST_CHANNEL_BIND_STATUS
member.summary: The HTTP_REQUEST_CHANNEL_BIND_STATUS structure contains secure channel endpoint binding information. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_request_channel_bind_status

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_REQUEST_HEADERS
member.summary: The HTTP_REQUEST_HEADERS structure contains headers sent with an HTTP request. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_request_headers

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_REQUEST_INFO
member.summary: The HTTP_REQUEST_INFO structure extends the HTTP_REQUEST structure with additional information about the request. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_request_info

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_REQUEST_INFO.InfoType
member.summary: A member of the HTTP_REQUEST_INFO_TYPE enumeration specifying the type of information contained in this structure.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_REQUEST_INFO.InfoLength
member.summary: The length, in bytes, of the pInfo member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_REQUEST_INFO.pInfo
member.summary: A pointer to the HTTP_REQUEST_AUTH_INFO structure when the InfoType member is HttpRequestInfoTypeAuth; otherwise NULL.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_REQUEST_PROPERTY_STREAM_ERROR
member.summary: The HTTP_REQUEST_PROPERTY_STREAM_ERROR structure represents an HTTP/2 or HTTP/3 stream error code. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_request_property_stream_error

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_REQUEST_V1
member.summary: Uses the HTTP_REQUEST structure to return data associated with a specific request. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_request_v1

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_REQUEST_V2
member.summary: The HTTP_REQUEST_V2 structure extends the HTTP_REQUEST_V1 request structure with more information about the request. Do not use HTTP_REQUEST_V2 directly in your code; use HTTP_REQUEST instead to ensure that the proper version, based on the operating system the code is compiled under, is used. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_request_v2

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_RESPONSE_V1
member.summary: The HTTP_RESPONSE_V1 structure contains data associated with an HTTP response. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_response_v1

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_RESPONSE_HEADERS
member.summary: The HTTP_RESPONSE_HEADERS structure contains the headers sent with an HTTP response. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_response_headers

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_RESPONSE_INFO
member.summary: The HTTP_RESPONSE_INFO structure extends the HTTP_RESPONSE structure with additional information for the response. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_response_info

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVER_AUTHENTICATION_BASIC_PARAMS
member.summary: The HTTP_SERVER_AUTHENTICATION_BASIC_PARAMS structure contains the information for Basic authentication on a URL Group. This structure is contained in the HTTP_SERVER_AUTHENTICATION_INFO structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_server_authentication_basic_params

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVER_AUTHENTICATION_DIGEST_PARAMS
member.summary: The HTTP_SERVER_AUTHENTICATION_DIGEST_PARAMS structure contains the information for digest authentication on a URL Group. This structure is contained in the HTTP_SERVER_AUTHENTICATION_INFO structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_server_authentication_digest_params

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVER_AUTHENTICATION_INFO
member.summary: The HTTP_SERVER_AUTHENTICATION_INFO structure is used to enable server-side authentication on a URL group or server session. This structure is also used to query the existing authentication schemes enabled for a URL group or server session. This structure must be used when setting or querying the HttpServerAuthenticationProperty on a URL group, or server session. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_server_authentication_info

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_BINDING_A
member.summary: The HTTP_SERVICE_BINDING_A structure provides Service Principle Name (SPN) in ASCII. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_service_binding_a

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_BINDING_BASE
member.summary: The HTTP_SERVICE_BINDING_BASE structure is a placeholder for the HTTP_SERVICE_BINDING_A structure and the HTTP_SERVICE_BINDING_W structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_service_binding_base

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_BINDING_BASE.Type
member.summary: Pointer to an HTTP_SERVICE_BINDING_TYPE value that indicates whether the data is in ASCII or Unicode.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_CACHE_SET
member.summary: Used in the pConfigInformation parameter of the HttpSetServiceConfiguration function. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_service_config_cache_set

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_IP_LISTEN_PARAM
member.summary: The HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_IP_LISTEN_PARAM structure is used to specify an IP address to be added to or deleted from the list of IP addresses to which the HTTP service binds. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_service_config_ip_listen_param

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_IP_LISTEN_QUERY
member.summary: The HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_IP_LISTEN_QUERY structure is used by HttpQueryServiceConfiguration to return a list of the Internet Protocol (IP) addresses to which the HTTP service binds. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_service_config_ip_listen_query

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_SSL_CCS_KEY
member.summary: Serves as the key by which identifies the SSL certificate record that specifies that Http.sys should consult the Centralized Certificate Store (CCS) store to find certificates if the port receives a Transport Layer Security (TLS) handshake. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_service_config_ssl_ccs_key

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_SSL_CCS_QUERY
member.summary: Specifies a Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) configuration to query for an SSL Centralized Certificate Store (CCS) record on the port when you call the HttpQueryServiceConfiguration function. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_service_config_ssl_ccs_query

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_SSL_CCS_SET
member.summary: Represents the SSL certificate record that specifies that Http.sys should consult the Centralized Certificate Store (CCS) store to find certificates if the port receives a Transport Layer Security (TLS) handshake. Use this structure to add, delete, retrieve, or update that SSL certificate. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_service_config_ssl_ccs_set

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_SSL_KEY
member.summary: The HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_SSL_KEY structure serves as the key by which a given Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) certificate record is identified. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_service_config_ssl_key

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_SSL_KEY.pIpPort
member.summary: Pointer to a sockaddr structure that contains the Internet Protocol (IP) address with which this SSL certificate is associated.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_SSL_PARAM
member.summary: The HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_SSL_PARAM structure defines a record in the SSL configuration store. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_service_config_ssl_param

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_SSL_QUERY
member.summary: The HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_SSL_QUERY structure is used to specify a particular record to query in the SSL configuration store. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_service_config_ssl_query

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_SSL_SET
member.summary: The HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_SSL_SET structure is used to add a new record to the SSL store or retrieve an existing record from it. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_service_config_ssl_set

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_SSL_SNI_KEY
member.summary: The HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_SSL_SNI_KEY structure serves as the key by which a given Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) Server Name Indication (SNI) certificate record is identified in the SSL SNI store. It appears in the HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_SSL_SNI_SET and the HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_SSL_SNI_QUERY structures, and is passed as the pConfigInformation parameter to HttpDeleteServiceConfiguration, HttpQueryServiceConfiguration, and HttpSetServiceConfiguration when the ConfigId parameter is set to HttpServiceConfigSslSniCertInfo. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_service_config_ssl_sni_key

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_SSL_SNI_QUERY
member.summary: The HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_SSL_SNI_QUERY structure is used to specify a particular Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) Server Name Indication (SNI) certificate record to query in the SSL SNI store. It is passed to the HttpQueryServiceConfiguration function using the pInputConfigInfo parameter when the ConfigId parameter is set to HttpServiceConfigSslSniCertInfo. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_service_config_ssl_sni_query

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_SSL_SNI_SET
member.summary: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_service_config_ssl_sni_set

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_TIMEOUT_SET
member.summary: The HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_TIMEOUT_SET structure is used to set the HTTP Server API wide timeout value. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_service_config_timeout_set

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_URLACL_KEY
member.summary: The HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_URLACL_KEY structure is used to specify a particular reservation record in the URL namespace reservation store. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_service_config_urlacl_key

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_URLACL_PARAM
member.summary: The HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_URLACL_PARAM structure is used to specify the permissions associated with a particular record in the URL namespace reservation store. It is a member of the HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_URLACL_SET structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_service_config_urlacl_param

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_URLACL_QUERY
member.summary: The HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_URLACL_QUERY structure is used to specify a particular reservation record to query in the URL namespace reservation store. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_service_config_urlacl_query

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SERVICE_CONFIG_URLACL_SET
member.summary: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_service_config_urlacl_set

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SSL_CLIENT_CERT_INFO
member.summary: The HTTP_SSL_CLIENT_CERT_INFO structure contains data about a Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) client certificate that can be used to determine whether the certificate is valid. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_ssl_client_cert_info

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_SSL_INFO
member.summary: The HTTP_SSL_INFO structure contains data for a connection that uses Secure Sockets Layer (SSL), obtained through the SSL handshake. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_ssl_info

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_STATE_INFO
member.summary: The HTTP_STATE_INFO structure is used to enable or disable a Server Session or URL Group. This structure must be used when setting or querying the HttpServerStateProperty on a URL Group or Server Session. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_state_info

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_TIMEOUT_LIMIT_INFO
member.summary: The HTTP_TIMEOUT_LIMIT_INFO structure defines the application-specific connection timeout limits. This structure must be used when setting or querying the HttpServerTimeoutsProperty on a URL Group, server session, or request queue. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_timeout_limit_info

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_TRANSPORT_ADDRESS
member.summary: The HTTP_TRANSPORT_ADDRESS structure specifies the addresses (local and remote) used for a particular HTTP connection. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_transport_address

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_TRANSPORT_ADDRESS.pRemoteAddress
member.summary: A pointer to the remote IP address associated with this connection. For more information about how to access this address, see the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_TRANSPORT_ADDRESS.pLocalAddress
member.summary: A pointer to the local IP address associated with this connection.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_UNKNOWN_HEADER
member.summary: The HTTP_UNKNOWN_HEADER structure contains the name and value for a header in an HTTP request or response whose name does not appear in the enumeration. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_unknown_header

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HTTP_VERSION
member.summary: The HTTP_VERSION structure defines a version of the HTTP protocol that a request requires or a response provides. This is not to be confused with the version of the HTTP Server API used, which is stored in an HTTPAPI_VERSION structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_version

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HWPROFILE_CHANGE_NOTIFICATION
member.summary: The HWPROFILE_CHANGE_NOTIFICATION structure describes an event related to a hardware profile configuration change. The PnP manager sends this structure to a driver that registered a callback routine for notification of EventCategoryHardwareProfileChange events. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_hwprofile_change_notification

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HWPROFILE_CHANGE_NOTIFICATION.Version
member.summary: Specifies the version of the data structure, currently 1.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HWPROFILE_CHANGE_NOTIFICATION.Size
member.summary: Specifies the size of the structure, in bytes including the size of the standard first three members plus the event-specific data.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.HWPROFILE_CHANGE_NOTIFICATION.Event
member.summary: Specifies a GUID identifying the event: GUID_HWPROFILE_QUERY_CHANGE, GUID_HWPROFILE_CHANGE_COMPLETE, or GUID_HWPROFILE_CHANGE_CANCELLED. The GUIDs are defined in Wdmguid.h.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IMAGE_POLICY_ENTRY
member.summary: This structure is not supported. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_image_policy_entry

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IMAGE_POLICY_METADATA
member.summary: This structure is not supported. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_image_policy_metadata

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.INPUT_INJECTION_VALUE
member.summary: Contains the input injection details. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-input_injection_value

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.INPUT_MAPPING_ELEMENT
member.summary: Contains the input mapping IDs for a device. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_input_mapping_element

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.INPUT_MAPPING_ELEMENT.InputMappingId
member.summary: The input mapping ID for a device.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.INPUT_MESSAGE_SOURCE
member.summary: Contains information about the source of the input message. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-input_message_source

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.INTERFACE
member.summary: The INTERFACE structure describes an interface that is exported by a driver for use by other drivers. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_interface

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.INTERFACE.Size
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of a structure defining a driver interface, including this structure and interface-specific members.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.INTERFACE.Version
member.summary: Driver-defined interface version.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.INTERFACE.Context
member.summary: Pointer to interface-specific context information.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.INTERFACE.InterfaceReference
member.summary: Pointer to a driver-supplied InterfaceReference routine that increments the interface's reference count.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.INTERFACE.InterfaceDereference
member.summary: Pointer to a driver-supplied InterfaceDereference routine that decrements the interface's reference count.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DEVICE_CREATION_CONFIGURATION
member.summary: IOMMU_DEVICE_CREATION_CONFIGURATION describes a configuration or list of configurations to be used as part of creation and initialization of an IOMMU_DMA_DEVICE. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-iommu_device_creation_configuration

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DEVICE_CREATION_CONFIGURATION.NextConfiguration
member.summary: Optional list to provide additional configurations.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DEVICE_CREATION_CONFIGURATION.ConfigType
member.summary: An enum describing which configuration is represented. See IOMMU_DEVICE_CREATION_CONFIGURATION_TYPE.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DEVICE_CREATION_CONFIGURATION_UNION.Acpi
member.summary: If (ConfigType == IommuDeviceCreationConfigTypeAcpi), provides the input parameters necessary for device creation.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DEVICE_CREATION_CONFIGURATION_UNION.DeviceId
member.summary: Defines the PVOID member DeviceId.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DEVICE_CREATION_CONFIGURATION_ACPI
member.summary: IOMMU_DEVICE_CREATION_CONFIGURATION_ACPI provides the ACPI-specific configuration parameters of a IOMMU_DEVICE_CREATION_CONFIGURATION structure, which is provided for creation of an ACPI-type IOMMU_DMA_DEVICE. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-iommu_device_creation_configuration_acpi

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DEVICE_CREATION_CONFIGURATION_ACPI.InputMappingBase
member.summary: Provides the input mapping base for the device's desired stream.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DEVICE_CREATION_CONFIGURATION_ACPI.MappingsCount
member.summary: Provides the count of mappings beginning at the base.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DMA_DOMAIN_CREATION_FLAGS
member.summary: The IOMMU_DMA_DOMAIN_CREATION_FLAGS structure defines configuration flags for a domain being created by IOMMU_DOMAIN_CREATE_EX. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-iommu_dma_domain_creation_flags

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DMA_DOMAIN_CREATION_FLAGS.u
member.summary: All flags are currently reserved. This field must be zero.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DMA_DOMAIN_CREATION_FLAGS.AsUlonglong
member.summary: Represents all flags as a single ULONGLONG.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DMA_LOGICAL_ADDRESS_TOKEN
member.summary: The IOMMU_DMA_LOGICAL_ADDRESS_TOKEN represents a reserved contiguous logical address range created by IOMMU_RESERVE_LOGICAL_ADDRESS_RANGE. Logical address tokens guarantee that the logical address represented has all of its associated page tables allocated ahead of time, ensuring that future mappings to this region will not fail due to low memory conditions. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-iommu_dma_logical_address_token

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DMA_LOGICAL_ADDRESS_TOKEN.LogicalAddressBase
member.summary: Represents the base address of the logical address range.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DMA_LOGICAL_ADDRESS_TOKEN.Size
member.summary: Represents the size, in bytes, of the logical address range.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DMA_LOGICAL_ADDRESS_TOKEN_MAPPED_SEGMENT
member.summary: The IOMMU_DMA_LOGICAL_ADDRESS_TOKEN_MAPPED_SEGMENT represents a mapped portion of an IOMMU_DMA_LOGICAL_ADDRESS_TOKEN. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-iommu_dma_logical_address_token_mapped_segment

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DMA_LOGICAL_ADDRESS_TOKEN_MAPPED_SEGMENT.OwningToken
member.summary: Provides a pointer to the logical address token that this mapped segment belongs to.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DMA_LOGICAL_ADDRESS_TOKEN_MAPPED_SEGMENT.Offset
member.summary: The offset, in bytes, into the logical address token of the mapped region.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DMA_LOGICAL_ADDRESS_TOKEN_MAPPED_SEGMENT.Size
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the mapped region within the logical address token.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DMA_LOGICAL_ALLOCATOR_CONFIG
member.summary: The IOMMU_DMA_LOGICAL_ALLOCATOR_CONFIG structure contains information required to configure a logical allocator. This structure is used by IOMMU_DOMAIN_CREATE_EX to create a logical allocator attached to the created [IOMMU_DMA_DOMAIN]. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-iommu_dma_logical_allocator_config

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DMA_LOGICAL_ALLOCATOR_CONFIG.LogicalAllocatorType
member.summary: An IOMMU_DMA_LOGICAL_ALLOCATOR_TYPE value that indicates the type of logical allocator to be created.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DMA_LOGICAL_ALLOCATOR_CONFIG_UNION.BuddyAllocatorConfig
member.summary: Provides configuration information specific to the HAL Buddy Allocator.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DMA_RESERVED_REGION
member.summary: The IOMMU_DMA_RESERVED_REGION structure describes a region of memory that needs to be marked as reserved during domain creation. This structure is used by IOMMU_DOMAIN_CREATE_EX. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-iommu_dma_reserved_region

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DMA_RESERVED_REGION.RegionNext
member.summary: Provides a pointer to the next reserved region.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DMA_RESERVED_REGION.Base
member.summary: Provides the base address of the region to be reserved. Must be page-aligned.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DMA_RESERVED_REGION.NumberOfPages
member.summary: Provides the number of pages to be reserved.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_DMA_RESERVED_REGION.ShouldMap
member.summary: Provides whether the reserved region should be identity mapped. If not, the region will not be mapped into the domain's page table at all.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_INTERFACE_STATE_CHANGE_FIELDS
member.summary: IOMMU_INTERFACE_STATE_CHANGE_FIELDS represents the fields of an IOMMU_INTERFACE_STATE_CHANGE, indicating the caller's wish to be notified of a change of a specific state field(s) or indicating to callback owners which states have changed.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_INTERFACE_STATE_CHANGE_FIELDS.DUMMYSTRUCTNAME
member.summary: various states of an IOMMU interface.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_INTERFACE_STATE_CHANGE_FIELDS.AsULONG
member.summary: The consolidated values of the fields in DUMMYSTRUCTNAME.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_INTERFACE_STATE_CHANGE_FIELDS_DUMMY
member.summary: A structure containing various states of an IOMMU interface.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_INTERFACE_STATE_CHANGE_FIELDS_DUMMY.AvailableDomainTypes
member.summary: When set to 1, this indicates that the caller wants to be notified (via the provided callback) when the available domain types change or this indicates to callback owners that the available domain types have changed.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_INTERFACE_STATE_CHANGE_FIELDS_DUMMY.Reserved
member.summary: Reserved for future fields. Currently unused.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_MAP_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_MAP_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS.MapType
member.summary: A IOMMU_MAP_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS_TYPE value that indicates the format the physical address is represented in.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_MAP_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS_UNION.Mdl
member.summary: If MapType == MapPhysicalAddressMdl, provides a MDL that represents the physical address.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_MAP_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS_UNION.ContiguousRange
member.summary: If MapType == MapPhysicalAddressContiguousRange, provides a contiguous physical address.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_MAP_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS_UNION.PfnArray
member.summary: If MapType == MapPhysicalAddressPfn, provides a PFN array.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_MAP_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS_MDL.Mdl
member.summary: The pointer to the MDL that represents the physical address.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_MAP_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS_RANGE.Base
