member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_MAP_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS_RANGE.Size
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of a contiguous physical address.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_MAP_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS_ARRAY.PageFrame
member.summary: The pointer to the PFN array.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IOMMU_MAP_PHYSICAL_ADDRESS_ARRAY.NumberOfPages
member.summary: The number of PFNs in the PFN array.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_CONNECT_INTERRUPT_PARAMETERS
member.summary: The IO_CONNECT_INTERRUPT_PARAMETERS structure contains the parameters that a driver supplies to the IoConnectInterruptEx routine to register an interrupt service routine (ISR). https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_io_connect_interrupt_parameters

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_DISCONNECT_INTERRUPT_PARAMETERS
member.summary: The IO_DISCONNECT_INTERRUPT_PARAMETERS structure describes the parameters when unregistering an interrupt-handling routine with IoDisconnectInterruptEx. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_io_disconnect_interrupt_parameters

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_ERROR_LOG_PACKET
member.summary: The IO_ERROR_LOG_PACKET structure serves as the header for an error log entry. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_io_error_log_packet

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_ERROR_LOG_PACKET.MajorFunctionCode
member.summary: Indicates the IRP_MJ_XXX major function code of the IRP the driver was handling when the error occurred. Setting this value is optional.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_ERROR_LOG_PACKET.RetryCount
member.summary: Indicates the number of times the driver has retried the operation and encountered this error. Use zero to indicate the driver attempted the operation once, or add one for each retry beyond the initial attempt.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_ERROR_LOG_PACKET.DumpDataSize
member.summary: Indicates the size, in bytes, of the variable-length DumpData member of this structure. The specified value must be a multiple of sizeof(ULONG).

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_ERROR_LOG_PACKET.NumberOfStrings
member.summary:
Indicates the number of insertion strings the driver will supply with this error log entry. Drivers set this value to zero for errors that need no insertion strings. The Event Viewer uses these strings to fill in the "%2" through "%n" entries in the string template for this error code.
The null-terminated Unicode strings themselves follow the IO_ERROR_LOG_PACKET structure in memory.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_ERROR_LOG_PACKET.StringOffset
member.summary: Indicates the offset, in bytes, from the beginning of the structure, at which any driver-supplied insertion string data begins. Normally this will be sizeof(IO_ERROR_LOG_PACKET) plus the value of the DumpDataSize member. If there are no driver-supplied insertion strings, StringOffset can be zero.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_ERROR_LOG_PACKET.EventCategory
member.summary: Specifies the event category for the error. A driver specifies the event categories it supports and corresponding descriptive strings in its message catalog. The Event Viewer displays the descriptive string as the Category value for the error.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_ERROR_LOG_PACKET.ErrorCode
member.summary: Specifies the type of error. The Event Viewer uses the error code to determine which string to display as the Description value for the error. The Event Viewer takes the string template for the error supplied in the driver's message catalog, replaces "%1" in the template with the name of the driver's device object, and replaces "%2" through "%n" with the insertion strings supplied with the error log entry.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_ERROR_LOG_PACKET.UniqueErrorValue
member.summary: A driver-specific value that indicates where the error was detected in the driver. Setting this value is optional.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_ERROR_LOG_PACKET.FinalStatus
member.summary: Specifies the NTSTATUS value to be returned for the operation that triggered the error. Setting this value is optional.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_ERROR_LOG_PACKET.SequenceNumber
member.summary: Specifies a driver-assigned sequence number for the current IRP, which should be constant for the life of a given request. Setting this value is optional.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_ERROR_LOG_PACKET.IoControlCode
member.summary: For an IRP_MJ_DEVICE_CONTROL or IRP_MJ_INTERNAL_DEVICE_CONTROL IRP, this member specifies the I/O control code for the request that trigged the error. Otherwise, this value is zero. Setting this value is optional.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_ERROR_LOG_PACKET.DeviceOffset
member.summary: Specifies the driver-specified offset into the device where the error occurred. Setting this value is optional.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_ERROR_LOG_PACKET.DumpData
member.summary: A variable-size array that can be used to store driver-specific binary data, such as register values or any other information useful in identifying the cause of the error. Drivers must specify the size, in bytes, of the array in the DumpDataSize member of this structure.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_INTERRUPT_MESSAGE_INFO
member.summary: The IO_INTERRUPT_MESSAGE_INFO structure describes the driver's message-signaled interrupts. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_io_interrupt_message_info

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_INTERRUPT_MESSAGE_INFO_ENTRY
member.summary: The IO_INTERRUPT_MESSAGE_INFO_ENTRY structure describes the properties of a single message-signaled interrupt. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_io_interrupt_message_info_entry

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_REPORT_INTERRUPT_ACTIVE_STATE_PARAMETERS
member.summary: The IO_DISCONNECT_INTERRUPT_PARAMETERS structure describes the parameters when unregistering an interrupt-handling routine with IoDisconnectInterruptEx. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_io_disconnect_interrupt_parameters

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR
member.summary: The IO_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR structure describes a range of raw hardware resources, of one type, that can be used by a device. An array of IO_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR structures is contained within each IO_RESOURCE_LIST structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_io_resource_descriptor

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR.Option
member.summary: Specifies whether this resource description is required, preferred, or alternative.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_RESOURCE_LIST
member.summary: The IO_RESOURCE_LIST structure describes a range of raw hardware resources, of various types, that can be used by a device. The resources specified represent a single, acceptable resource configuration for a device. An array of IO_RESOURCE_LIST structures is contained within each IO_RESOURCE_REQUIREMENTS_LIST structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_io_resource_list

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_RESOURCE_LIST.Version
member.summary: The version number of this structure. This value should be 1.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_RESOURCE_LIST.Revision
member.summary: The revision of this structure. This value should be 1.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_RESOURCE_LIST.Count
member.summary: The number of elements in the Descriptors array.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_RESOURCE_LIST.Descriptors
member.summary: The first element in an array of one or more IO_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR structures.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_RESOURCE_REQUIREMENTS_LIST
member.summary: The IO_RESOURCE_REQUIREMENTS_LIST structure describes sets of resource configurations that can be used by a device. Each configuration represents a range of raw resources, of various types, that can be used by a device. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_io_resource_requirements_list

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_SECURITY_CONTEXT
member.summary: The IO_SECURITY_CONTEXT structure represents the security context of an IRP_MJ_CREATE request. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_io_security_context

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_SECURITY_CONTEXT.SecurityQos
member.summary: Reserved for system use.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_SECURITY_CONTEXT.AccessState
member.summary: Reserved for use by file systems and file system filter drivers. This member is a pointer to an ACCESS_STATE structure that contains the object's subject context, granted access types, and remaining desired access types.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_SECURITY_CONTEXT.DesiredAccess
member.summary: An ACCESS_MASK value that expresses the access rights that are requested in the IRP_MJ_CREATE request.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_SECURITY_CONTEXT.FullCreateOptions
member.summary: Reserved for system use.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_SESSION_CONNECT_INFO
member.summary: The IO_SESSION_CONNECT_INFO structure provides information about a user session. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_io_session_connect_info

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_SESSION_CONNECT_INFO.SessionId
member.summary: Session ID. This member contains the Terminal Services session identifier of the user session for which the driver is receiving this notification.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_SESSION_CONNECT_INFO.LocalSession
member.summary: Indicates whether the user session is a local session or a remote session. If TRUE, the user is logged on locally. If FALSE, the user is logged on remotely.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_SESSION_STATE_INFORMATION
member.summary: The IO_SESSION_STATE_INFORMATION structure contains information about the state of a user session. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_io_session_state_information

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_SESSION_STATE_INFORMATION.SessionId
member.summary: The session ID. This member contains the Terminal Services session identifier of a user session. The IoGetContainerInformation routine sets this member to the session ID of the session that is represented by the session object that the ContainerObject parameter of IoGetContainerInformation points to.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_SESSION_STATE_INFORMATION.SessionState
member.summary: The current state of the user session that is identified by SessionId.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_SESSION_STATE_INFORMATION.LocalSession
member.summary: Indicates whether the user session identified by SessionId is a local session. If TRUE, the user is logged on locally. If FALSE, the user is logged on remotely. This member is valid only if the session is connected.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_SESSION_STATE_NOTIFICATION
member.summary: The IO_SESSION_STATE_NOTIFICATION structure contains information that a kernel-mode driver supplies to the IoRegisterContainerNotification routine when the driver registers to receive notifications of session events. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_io_session_state_notification

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_SESSION_STATE_NOTIFICATION.Size
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the IO_SESSION_STATE_NOTIFICATION structure.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_SESSION_STATE_NOTIFICATION.Flags
member.summary: No flags are currently defined for this member. Set to zero.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_SESSION_STATE_NOTIFICATION.IoObject
member.summary: A pointer to an I/O object owned by the driver. This member can point to a DEVICE_OBJECT, DRIVER_OBJECT, or FILE_OBJECT structure. The I/O object must remain valid for the lifetime of the registration. Before you delete a registered device object, unload a registered driver, or close a registered file object, call the IoUnregisterContainerNotification routine to cancel the registration. A driver can maintain simultaneous registrations for more than one I/O object, but it cannot create more than one active registration for the same I/O object.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_SESSION_STATE_NOTIFICATION.EventMask
member.summary: Mask bits for session events. These mask bits indicate the events for which the driver requests notifications.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_SESSION_STATE_NOTIFICATION.Context
member.summary: A pointer to a context buffer in which the driver can store its private data for a particular session notification registration.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_STACK_LOCATION
member.summary: The IO_STACK_LOCATION structure defines an I/O stack location, which is an entry in the I/O stack that is associated with each IRP. Each I/O stack location in an IRP has some common members and some request-type-specific members. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_io_stack_location

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_STATUS_BLOCK
member.summary: A driver sets an IRP's I/O status block to indicate the final status of an I/O request, before calling IoCompleteRequest for the IRP. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_io_status_block

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.IO_STATUS_BLOCK64
member.summary: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-io_status_block64

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KBDLLHOOKSTRUCT
member.summary: Contains information about a low-level keyboard input event. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-kbdllhookstruct

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KBDLLHOOKSTRUCT.vkCode
member.summary: A virtual-key code. The code must be a value in the range 1 to 254.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KBDLLHOOKSTRUCT.scanCode
member.summary: A hardware scan code for the key.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KBDLLHOOKSTRUCT.flags
member.summary: The extended-key flag, event-injected flags, context code, and transition-state flag.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KBDLLHOOKSTRUCT.time
member.summary: The time stamp for this message, equivalent to what GetMessageTime would return for this message.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KBDLLHOOKSTRUCT.dwExtraInfo
member.summary: Additional information associated with the message.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KBUGCHECK_ADD_PAGES
member.summary: The KBUGCHECK_ADD_PAGES structure describes one or more pages of driver-supplied data to be written by a KBUGCHECK_REASON_CALLBACK_ROUTINE callback function to the crash dump file. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_kbugcheck_add_pages

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KBUGCHECK_DUMP_IO
member.summary: The KBUGCHECK_DUMP_IO structure describes an I/O operation on the crash dump file. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_kbugcheck_dump_io

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KBUGCHECK_DUMP_IO.Offset
member.summary: Specifies the current offset in the crash dump file, or -1 if the crash dump file is being written sequentially.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KBUGCHECK_DUMP_IO.Buffer
member.summary: Pointer to a buffer that contains the current data to be written to the dump file.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KBUGCHECK_DUMP_IO.BufferLength
member.summary: Specifies the length of the buffer, in bytes, that is specified by the Buffer member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KBUGCHECK_DUMP_IO.Type
member.summary: Specifies the KBUGCHECK_DUMP_IO_TYPE value that signifies the type of data to be written to the dump file.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KBUGCHECK_SECONDARY_DUMP_DATA
member.summary: The KBUGCHECK_SECONDARY_DUMP_DATA structure describes a section of driver-supplied data to be written by KbCallbackSecondaryDumpData routine to the crash dump file. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_kbugcheck_secondary_dump_data

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KBUGCHECK_SECONDARY_DUMP_DATA.InBuffer
member.summary: Pointer to a buffer that is allocated by the system.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KBUGCHECK_SECONDARY_DUMP_DATA.InBufferLength
member.summary: Specifies the size of the buffer, in bytes, specified by the InBuffer member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KBUGCHECK_SECONDARY_DUMP_DATA.MaximumAllowed
member.summary: Specifies the maximum amount of data that the KbCallbackSecondaryDumpData routine can write to the crash dump file.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KBUGCHECK_SECONDARY_DUMP_DATA.Guid
member.summary: Specifies a GUID that identifies the driver's crash dump data. (Drivers must use unique GUIDs to mark their crash dump data. Use the GuidGen.exe tool to generate GUIDs for your driver. This tool is included in the Microsoft Windows SDK.)

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KBUGCHECK_SECONDARY_DUMP_DATA.OutBuffer
member.summary: Pointer to the buffer where the driver writes its crash dump data, or NULL.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KBUGCHECK_SECONDARY_DUMP_DATA.OutBufferLength
member.summary: Specifies the size of the buffer, in bytes, that was specified by the OutBuffer member.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KDPC_WATCHDOG_INFORMATION
member.summary: DPC = deferred procedure call The KDPC_WATCHDOG_INFORMATION structure holds time-out information about the current deferred procedure call (DPC). https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_kdpc_watchdog_information

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KDPC_WATCHDOG_INFORMATION.DpcTimeLimit
member.summary: Time limit for a single, current deferred procedure call. If DPC time-out has been disabled, this value is set to 0.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KDPC_WATCHDOG_INFORMATION.DpcTimeCount
member.summary: Time remaining for the current deferred procedure call, if DPC time-out has been enabled.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KDPC_WATCHDOG_INFORMATION.DpcWatchdogLimit
member.summary: Total time limit permitted for a sequence of deferred procedure calls. If DPC watchdog has been disabled, this value is set to zero.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KDPC_WATCHDOG_INFORMATION.DpcWatchdogCount
member.summary: Time value remaining for the current sequence of deferred procedure calls, if enabled.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KDPC_WATCHDOG_INFORMATION.Reserved
member.summary: Reserved for system use.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KERNEL_CET_CONTEXT
member.summary: Reserved for system use only. Do not use. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-kernel_cet_context

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KERNEL_SOFT_RESTART_NOTIFICATION
member.summary: Reserved for system use. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-kernel_soft_restart_notification

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_BASIC_INFORMATION
member.summary: The KEY_BASIC_INFORMATION structure defines a subset of the full information that is available for a registry key. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_key_basic_information

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_BASIC_INFORMATION.LastWriteTime
member.summary: The last time this key or any of its values changed. This time value is expressed in absolute system time format. Absolute system time is the number of 100-nanosecond intervals since the start of the year 1601 in the Gregorian calendar.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_BASIC_INFORMATION.TitleIndex
member.summary: Device and intermediate drivers should ignore this member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_BASIC_INFORMATION.NameLength
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the key name string in the Name array.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_BASIC_INFORMATION.Name
member.summary: An array of wide characters that contains the name of the registry key. This character string is not null-terminated. Only the first element in this array is included in the KEY_BASIC_INFORMATION structure definition. The storage for the remaining elements in the array immediately follows this element.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_FULL_INFORMATION
member.summary: The KEY_FULL_INFORMATION structure defines the information available for a registry key, including information about its subkeys and the maximum length for their names and value entries. This information can be used to size buffers to get the names of subkeys and their value entries. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_key_full_information

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_FULL_INFORMATION.ClassOffset
member.summary: The byte offset from the start of this structure to the Class member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_FULL_INFORMATION.ClassLength
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the key class name string in the Class array.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_FULL_INFORMATION.SubKeys
member.summary: The number of subkeys for this key.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_FULL_INFORMATION.MaxNameLen
member.summary: The maximum size, in bytes, of any name for a subkey.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_FULL_INFORMATION.MaxClassLen
member.summary: The maximum size, in bytes, of a class name.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_FULL_INFORMATION.Values
member.summary: The number of value entries for this key.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_FULL_INFORMATION.MaxValueNameLen
member.summary: The maximum size, in bytes, of a value entry name.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_FULL_INFORMATION.MaxValueDataLen
member.summary: The maximum size, in bytes, of a value entry data field.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_FULL_INFORMATION.Class
member.summary: An array of wide characters that contains the name of the class of the key. This character string is not null-terminated. Only the first element in this array is included in the KEY_FULL_INFORMATION structure definition. The storage for the remaining elements in the array immediately follows this element.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_NODE_INFORMATION
member.summary: The KEY_NODE_INFORMATION structure defines the basic information available for a registry (sub)key. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_key_node_information

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_NODE_INFORMATION.ClassOffset
member.summary: The byte offset from the start of this structure to the class name string, which is located in the Name array immediately following the key name string. Like the key name string, the class name string is not null-terminated.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_NODE_INFORMATION.ClassLength
member.summary: The size, in bytes, in the class name string.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_NODE_INFORMATION.NameLength
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the key name string contained in the Name array.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_NODE_INFORMATION.Name
member.summary: An array of wide characters that contains the name of the registry key. This character string is not null-terminated. Only the first element in this array is included in the KEY_NODE_INFORMATION structure definition. The storage for the remaining elements in the array immediately follows this element.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_VALUE_BASIC_INFORMATION
member.summary: The KEY_VALUE_BASIC_INFORMATION structure defines a subset of the full information available for a value entry of a registry key. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_key_value_basic_information

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_VALUE_BASIC_INFORMATION.TitleIndex
member.summary: Device and intermediate drivers should ignore this member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_VALUE_BASIC_INFORMATION.Type
member.summary: Specifies the system-defined type for the value entry in the registry key

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_VALUE_BASIC_INFORMATION.NameLength
member.summary: Specifies the size in bytes of the following value entry name.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_VALUE_BASIC_INFORMATION.Name
member.summary: A string of Unicode characters naming a value entry of the key.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_VALUE_ENTRY
member.summary: The KEY_VALUE_ENTRY structure is used by the REG_QUERY_MULTIPLE_VALUE_KEY_INFORMATION structure to describe a single value entry for a registry key. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_key_value_entry

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_VALUE_ENTRY.ValueName
member.summary: Pointer to a UNICODE_STRING structure that contains the name of the value entry.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_VALUE_ENTRY.DataLength
member.summary: Specifies the size, in bytes, of the data for the value entry.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_VALUE_ENTRY.DataOffset
member.summary: Specifies the offset, in bytes, of the value entry's data within the buffer that is pointed to by the ValueBuffer member of REG_QUERY_MULTIPLE_VALUE_KEY_INFORMATION.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_VALUE_ENTRY.Type
member.summary: Specifies the type of the value entry's data.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_VALUE_FULL_INFORMATION
member.summary: The KEY_VALUE_FULL_INFORMATION structure defines information available for a value entry of a registry key. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_key_value_full_information

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_VALUE_FULL_INFORMATION.TitleIndex
member.summary: Device and intermediate drivers should ignore this member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_VALUE_FULL_INFORMATION.Type
member.summary: Specifies the system-defined type for the registry value(s) following the Name member.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_VALUE_FULL_INFORMATION.DataOffset
member.summary: Specifies the offset from the start of this structure to the data immediately following the Name string.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_VALUE_FULL_INFORMATION.DataLength
member.summary: Specifies the number of bytes of registry information for the value entry identified by Name.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_VALUE_FULL_INFORMATION.NameLength
member.summary: Specifies the size in bytes of the following value entry name.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_VALUE_FULL_INFORMATION.Name
member.summary: A string of Unicode characters naming a value entry of the key.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.KEY_VALUE_PARTIAL_INFORMATION

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.OB_OPERATION_REGISTRATION.PostOperation

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.OPERATION_END_PARAMETERS.OperationId
member.summary: A identifier that corresponds to the operation having file access patterns recorded. The value should be unique for each operation that the developer intends to record.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.OPERATION_END_PARAMETERS.Flags
member.summary: The value of this parameter can include any combination of the following values. OPERATION_END_DISCARD 1 Specifies that the system should discard the information it has been tracking for this operation.Specify this flag when the operation either fails or does not follow the expected sequence of steps.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.OPERATION_START_PARAMETERS
member.summary: This structure is used by the OperationEnd function.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.OPERATION_START_PARAMETERS.Version
member.summary: This parameter should be initialized to the OPERATION_API_VERSION defined in the Windows SDK. OPERATION_API_VERSION 1 This API was introduced in Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012 as version 1.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.OPERATION_START_PARAMETERS.OperationId
member.summary: A identifier that corresponds to the operation having file access patterns recorded. The value should be unique for each operation that the developer intends to record.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.OPERATION_START_PARAMETERS.Flags
member.summary: The value of this parameter can include any combination of the following values. OPERATION_START_TRACE_CURRENT_THREAD 1 Specifies that the system should discard the information it has been tracking for this operation.Specify this flag when the operation either fails or does not follow the expected sequence of steps.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PAINTSTRUCT
member.summary: The PAINTSTRUCT structure contains information for an application. This information can be used to paint the client area of a window owned by that application. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-paintstruct

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PAINTSTRUCT.hdc
member.summary: A handle to the display DC to be used for painting.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PAINTSTRUCT.fErase
member.summary: Indicates whether the background must be erased. This value is nonzero if the application should erase the background. The application is responsible for erasing the background if a window class is created without a background brush. For more information, see the description of the hbrBackground member of the WNDCLASS structure.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PAINTSTRUCT.rcPaint
member.summary: A RECT structure that specifies the upper left and lower right corners of the rectangle in which the painting is requested, in device units relative to the upper-left corner of the client area.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PAINTSTRUCT.fRestore
member.summary: Reserved; used internally by the system.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PAINTSTRUCT.fIncUpdate
member.summary: Reserved; used internally by the system.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PAINTSTRUCT.rgbReserved
member.summary: Reserved; used internally by the system.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PCI_ATS_INTERFACE
member.summary: Defines the PCI_ATS_INTERFACE structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-pci_ats_interface

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PCI_COMMON_CONFIG
member.summary: The PCI_COMMON_CONFIG structure defines standard PCI configuration information returned by the HalGetBusData or HalGetBusDataByOffset routine for the input BusDataType PCIConfiguration, assuming the caller-allocated Buffer is of sufficient Length. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_pci_common_config

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PCI_MSIX_TABLE_CONFIG_INTERFACE
member.summary: The PCI_MSIX_TABLE_CONFIG_INTERFACE structure enables device drivers to modify their MSI-X interrupt settings. This structure describes the GUID_MSIX_TABLE_CONFIG_INTERFACE interface. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_pci_msix_table_config_interface

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PCI_SECURITY_INTERFACE2
member.summary: Defines the PCI_SECURITY_INTERFACE2 structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-pci_security_interface2

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PCI_SEGMENT_BUS_NUMBER
member.summary: Reserved for system use. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-pci_segment_bus_number

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PCI_SLOT_NUMBER
member.summary: The PCI_SLOT_NUMBER structure is obsolete. It defines the format of the Slot parameter to the obsolete HalXxxBusData routines when they are called with the BusDataType value PCIConfiguration. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_pci_slot_number

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PERFORMANCE_INFORMATION
member.summary: Contains performance information. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/psapi/ns-psapi-performance_information

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PERFORMANCE_INFORMATION.cb
member.summary: The size of this structure, in bytes.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PERFORMANCE_INFORMATION.CommitTotal
member.summary: The number of pages currently committed by the system. Note that committing pages (using VirtualAlloc with MEM_COMMIT) changes this value immediately; however, the physical memory is not charged until the pages are accessed.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PERFORMANCE_INFORMATION.CommitLimit
member.summary: The current maximum number of pages that can be committed by the system without extending the paging file(s). This number can change if memory is added or deleted, or if pagefiles have grown, shrunk, or been added. If the paging file can be extended, this is a soft limit.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PERFORMANCE_INFORMATION.CommitPeak
member.summary: The maximum number of pages that were simultaneously in the committed state since the last system reboot.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PERFORMANCE_INFORMATION.PhysicalTotal
member.summary: The amount of actual physical memory, in pages.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PERFORMANCE_INFORMATION.PhysicalAvailable
member.summary: The amount of physical memory currently available, in pages. This is the amount of physical memory that can be immediately reused without having to write its contents to disk first. It is the sum of the size of the standby, free, and zero lists.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PERFORMANCE_INFORMATION.SystemCache
member.summary: The amount of system cache memory, in pages. This is the size of the standby list plus the system working set.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PERFORMANCE_INFORMATION.KernelTotal
member.summary: The sum of the memory currently in the paged and nonpaged kernel pools, in pages.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PERFORMANCE_INFORMATION.KernelPaged
member.summary: The memory currently in the paged kernel pool, in pages.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PERFORMANCE_INFORMATION.KernelNonpaged
member.summary: The memory currently in the nonpaged kernel pool, in pages.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PERFORMANCE_INFORMATION.PageSize
member.summary: The size of a page, in bytes.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PERFORMANCE_INFORMATION.HandleCount
member.summary: The current number of open handles.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PERFORMANCE_INFORMATION.ProcessCount
member.summary: The current number of processes.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PERFORMANCE_INFORMATION.ThreadCount
member.summary: The current number of threads.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PHYSICAL_ADDRESS
member.summary: Union

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PLUGPLAY_NOTIFICATION_HEADER
member.summary: A PLUGPLAY_NOTIFICATION_HEADER structure is included at the beginning of each PnP notification structure, such as a DEVICE_INTERFACE_CHANGE_NOTIFICATION structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_plugplay_notification_header

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PLUGPLAY_NOTIFICATION_HEADER.Version
member.summary: Specifies the version of the data structure, currently set to 1.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PLUGPLAY_NOTIFICATION_HEADER.Size
member.summary: Specifies the size of the structure, in bytes.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PLUGPLAY_NOTIFICATION_HEADER.Event
member.summary: Specifies a GUID identifying the event.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PNP_BUS_INFORMATION
member.summary: The PNP_BUS_INFORMATION structure describes a bus. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_pnp_bus_information

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.POINT
member.summary: The POINT structure defines the x- and y-coordinates of a point. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/windef/ns-windef-point

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.POINT.x
member.summary: Specifies the x-coordinate of the point.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.POINT.y
member.summary: Specifies the y-coordinate of the point.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.POINTER_DEVICE_CURSOR_INFO

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.POINTER_DEVICE_CURSOR_INFO.cursorId
member.summary: The assigned cursor ID.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.POINTER_DEVICE_CURSOR_INFO.cursor
member.summary: The POINTER_DEVICE_CURSOR_TYPE that the ID is mapped to.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.POINTER_DEVICE_INFO
member.summary: Contains information about a pointer device. An array of these structures is returned from the GetPointerDevices function. A single structure is returned from a call to the GetPointerDevice function. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-pointer_device_info

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.POINTER_DEVICE_PROPERTY
member.summary: Contains pointer-based device properties (Human Interface Device (HID) global items that correspond to HID usages). https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-pointer_device_property

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.POINTER_TYPE_INFO
member.summary: Contains information about the pointer input type. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-pointer_type_info

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.POOL_CREATE_EXTENDED_PARAMS
member.summary: Defines the POOL_CREATE_EXTENDED_PARAMS structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-pool_create_extended_params

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.POOL_EXTENDED_PARAMS_SECURE_POOL
member.summary: Defines the POOL_EXTENDED_PARAMS_SECURE_POOL structure. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-pool_extended_params_secure_pool

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.POWER_PLATFORM_INFORMATION
member.summary: The POWER_PLATFORM_INFORMATION structure contains information about the power capabilities of the system.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.POWER_SESSION_ALLOW_EXTERNAL_DMA_DEVICES
member.summary: Reserved for system use.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.POWER_STATE
member.summary: The POWER_STATE union specifies a system power state value or a device power state value.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PO_FX_COMPONENT_IDLE_STATE
member.summary: The PO_FX_COMPONENT_IDLE_STATE structure specifies the attributes of an Fx power state of a component in a device. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_po_fx_component_idle_state

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PO_FX_COMPONENT_PERF_INFO
member.summary: The PO_FX_COMPONENT_PERF_INFO structure describes all the sets of performance states for a single component within a device. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_po_fx_component_perf_info

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PO_FX_COMPONENT_PERF_SET
member.summary: The PO_FX_COMPONENT_PERF_SET structure represents a set of performance states for a single component within a device. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_po_fx_component_perf_set

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PO_FX_COMPONENT_V1
member.summary: The PO_FX_COMPONENT structure describes the power state attributes of a component in a device. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_po_fx_component_v1

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PO_FX_COMPONENT_V2
member.summary: The PO_FX_COMPONENT structure describes the power state attributes of a component in a device. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_po_fx_component_v2

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PO_FX_DEVICE_V1
member.summary: The PO_FX_DEVICE structure describes the power attributes of a device to the power management framework (PoFx). https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_po_fx_device_v1

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PO_FX_DEVICE_V2
member.summary: The PO_FX_DEVICE structure describes the power attributes of a device to the power management framework (PoFx). https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_po_fx_device_v2

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PO_FX_PERF_STATE
member.summary: The PO_FX_PERF_STATE structure represents a performance state for a single component within a device. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_po_fx_perf_state

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESSOR_NUMBER
member.summary: The PROCESSOR_NUMBER structure identifies a processor by its group number and group-relative processor number. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/miniport/ns-miniport-_processor_number

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESSOR_NUMBER.Group
member.summary: The group number. If multiprocessor system contains n groups, the groups are numbered from 0 to n-1.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESSOR_NUMBER.Number
member.summary: The group-relative processor number. If a group contains m logical processors, the processors are numbered from 0 to m-1.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESSOR_NUMBER.Reserved
member.summary: Reserved for future use. Initialize to zero.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_INFORMATION
member.summary: Contains information about a newly created process and its primary thread. It is used with the CreateProcess, CreateProcessAsUser, CreateProcessWithLogonW, or CreateProcessWithTokenW function. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/processthreadsapi/ns-processthreadsapi-process_information

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_INFORMATION.hProcess
member.summary: A handle to the newly created process. The handle is used to specify the process in all functions that perform operations on the process object.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_INFORMATION.hThread
member.summary: A handle to the primary thread of the newly created process. The handle is used to specify the thread in all functions that perform operations on the thread object.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_INFORMATION.dwProcessId
F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_INFORMATION.dwThreadId
T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_LEAP_SECOND_INFO
member.summary: Specifies how the system handles positive leap seconds. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/processthreadsapi/ns-processthreadsapi-process_leap_second_info

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_LEAP_SECOND_INFO.Flags
member.summary: Currently, the only valid flag is PROCESS_LEAP_SECOND_INFO_FLAG_ENABLE_SIXTY_SECOND.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_LEAP_SECOND_INFO.Reserved
member.summary: Reserved for future use

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS.cb
member.summary: The size of the structure, in bytes.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS.PageFaultCount
member.summary: The number of page faults.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS.PeakWorkingSetSize
member.summary: The peak working set size, in bytes.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS.WorkingSetSize
member.summary: The current working set size, in bytes.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS.QuotaPeakPagedPoolUsage
member.summary: The peak paged pool usage, in bytes.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS.QuotaPagedPoolUsage
member.summary: The current paged pool usage, in bytes.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS.QuotaPeakNonPagedPoolUsage
member.summary: The peak nonpaged pool usage, in bytes.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS.QuotaNonPagedPoolUsage
member.summary: The current nonpaged pool usage, in bytes.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS.PagefileUsage
member.summary: The Commit Charge value in bytes for this process. Commit Charge is the total amount of memory that the memory manager has committed for a running process.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS.PeakPagefileUsage
member.summary: The peak value in bytes of the Commit Charge during the lifetime of this process.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS_EX
member.summary: Contains extended memory statistics for a process. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/psapi/ns-psapi-process_memory_counters_ex

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS_EX.PrivateUsage
member.summary: Same as PagefileUsage. The Commit Charge value in bytes for this process. Commit Charge is the total amount of private memory that the memory manager has committed for a running process.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_MEMORY_EXHAUSTION_INFO
member.summary: Allows applications to configure a process to terminate if an allocation fails to commit memory. This structure is used by the PROCESS_INFORMATION_CLASS class. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/processthreadsapi/ns-processthreadsapi-process_memory_exhaustion_info

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_MEMORY_EXHAUSTION_INFO.Version
member.summary: Version should be set to PME_CURRENT_VERSION.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_MEMORY_EXHAUSTION_INFO.Reserved
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_MEMORY_EXHAUSTION_INFO.Type
member.summary: Type of failure. Type should be set to PMETypeFailFastOnCommitFailure (this is the only type available).

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_MEMORY_EXHAUSTION_INFO.Value
member.summary: Used to turn the feature on or off.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_POWER_THROTTLING_STATE

This structure is used by the SetProcessInformation function. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/processthreadsapi/ns-processthreadsapi-process_power_throttling_state

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_POWER_THROTTLING_STATE.Version

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_POWER_THROTTLING_STATE.ControlMask
member.summary: This field enables the caller to take control of the power throttling mechanism.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_POWER_THROTTLING_STATE.StateMask
member.summary: Manages the power throttling mechanism on/off state.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.PROCESS_PROTECTION_LEVEL_INFORMATION
member.summary: Specifies whether Protected Process Light (PPL) is enabled. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/processthreadsapi/ns-processthreadsapi-process_protection_level_information

member.summary: A union that consists of either a Detailed structure or a string.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.REASON.Detailed
member.summary: A structure that identifies a localizable string resource to describe the reason for the power request.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.REASON.SimpleReasonString
member.summary: A non-localized string that describes the reason for the power request.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.REASON_CONTEXT.Version
member.summary: The version number of the structure. This parameter must be set to POWER_REQUEST_CONTEXT_VERSION.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.REASON_CONTEXT.Flags
member.summary: The format of the reason for the power request. This parameter can be one of the following values: POWER_REQUEST_CONTEXT_DETAILED_STRING 0x00000002 The Detailed structure identifies a localizable string resource that describes the reason for the power request. POWER_REQUEST_CONTEXT_SIMPLE_STRING 0x00000001 The SimpleReasonString parameter contains a simple, non-localizable string that describes the reason for the power request.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.REASON_CONTEXT.Reason
member.summary: A union that consists of either a Detailed structure or a string.

member.summary: The module that contains the string resource.

member.summary: The ID of the string resource.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.REASON_DETAILED.ReasonStringCount
member.summary: The number of strings in the ReasonStrings parameter.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.REASON_DETAILED.ReasonStrings
member.summary: An array of strings to be substituted in the string resource at run time.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES
member.summary: The SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure contains the security descriptor for an object and specifies whether the handle retrieved by specifying this structure is inheritable. This structure provides security settings for objects created by various functions, such as CreateFile, CreatePipe, CreateProcess, RegCreateKeyEx, or RegSaveKeyEx. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/windows/desktop/legacy/aa379560(v=vs.85)

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES.nLength
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of this structure. Set this value to the size of the SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES.lpSecurityDescriptor
member.summary: A pointer to a SECURITY_DESCRIPTOR structure that controls access to the object. If the value of this member is NULL, the object is assigned the default security descriptor associated with the access token of the calling process. This is not the same as granting access to everyone by assigning a NULL discretionary access control list (DACL). By default, the default DACL in the access token of a process allows access only to the user represented by the access token.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES.bInheritHandle
member.summary: A Boolean value that specifies whether the returned handle is inherited when a new process is created. If this member is TRUE, the new process inherits the handle.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.SECURITY_CAPABILITIES
member.summary: The SECURITY_CAPABILITIES structure defines the security capabilities of the app container. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-security_capabilities

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.SECURITY_DESCRIPTOR
member.summary: The SECURITY_DESCRIPTOR structure contains the security information associated with an object. Applications use this structure to set and query an object's security status. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-security_descriptor?redirectedfrom=MSDN

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.SID
member.summary: The security identifier (SID) structure is a variable-length structure used to uniquely identify users or groups. Applications should not modify a SID directly. To create and manipulate a security identifier, use the functions listed in the See Also section. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-sid

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.SID_AND_ATTRIBUTES
member.summary: The SID_AND_ATTRIBUTES structure represents a security identifier (SID) and its attributes. SIDs are used to uniquely identify users or groups. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-sid_and_attributes

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.SID_AND_ATTRIBUTES_HASH
member.summary: The SID_AND_ATTRIBUTES_HASH structure specifies a hash values for the specified array of security identifiers (SIDs). https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-sid_and_attributes_hash

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.SID_IDENTIFIER_AUTHORITY

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.SYSTEM_AUDIT_ACE
member.summary: The SYSTEM_AUDIT_ACE structure defines an access control entry (ACE) for the system access control list (SACL) that specifies what types of access cause system-level notifications. A system-audit ACE causes an audit message to be logged when a specified trustee attempts to gain access to an object. The trustee is identified by a security identifier (SID). https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-system_audit_ace

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.SYSTEM_POWER_STATE_CONTEXT_DUMMY.Reserved1
member.summary: Opaque member. Reserved for system use.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.SYSTEM_POWER_STATE_CONTEXT_DUMMY.TargetSystemState
member.summary: The target system power state of the previous system power IRP that the driver received. This member is set to a SYSTEM_POWER_STATE enumeration value. Drivers should treat this member as read-only.

member.name: P:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.SYSTEM_POWER_STATE_CONTEXT_DUMMY.EffectiveSystemState
member.summary: The effective previous system power state, as perceived by the user. This member is set to a SYSTEM_POWER_STATE enumeration value. Drivers should treat this member as read-only. This member value might not match the TargetSystemState member if, for example, the previous system power IRP indicated that the computer was about to enter hibernation, but a hybrid shutdown instead occurred to prepare the computer for a fast startup.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TITLEBARINFO
member.summary: Contains title bar information. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-titlebarinfo

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TITLEBARINFOEX
member.summary: Expands on the information described in the TITLEBARINFO structure by including the coordinates of each element of the title bar. This structure is sent with the WM_GETTITLEBARINFOEX message. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-titlebarinfoex

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOKEN_ACCESS_INFORMATION
member.summary: The TOKEN_ACCESS_INFORMATION structure specifies all the information in a token that is necessary to perform an access check. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-token_access_information

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOKEN_APPCONTAINER_INFORMATION
member.summary: The TOKEN_APPCONTAINER_INFORMATION structure specifies all the information in a token that is necessary for an app container. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-token_appcontainer_information

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOKEN_AUDIT_POLICY
member.summary: The TOKEN_AUDIT_POLICY structure specifies the per user audit policy for a token. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-token_audit_policy

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOKEN_CONTROL
member.summary: The TOKEN_CONTROL structure contains information that identifies an access token. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-token_control

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOKEN_DEFAULT_DACL
member.summary: The TOKEN_DEFAULT_DACL structure specifies a discretionary access control list (DACL). https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-token_default_dacl

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOKEN_DEVICE_CLAIMS
member.summary: The TOKEN_DEVICE_CLAIMS structure defines the device claims for the token. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-token_device_claims

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOKEN_ELEVATION
member.summary: The TOKEN_ELEVATION structure indicates whether a token has elevated privileges. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-token_elevation

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOKEN_GROUPS
member.summary: The TOKEN_GROUPS structure contains information about the group security identifiers (SIDs) in an access token. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-token_groups

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOKEN_GROUPS_AND_PRIVILEGES
member.summary: The TOKEN_GROUPS_AND_PRIVILEGES structure contains information about the group security identifiers (SIDs) and privileges in an access token. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-token_groups_and_privileges

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOKEN_LINKED_TOKEN
member.summary: The TOKEN_LINKED_TOKEN structure contains a handle to a token. This token is linked to the token being queried by the GetTokenInformation function or set by the SetTokenInformation function. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-token_linked_token

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOKEN_MANDATORY_LABEL
member.summary: The TOKEN_MANDATORY_LABEL structure specifies the mandatory integrity level for a token. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-token_mandatory_label

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOKEN_MANDATORY_POLICY
member.summary: The TOKEN_MANDATORY_POLICY structure specifies the mandatory integrity policy for a token. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-token_mandatory_policy

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOKEN_ORIGIN
member.summary: The TOKEN_ORIGIN structure contains information about the origin of the logon session. This structure is used by the GetTokenInformation function. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-token_origin

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOKEN_OWNER
member.summary: The TOKEN_OWNER structure contains the default owner security identifier (SID) that will be applied to newly created objects. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-token_owner

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOKEN_PRIMARY_GROUP
member.summary: The TOKEN_PRIMARY_GROUP structure specifies a group security identifier (SID) for an access token. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-token_primary_group

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOKEN_PRIVILEGES
member.summary: The TOKEN_PRIVILEGES structure contains information about a set of privileges for an access token. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-token_privileges

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOKEN_SOURCE
member.summary: The TOKEN_SOURCE structure identifies the source of an access token. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-token_source

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOKEN_STATISTICS
member.summary: The TOKEN_STATISTICS structure contains information about an access token. An application can retrieve this information by calling the GetTokenInformation function. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-token_statistics

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOKEN_USER
member.summary: The TOKEN_USER structure identifies the user associated with an access token. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-token_user

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOKEN_USER_CLAIMS
member.summary: The TOKEN_USER_CLAIMS structure defines the user claims for the token. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winnt/ns-winnt-token_user_claims

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOUCH_HIT_TESTING_INPUT
member.summary: Contains information about the touch contact area reported by the touch digitizer. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-touch_hit_testing_input

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TOUCH_HIT_TESTING_PROXIMITY_EVALUATION
member.summary: Contains the hit test score that indicates whether the object is the likely target of the touch contact area, relative to other objects that intersect the touch contact area. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-touch_hit_testing_proximity_evaluation

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRACE_ENABLE_INFO
member.summary: Defines the session and the information that the session used to enable the provider. This information is returned by EnumerateTraceGuidsEx as part of a TRACE_PROVIDER_INSTANCE_INFO block. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntrace/ns-evntrace-trace_enable_info

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRACE_GUID_INFO
member.summary: Returned by EnumerateTraceGuidsEx. Defines the header to the list of sessions that enabled a provider. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntrace/ns-evntrace-trace_guid_info

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRACE_GUID_PROPERTIES
member.summary: Returned by EnumerateTraceGuids. Contains information about an event trace provider. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntrace/ns-evntrace-trace_guid_properties

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRACE_GUID_REGISTRATION
member.summary: Used with RegisterTraceGuids to register event trace classes. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntrace/ns-evntrace-trace_guid_registration

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRACE_LOGFILE_HEADER
member.summary: The TRACE_LOGFILE_HEADER structure contains information about an event tracing session and its events. It is the raw data format of the trace information data in the header of an ETW log file. It is also a part of the information returned by OpenTrace and provided to the BufferCallback during trace processing. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntrace/ns-evntrace-trace_logfile_header

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRACE_PERIODIC_CAPTURE_STATE_INFO
member.summary: Used with TraceQueryInformation and TraceSetInformation to get or set information relating to a periodic capture state. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntrace/ns-evntrace-trace_periodic_capture_state_info

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRACE_PERIODIC_CAPTURE_STATE_INFO.CaptureStateFrequencyInSeconds
member.summary: The frequency of state captures in seconds.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRACE_PERIODIC_CAPTURE_STATE_INFO.ProviderCount
member.summary: The number of providers.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRACE_PERIODIC_CAPTURE_STATE_INFO.Reserved
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRACE_PROVIDER_INSTANCE_INFO
member.summary: Defines an instance of the provider GUID. This data is returned from EnumerateTraceGuidsEx when called with the TraceGuidQueryInfo information class. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntrace/ns-evntrace-trace_provider_instance_info

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRACE_PROVIDER_INSTANCE_INFO.NextOffset
member.summary: Offset, in bytes, from the beginning of this structure to the next TRACE_PROVIDER_INSTANCE_INFO structure. The value is zero if there is not another instance info block.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRACE_PROVIDER_INSTANCE_INFO.EnableCount
member.summary: Number of TRACE_ENABLE_INFO structures in this block. Each structure represents a session that enabled the provider.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRACE_PROVIDER_INSTANCE_INFO.Pid
member.summary: Process identifier of the process that registered the provider.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRACE_PROVIDER_INSTANCE_INFO.Flags
member.summary: Can be one of the following flags. TRACE_PROVIDER_FLAG_LEGACY: The provider used RegisterTraceGuids instead of EventRegister to register itself. TRACE_PROVIDER_FLAG_PRE_ENABLE: The provider is not registered; however, one or more sessions have enabled the provider.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRACE_VERSION_INFO
member.summary: Determines the version information of the trace processing API. This data is returned from TraceQueryInformation when called with the TraceVersionInfo information class. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/evntrace/ns-evntrace-trace_version_info

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRACE_VERSION_INFO.EtwTraceProcessingVersion
member.summary: The version of the trace processing API on the current system.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRACE_VERSION_INFO.Reserved
member.summary: Not used.

member.summary: The TRANSACTIONMANAGER_LOG_INFORMATION structure contains information about a transaction manager object.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRANSACTIONMANAGER_LOG_INFORMATION.LogIdentity

member.summary: The TRANSACTIONMANAGER_RECOVERY_INFORMATION structure contains information about a transaction manager object. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_transactionmanager_recovery_information

member.summary: The last log sequence number of the last log record that KTM obtained from CLFS during the most recent recovery operation.

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRANSACTION_BASIC_INFORMATION
member.summary: The TRANSACTION_BASIC_INFORMATION structure contains information about a transaction object. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/ddi/wdm/ns-wdm-_transaction_basic_information

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRANSACTION_BASIC_INFORMATION.TransactionId
member.summary: A GUID that KTM has assigned to the transaction object. This value is also known as the transaction's unit of work (UOW) identifier.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRANSACTION_BASIC_INFORMATION.State
member.summary: A TRANSACTION_STATE-typed value that specifies the transaction's current state.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRANSACTION_BASIC_INFORMATION.Outcome
member.summary: A TRANSACTION_OUTCOME-typed value that specifies the transaction's outcome (result).

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRANSACTION_ENLISTMENTS_INFORMATION

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRANSACTION_ENLISTMENTS_INFORMATION.NumberOfEnlistments
member.summary: The number of enlistments that are associated with a transaction object. This is also the number of elements in the array that the EnlistmentPair member specifies.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRANSACTION_ENLISTMENTS_INFORMATION.EnlistmentPair
member.summary: A caller-allocated array of TRANSACTION_ENLISTMENT_PAIR structures.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRANSACTION_ENLISTMENT_PAIR.EnlistmentId
member.summary: A GUID that KTM has assigned to the enlistment.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.TRANSACTION_ENLISTMENT_PAIR.ResourceManagerId
member.summary: A GUID that KTM has assigned to the resource manager that created the enlistment.

member.summary: The length, in bytes, of the string stored in Buffer.

member.summary: The length, in bytes, of Buffer.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.UNICODE_STRING.Buffer
member.summary: Pointer to a buffer used to contain a string of wide characters.

member.summary: Used by UpdateLayeredWindowIndirect to provide position, size, shape, content, and translucency information for a layered window. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-updatelayeredwindowinfo

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.USAGE_PROPERTIES

member.name: T:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.USEROBJECTFLAGS
member.summary: Contains information about a window station or desktop handle. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/ns-winuser-userobjectflags

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.USEROBJECTFLAGS.fInherit
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, new processes inherit the handle. Otherwise, the handle is not inherited.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.USEROBJECTFLAGS.fReserved
member.summary: Reserved for future use. This member must be FALSE.

member.name: F:Ban3.Infrastructures.NativeLibs.Structs.USEROBJECTFLAGS.dwFlags
member.summary:
For window stations, this member can contain the following window station attribute. WSF_VISIBLE=0x0001L Window station has visible display surfaces.
For desktops, the dwFlags member can contain the following value. DF_ALLOWOTHERACCOUNTHOOK=0x0001L Allows processes running in other accounts on the desktop to set hooks in this process.
